loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny es una mujer de 20 años soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en la parroquia rural de Pifo en Quito-Ecuador en una vivienda propia desde hace una año en el barrio “Amazonas”. Ella tiene estudios secundarios completos.
Hace dos años empezó su negocio de crianza de cerdos que aprendió de sus padres. Para ello arrienda una estructura metálica en la cual tiene a sus cerdos. Ella quiere un crédito para comprar balanceado y más cerdos; de esta manera ella ampliará su negocio mejorando sus ingresos y su calidad de vida. Este es su primer crédito con Fundación Alternativa.
En su vida uno de sus principales obstáculos es trabajar y estudiar al mismo tiempo porque ella trabaja sola y debe criar a su hijo, pero este es un esfuerzo necesario para su superación personal.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 20 year old single woman, and she has a son.  She lives in the rural parish of Pifo in Quito, Ecuador.  She has lived in her own house in the Amazonas neighborhood for one year.  She has a high school education.

Two years ago she started a business of raising pigs, which she learned from her parents.  In order to do this, she rents a metal structure where she keeps the pigs.

She wants the loan to buy balanced feed and more pigs.  That way she will expand her business, which will improve her income and her quality of life.  This is her first loan with the Fundación Alternativa.

One of the primary obstacles in her life is working and studying at the same time.  This is because she works alone, and she needs to take care of her child.  However, this is a necessary endeavor for her personal development.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and more pigs.

loans.name: Renacimiento Group

texts.en:
Patricia, Francisca and Adelis, all of whom reside in Danli, Honduras, formed the “Renacimiento” solidarity group in June, 2011. 

Patricia runs a small convenience shop and is requesting a loan of  5,000 HNL to purchase merchandise to sell. 

Francisca makes a living by selling clothing and shoes out of her home, and she is requesting a loan of 5,000 HNL to purchase more merchandise to sell. 

Adelis makes and sells fresh tortillas from her home, a business she has run for the past seven years. She is requesting a loan of  5,000 HNL for working capital.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell in her convenience shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make concrete blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.name: Adonaïm 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme Zenabo est la responsable du groupe ADONAÏM2.Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Le plus âgé a 5ans et le moins âgé a 3ans. Aucun ne va à l’école et elle a 2 personnes en charge.

Elle vend des condiments depuis 5ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de pissy en ville. Ses client sont les hommes et les femmes.

Mme veut acheter un sac d’oignon, un carton de patte de tomate, un plat de tomate fraiche, un demi plat de percile et de celerie, 2kg d’ail, un paquet de Maggi.

Elle prend soin de ses enfants avec ses bénéfices. Ses ambitions sont de scolariser ses enfants et d’agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Mrs. Zenabo is manager of the ADONAIM 2 group. She is married and mother of 2 children.  The oldest is 5 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. Neither attends school and she has two dependents. She has been selling condiments for 5 years.  She stocks up at the Pissy market in town.  Her customers are men and women.  She wants to buy a bag of onions, a carton of tomato paste, a plate of fresh tomatoes, a half-plate of parsley and celery, 2 kg of garlic, and one package of Maggi seasoning.  She takes care of her children with her profits.  Her goals are to put her children in school and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a bag of onions, a carton of tomato paste, a plate of fresh tomatoes, a half-plate of parsley and celery, 2 kg of garlic, one package of Maggi seasoning.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.fr:
Marié, 51ans d’âge, maman de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 13ans et 27ans, et ayant une personne à charge qui avec son CEP est devenue vendeuse de foufou en 1997 avec  un capital de 150.000 frs CFA.

Le marche qui est son le lieu d’activité est parmi le plus grand et le plus fréquenter de la capital.ses ventes varies entre 10000f et 20000f par jour.

Avec le second prêt actuel, elle veut acheter  6 sacs de foufou.

Comme une bonne maman, elle a un souci particulier pour ses enfants celui de les aider dans leurs entreprises pour ceux qui sont déjà indépendant et soutenir les plus jeune dans leurs cursus scolaire.
texts.en:
This woman is 51 years old, married, and has four children who are between the ages 13 and 27, and also has one additional person in her care. With her CEP (local community fund), she became a retailer of fufu (a staple food eaten in West and Central Africa) in 1997 with 150,000 FCFA worth of capital.

The market where she runs her business is among the largest and most-visited in the capital. Her sales vary from 10,000F to 20,000F per day.

With the current (her second) loan, she would like to buy 6 bags of fufu.

As a good mother, she takes special care of her children, including helping those who are already independent with their businesses, and providing for the education of the younger ones.

loans.use: To buy bags of fufu (a staple West and Central African food)

loans.name: Keilor Mauricio

texts.es:
Keilor Mauricio, tiene la edad de 20 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El con el dinero pretende realizar la compra de un caballo para el trasporte de café en la próxima cosecha. El cuenta con el lugar apto para tener el animal en buenas condiciones de vida y los implementos para su mantención. El quiere poder tener disponible un animal de este para el trasporte de fácil de sus cosechas. Una de sus metas es tener un fácil transporte de su café al recibidor.
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Keilor Mauricio, 20, is single living with his parents.  He intends to use the money to buy a horse to transport the coffee from his next harvest.  He has a place that’s suitable to keep the animal in good living conditions and the tools for its upkeep.  He wants to have an animal available for the easy transport of his harvests.  One of his goals is to have an easy way to transport his coffee to the receiver.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans from state banks.  FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a horse.

loans.name: Paula Isidora

texts.es:
Doña Paula es una mujer trabajadora, tiene dos trabajo, uno como conserje en una empresa privada, y venta de comida en la misma empresa teniendo el permiso para realizar sus ventas. y en su casa de habitacion su hermana le ayuda con el negocio de comida en el dia y en la noche,  ella cuando llega siga en  movimiento de venta ya que le ha ido muy bien con su negocio, el cual inicio con una pequeña pulperia que no cuenta ya. 
Paula se siente sastifecha ya que ha logrado salir adelante con sus tres hijos, los tres estudiantes, lograndolo junto a Afodenic el cual ha sido el medio para la inversion en su venta de comida.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo comprara una cocina industrial, otro exhibidor de comida, asi como la compra de platos, vasos, cucharas, tenedores, saleros, azucarera entre otros producto que ayude a realizar mejoras a su negocio.
texts.en:
Paula is a hard working woman.  She has two jobs: one as a caretaker at a private firm and another selling food at that same firm having permission to do so.  She also sells at home with help from her sister who helps her sell food day and night.  When she returns home sales continue.  She has done very well in business which she started with a small grocery store that she does not have any longer.

Paula feels satisfied that she’s managed to get ahead with her three children, all of them students.  She’s attained this with Afodenic which has been the means for her investment in food sales.

Today, with this new loan, she will buy an industrial stove, another food display case and she will also buy plates, glasses, spoons, forks, salt shakers, sugar dispensers, among other products that will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove, a display case for food, dishes, glasses, forks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.en: Maria lives in Danli, Honduras where she has operated a small convenience shop for the last 10 years. Due to the growth in business she now relies on her children for help around the store. Maria is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 with which to purchase merchandise  such as meats, cheeses, fruit, vegetables, snacks, milk, soft drinks, basic grains, cornmeal, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products.

loans.use: to purchase meats, cheeses, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena, tiene la edad de 25 años, está en unión libre y vive con su hijo y su esposo. Ella con el dinero realizara la compra de una vaca para la producción de leche. Ella cuenta con el terreno apto para el mantenimiento del animal y quiere poder producir leche para su hogar y aumentar la cantidad de animales a su poder. Ella lo que pretende es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y así poder tener un egreso menos con la leche que produce, y tener más ingresos con la venta de la leche sobrante. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María Elena, 25, is in a common law relationship and lives with her son and husband.  She will use the loan to buy a cow for milk production.  She has a piece of land that’s apt for keeping an animal and she wants to produce milk for her home and to increase the number of animals in her possession.  What she intends to do is improve the quality of life of her family and reduce her expenses with the milk she produces and increase income by selling the milk that’s left over.

This is the first loan she’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gueswendbala Tib Songdo Group

texts.fr:
Mme Pauline représente le groupe GUESWENDBALATIBSONGDO. Mariée, elle est mère de 5 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 1an.4 vont à l’école et elle a 2 personnes a sa charge.

Elle vend du savon liquide depuis 4ans et parallèlement des condiments. Mme s’approvisionne au marché de paglayiri en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.

Elle veut s’acheter 4kg de poudre de savon, 1kg de colorant et un demi-sac d’oignon.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle prend soin de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et s’occuper de ses enfants pour un meilleur avenir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pauline represents the  GUESWENDBALA TIB SONGDO group. She is married and the mother of 5 children. The oldest is 17 and youngest is 1. 4 go to school and she is responsible for 2 people. 

For the last 4 years she has been selling liquid soap, as well as condiments. Pauline obtains her supplies at the Paglayiri market in town. Her customers are both men and women. She wants to buy 4 kg of soap powder, 1 kg of colorant and a half-sack of onions. With her profits, she takes care of her children. Her ambition is to increase her business and take care of her children for a better future.

loans.use: to buy 4 kg of soap powder, 1 kg of colorant and a half-sack of onions.

loans.name: Patricia  Michelline

texts.fr:
Âgée de 36 ans, cette maman célibataire de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie de 07ans à 16ans est arrivée jusqu' en classe de 3em. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, elle tient une mini alimentation à son domicile avec un capital de 50.000frs en 2009.

Ses ventes sont comprise   entre 15000f et 20000f par jour les clients vienne jusqu’à une heure tardive pour acheter.

Avec le prêt, elle va acheter 1 bidon d’huile, 1 sac de riz, un carton de pax, un sachet de sel, des biscuits.
Soutenir ses enfants, construire sa  demeure est son souhait, et veut faire des bénéfices énormes aux travers cette activité pour aller de l’avant.
texts.en:
Aged 36, this single mother of two children (aged 7 and 16) completed her education all the way to the end of junior high school (equivalent to 9th grade). To provide for her family, she runs a small food shop at her home, with 50,000 F worth of capital in 2009.

Her sales run between 15,000 F and 20,000 F per day, and her customers frequent her shop through the late hours to buy her merchandise.

With this loan, she is going to buy 1 can of oil, 1 bag of rice, one box of Pax washing powder, a packet of salt, and biscuits.

She hopes to provide for her children and build her home, and wants to make large profits through this business in order to go forward.

loans.use: To buy cans of oil, rice, salt, and biscuits.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.en: Maria lives in Danli, Honduras where she makes a living by purchasing bulk quantities of milk and reselling it in smaller quantities throughout her community. She also makes and sells various types of cheeses that are made from the raw milk she purchases. Maria is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 to purchase bulk quantities of milk given that she is always able to resell whatever amount she purchases.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of milk.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro pequeño comerciante, con mas de once años, en las ventas, de pollo y carne de res, el cual lo hace en su casa de habitacion. Padre de tres hijos,  ambos cuidan de su familia, su esposa labora en servicios domesticos, logrando cubrir medicina y gastos basicos.
Don Alejandro le ha gustado el comercio, por tal razon inicio con poco y con el apoyo de sus padres, hoy en dia cuenta con su propio capital, el cual lo ha logrado con ganancia de las ventas y financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado en dos ciclos, lo que para el es de gran sastifaccion, al producir mas carne, mejores ventas. 
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara una vaca y un cerdo para la venta de carne. Sus planes a futuro es la compra de mas cerdo, lo que espera tener mas utilidades para dicha compra.
texts.en:
Alejandro has a small business with over eleven years experience selling chicken and beef, which he does from his home.  He is a father of three children.  Both he and his wife take care of his family; his wife works in domestic services, managing to cover medicine and basic expenses.

Don Alejandro liked business, accordingly he started with little and with the support of his parents, he now has his own capital.  He achieved this through profits from his sales, and from the financing that Afodenic has given him in two lending cycles.  This gives him great satisfaction, and allows him to produce more meat, and better sales.

With this new loan he will buy a cow and a pig to sell their meat.  His future plans are to buy more pigs, which he hopes to have more profits to purchase.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a pig to continue growing his meat selling business.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela María, tiene la edad de 27 años, está soltera y vive con sus padres. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de una vaca de leche. Ella cuenta con le área especial para el mantenimiento de este animal y poder satisfacer sus necesidades de alimentacion en buenas condiciones. Ella pretende tener ganancias de este nuevo proyecto y darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida. También lo que pretende es obtener de la vaca una cría y para su posterior venta y así tener mayores ganancias. 

Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gabriela María is 27 years old.  She’s single living with her parents.  She intends to use the loan to buy a dairy cow.  She has a special space where she can keep the animal, feed it and provide good living conditions.  She intends to earn profits from this new project and provide her family with a better standard of living.  She also intends to obtain a calf from the cow to sell subsequently thus earning higher profits.

This is the first loan she’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had any prior loans with state banks.  FUDECUSUR has offered a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Miriam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Miriam tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas, cosmeticos y ropa, el cual durante siete años ha venido trabajando en sus ventas. negocio que inicio con ahorros propios y el apoyo economico de su mama.
Miriam hoy cuenta con mucha clientela y vende productos Avon, vendiendo este productos por catalogos siendo el cincuenta por ciento en encargos y al credito de quincena. En donde ofrece, cremas de cuerpo, perfumes, desoarante, ropa, zapatos, toallas entre otros.
Sus ventas incrementaron al inducir mas mercaderia, el cual lo logro con financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado en doce ciclos. y que ha sido de gran sastifaccion ya que tiene que dar estudios  a sus tres hijos.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara: cosmeticos de la Avon y de la Zermat, ropa, zapatos de hombre y mujer.
texts.en:
Miriam has a small business where she sells tortillas, cosmetics and clothing. She has worked in sales at the business for seven years. The business was started with her own savings and economic support from her mother. 

Now Miriam has a large clientele and she sells Avon products. She sells the products through catalogs fifty percent of which are ordered on credit and are paid on a biweekly basis. She offers body lotions, perfumes, deodorants, clothing, shoes and towels among other things.

Her sales increased after she brought on more merchandise. She was able to do this through loans that Afodenic has granted including this twelfth one. This has been of great satisfaction for her as now she has to put her three children through school.

With this new loan she will purchase Avon and Zermat cosmetics, clothing and men’s and women’s shoes.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes and cosmetics to increase sales and fulfill her orders.

loans.name: Obreras De Nogales Group

texts.es: Esta foto fue tomada en la casa de la señora Patricia un integrante del grupo "Obreras de Nogales", que esta ubicado en el estado de Veracruz en México. Ella se dedica a la venta de calzado que inicio hace 7 años. Solicita el prestamo para invertiren la compra del calzado de diferentes tallas y modelos. Sus vecinos y compañeras de grupo la conocen como una persona trabajadora y muy entusiasta de buen caracter. Al momento de solicitar este prestamo se siente contenta por la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio. La señora Patricia tiene 43 años estudio, es casada y tiene en total 2 hijos un varon y una mujer. Con las ganancias quiere ahorrar una parte para la educación de sus hijos y apoyar a su marido en los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in the home of Señora Patricia, a member of the group "Obreras de Nogales" ("Workers of Nogales"), which is located in the state of Veracruz in Mexico.  She sells shoes, which she started doing 7 years ago.  She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of shoes in different sizes and models.  Her neighbors and companions in the group know her as a hard working and very enthusiastic person of good character.  At the moment of applying for this loan, she feels happy for the opportunity to invest in her business.  

Señora Patricia is 43 years old, is married and has a total of 2 children; a son and a daughter.  She wants to save some of her profits for the education of her children and to support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy shoes in different sizes and models.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis Ángel, tiene la edad de 40 años, está soltero y vive con 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de una maquina de soldar. El quiere realizar la compra de esta máquina para realizar trabajos en soldadura y darles un mejor acabado, para así poder ir generando más fuentes de empleo y mayor clientela. Es quiere generar los ingresos para su bienestar y la de su familia y a su vez tener un futuro cada día más seguro. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Ángel is 40 years old, single, and lives with his 2 children who are his biggest priority.  He intends to use his loan to buy a soldering machine.  He wants to buy this machine to complete soldering work and give them a nicer finish, so that he can create more streams of revenue and a better customer base.

He wants to generate income for the well-being of his family and to have a more stable future.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not previously had other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR granted him the loan with more ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy a soldering machine.

loans.name: Yorleni

texts.es: Doña Yorleni es una señora de 41 años, casada, tiene tres hijos. Humilde, trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación tanto personal como familiar. Ella vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos. Conoce de la Fundación por medio de su suegra que fue clienta años atrás. La señora se dedica al comercio de ventas por catálogo hace año y seis meses. Vió la necesidad de ayudar económicamente a su esposo, por lo que se afilió a dos casas comerciales de catálogos. Ella sale a vender y cobrar sin descuidar a su familia. Tiene el apoyo de una hija adolescente en los oficios domésticos y de su esposo para entregar y cobrar sus pedidos. Su meta es aumentar sus ventas para obtener más ingresos y ahorrar, y asi poder ayudar a su esposo a reparar su casa de habitación, ya que no está en las mejores condiciones por las inundaciones que han habido en los últimos años. Éste financiamiento me ayudará a crecer y superarme.
texts.en:
Yorleni is a 41-year old woman, married, and has three children.  She is humble, hard-working, and has a great desire to succeed both individually and as a family.  She lives with her husband and three children.  She knows Fundación through her mother-in-law who was a customer some years back.  She has dedicated herself to the commerce of sales by catalog for one year and six months.  She saw the need to help her husband out financially, which is why she affiliated herself with two commercial catalog houses.

She goes out to sell without neglecting her family.  She has the support of an adolescent daughter in the household tasks, and of her husband in delivering and charging for the orders.  Her goal is to augment her sales so she can increase her earnings and savings, and therefore be able to help her husband with some repairs to their home.  It is not in the best of condition due to the floods there have been in the past couple of years.  This financing will help me to grow and succeed.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of merchandise by catalogs.

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina

texts.en: Maria is a mother of two who lives in Choluteca, Honduras. For the last several years she has made a living by selling basic grains out of her home. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 with which to buy merchandise. In her free time, Maria enjoys attending church.

loans.use: to purchase cornmeal, flour, beans, rice, and corn.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco Tulio, tiene la edad de 66 años, está casado, vive con 2 hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la siembra de este cultivo al igual que la experiencia. El tiene la plantación ya en buenas condiciones pero quiere darle a su cafetal una asistencia extra para mejorar la cosecha próxima. El quiere generar las ganancia para su bienestar familiar  y tener un dinerito extra para  luego seguir asistiendo su cef y seguir adelante con su proyecto de caficultor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is 66 years old, married and lives with 2 children and his wife, who are his biggest priority.  He intends to use the loan to buy the supplies needed to help his coffee plantation.  He has land that is optimal for planting this crop, as well as the experience to do so.  He has the field already in good condition, but wants to give it some extra assistance to improve the next harvest.

He wants to generate profits for the well-being of his family, and to have a little money extra to later continue forward as a coffee grower.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not had previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted the loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy supplies to help his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Gbedokpo 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO 1 est composé de onze personnes qui habitent la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe du nom de Grâce est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Grâce est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin.  Grâce est mariée à un certain Ibrahim. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux sont les leurs. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Grâce mène comme activité depuis dix ans la vente des produits divers et des fournitures scolaires. Grâce s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Grâce sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO 1,  un premier crédit.
texts.en: The GBEDOKPO 1 group consists of 11 people who live in the same house.  This is the first time that this group has asked for financial aid from ALIDE, in order to increase their level of business.  The representative of the group is named Grace and she is the one with her hand raised in the photo.  Grace is 44 years old and lives in Benin.  Grace is married to Ibrahim.  The couple have three children, all in school, two of which are theirs.  The children live together with their parents.  To support herself and her children, Grace has been in business for the past 10 years selling various products and school supplies.  Grace stocks up at one of the largest markets in Benin. In the pursuit of customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues and her income, Grace is asking for, together with the other members of GBEDOKPO 1, a first loan.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and other products.

loans.name: Gbedokpo 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBEDOKPO 2 est composé de onze personnes qui habitent la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe du nom de Madeleine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Madeleine est âgée de 42 ans environs et vit au Bénin. Madeleine est mariée à un agent de la voirie du nom de Edgard. Le couple a quatre enfants tous à leur charge. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Madeleine n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Madeleine mène comme activité depuis sept ans la vente des légumes, des condiments de sauce et de maïs. Madeleine s’approvisionne dans l’un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires  et son revenu, Madeleine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDOKPO 2, un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The Gbedokpo 2 group is made up of eleven people who live in the same house. It's the first time that this group is seeking financial help from ALIDé, in order to grow their business.

The leader of the group is Madeleine, who is raising her hand in the photo. She is about 42 years old and lives in Benin. Madeleine is married to Edgard, a public roads agent. The couple has four dependent children, and some of the children are in school. Madeleine has never been to school.

In order to meet her and her children's needs, for seven years Madeleine has been selling vegetables, sauce ingredients, and corn. She gets her supplies in one of the biggest markets in Benin. 

In order to satisfy her clients and to increase her revenue and income, Madeleine is seeking, along with the other members of the Gbedokpo 2 group, her first loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn, vegetables, and sauce ingredients.

loans.name: Ingrid Lilibeth

texts.en: Ingrid is a single mother of one child who lives in Choluteca, Honduras. She makes a living by preparing and selling homemade tortillas out of her home. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 7,000 with which to purchase corn and firewood--two essential inputs for making fresh tortillas.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood.

loans.name: El Futuro Del Peru Group

texts.es: La Señora Asteria es socia de la Alcancía comunal “El Futuro de Perú”, tiene  46 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos menores. La socia se dedica a la Artesanía manual en Bordado de Fustanes (Tejidos Artesanales). Se levanta a tempranas horas de la mañana para que pueda bordar  fustanes para ello tiene que tener mucha dedicación, concentración, creatividad y arte. Ella las confecciona para los meses de Fiestas Patronales como Santiago (fiesta costumbrista  en la zona). Los Fustanes las venden en los meses de junio, julio y agosto ya que hay mucha demanda. La socia solicito el préstamo para comprar los materias primas como lanas, hilos y telas. Sus objetivos en el futuro es comprar maquinas industriales.La socia esta ubicada al centro del grupo con chompa color blanco y lila, detras de joven milber.
texts.en:
Señora Asteria is a member of the community bank '“El Futuro de Perú” ("The Future of Peru").  She is 46 years old and married with 3 young children. The member works in handicrafts, doing Fustanes Embroidery (traditional hand-woven fabrics).  She rises in the early hours of the morning so you can embroider the fabrics, as it takes a lot of dedication, concentration, creativity and art.  She makes apparel for the months of the Patron Festivals, such as Santiago (a festival held in the area).  The embroidered fabrics are sold in the months of June, July and August as demand is high.  

The member is requesting the loan to buy raw materials like wool, yarns and fabric.  Her future objective is to buy an industrial sewing machine.  The partner is located in the center of the group wearing a white sweater and lilac, behind the young man Milber.

loans.use: to make apparel and embroider fabric.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and five children in Choluteca, Honduras. 

He has made a living for the last seven years by selling basic grains out of his home. 

Juan is requesting a loan of HNL 8,000 to purchase bulk supplies of grains.

loans.use: to purchase bulk supplies of grains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items to increase profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an assortment of goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items to increase profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three baby calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and flowerpots  for rose sale

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es: La señora Otilia es socia D. la Alcancía Comunal “San Roque”, tiene 64 años D. edad, casada tiene  7 hijos. La socia se dedica a la Agricultura en la Venta D. Verduras, ella tiene su propio hectárea D. terreno para cultivar y cosechar las verduras como Lechuga, Nabo, Zanahoria, Cebollas, y otros para la venta en el mercado D. su localidad, también conjuntamente con su esposo e hijos cría animales menores como Cuy, Ternera, Cerdos, Gallinas, etc. El préstamo solicito es para comprar insumos como semillas para el cultivo D. verduras. Sus objetivos en el futuro es comprar maquinas agrícolas para el cultivo D. sus productos. Está ubicada en la izquierda segunda fila con polo blanco, chompa color plomo y guindo.
texts.en: Otilia is a member of the San Roque Communal Bank.  She is 64 years old, married, and has 7 children.  She farms and sells produce, and has her own hectare to grow and harvest produce such as lettuce, turnips, carrots, onions, and others, to sell in the market in her area.  Together with her husband and children, she raises small animals, such as guinea pigs, calves, pigs, chickens, etc.  She requested the loan to buy raw materials such as seed to grow her produce.  Her goal is to buy farm equipment to grow her products.  She is the first person on the second row, with a white polo shirt, and a gray and burgundy sweater.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria es una pequeña comerciante en la venta de ropa, cosmeticos y zapatos, negocio que adminstra desde hace trece años, comenzando con la venta de pollo, en donde le pagaban por comision, luego comienza ah vender bizuteria y sandalias, y una pequeña pulperia, es atraves de los años que nace su inversion con ganancias y prestamo que Afodenic  ha dado en doce ciclos.
Doña Gloria tiene su local aparte en su casa para su negocio, ha captado clientela por ser a precios accesibles la venta de ropa, en toda variedad y tamaño vende la ropa, asi como los zapatos.
Con este nuevo financiamiento sera para la compra de pantolones de varon  mujer y niños, camisas, camisetas, blusas, trajes de señora, perfumes, vanidad, pintura de labios, pañales, chaqueta azulona, entre otros que ayude a incrementar las ventas. con el objetivo de seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria has a small business selling clothing, cosmetics, and shoes, which she has managed for thirteen years.  She started by selling chicken, where she was paid by contract, and then she began selling costume jewelry and sandals, and a small general store.  Through the years she has re-invested, using her profits, and loans provided by Afodenic over twelve cycles.
Gloria has her business in a separate section of her home, and has built her customer base by having reasonable prices for clothes, which she offers in a wide variety and sizes, and likewise for shoes.
This additional financing will be to purchase men’s, women’s, and children’s pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, ladies’ outfits, perfumes, beauty products, lipsticks, diapers, “chaqueta azulona” (blue jackets made of various fabrics), and other items, to increase her sales, with the goal of continuing to support her family.

loans.use: invest more in clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and enjoy increased sales and profits.

loans.name: Modesto Eulalio

texts.es:
Modesto es de la comunidad de Brasilia, caracterizado en la zona por ser un hombre emprendedor.

El esta solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000, con el fin de brindar mayor variedad de productos para su pulpería, la cual fundo desde el ano 1998, para mejorar los ingresos económicos de su nucleo familiar, ya que es la única entreda que tiene. 

El es un comerciante de la zona de Alajuela y es socio de la Empresa de Credito Comunal de Brasilia.
texts.en:
Modesto is from the community of Brasilia. He is known in the area for being an enterprising man.

He is requesting a loan for 500,000 colones, with the aim of offering a greater variety of products in his general store. He has operated the store since 1998 to increase the economic resources of his family unit, since it is the only source of income he has. 

He is a merchant in the Alajuela zone and is a member of the Brasilia communal bank.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his general store.

loans.name: Angelica Carolina

texts.es:
ANGELA CAROLINA:
La señora Angela Carolina se dedica a la venta D. pollo desD. hace 18 años  tiene una hija  es viuda  y  venD. en un pueblo cercano a su casa    y ahora necesita otro crédito para seguir  ofreciendo a su clientela   los pollos   destazados  y así mismo  poder crecer en sus ganancias  como  el pollo es un alimento básico y lo consumen siempre las personas   así mismo su venta crece un poco mas  y  donD. ella venD. es  una colonia    llamada Villas del Quetzal  los sábados tiene más demanda D. su venta porque los días domingos ella descansa y no muchas personas que vendan pollo y que sea fresco  en el tiempo que ella trabajo su crédito no tuvo ningún  problema   su más granD. deseo es poder  seguir  ofreciendo mas  y poder tener una persona que le ayuD. a vender  en otro lugar y generar más ganancias  como también poder seguir dándole lo  necesario  a su hija.
texts.en:
Angela Carolina has been selling chicken for 18 years.  She has a daughter.  She is a widow, and she sells in a town that is close to her house.

She needs another loan in order to continue selling butchered chicken to her customers.  Similarly, she wants to be able to have her income grow.  Chicken is a basic food that it is always consumed; and her sales grow a bit more.  There is more demand for her Saturday sales at the Villas del Quetzal neighborhood because on Sundays she rests.  

During the time that she works there are not many people who sell chicken that is fresh.  There were no problems with the loan.  Her biggest wish is to be able to keep selling more and to be able to have a person help her sell in another location.  This will generate more income, and she would also be able to continue giving her daughter the necessities.

loans.use: to buy chicken to butcher.

loans.name: Adelita De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Adelita es una ama de casa, gran una mujer, madre soltera y muy emprendera.  

Ella necesita un préstamo de ₡500.00, para llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su casa, construyendo y añadiendo a su vivienda un cuarto de pila, para lo cual necesitara comprar zinc, cemento, arena y clavos, entre otras cosas.

Ella pertenece a la Empresa de Credito Comunal de Brasilia.
texts.en:
Adelita is a home maker, a single mother and a great and very enterprising woman.  

Adelita needs a loan of ₡500.00 (USD $1025) to carry out an improvement on her house.  She wants to add a laundry room on to her house.  She will need buy zinc, cement, sand and nails, among other items.

Adelita belongs to the communal bank "la Empresa de Credito Comunal de Brasilia" (The Communal Credit Company of Brasilia).

loans.use: to build a laundry room.

loans.name: Angelica Amparo

texts.es:
ANGELICA AMPARO 
La señora  Angélica  se dedica a la venta D. pollo destazado en  la  Ciudad Quetzal   D. ambulante   desD. hace 15años   tiene 4 hijos menores D. edad  necesita otro crédito para incrementar las ventas   D. pollo  ya que ahora  también venD. en su casa por las tardes  para poder incrementar  sus ganancias   y  así mismo para poder hacer los pagos correspondientes    ahora su capital    es muy poco para poder seguir vendiendo por las tardes , su deseo ahora  es poder comprar más pollos por día para poder entregar algunos pedidos que le hacen cuando hay días festivos  en la aldea donD. ella vive, y agradece a Fape por seguir confiando en ella y en su venta .
texts.en:
Angélica has been selling butchered chicken in an itinerant manner in Ciudad Quetzal for 15 years.  She has four minor children.

She needs another loan to increase her chicken sales.  This is because she now also sells at her house in the afternoons in order to be able to increase her income and to make the respective payments.  She currently has very little money in order to keep selling in the afternoons.

Her current wish is to be able to buy more chickens per day.  She wants more chickens in order to be able to deliver some orders that she has for festival days in the village where she lives.  She is grateful to Fape for continuing to have faith in her and her sales business.

loans.use: to buy chicken to butcher.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
ISABEL 
La señora Isabel  su negocio   es una tienda que tiene ubicada en su casa ella ya solo tiene una hija que depende de ella,  necesita otro crédito para tener más variedad   de productos  comestibles de consumo diario  ya que por tener otro tipo de productos muchas personas llegan a buscarla  en su casa para comprar a altas horas de  la noche, durante el tiempo que ella a trabajado con el crédito no ha tenido  más bien a incrementado sus ventas  a comparación de las otras tiendas que ella tiene por donde vive su mayor deseo es poder acomodar y surtir su tienda como tal vez colocando cosas de plásticos  que algunas personas necesitan y llegan a pedirle, y de ahí ayudarse  para seguir dándole estudios a su hija menor
texts.en:
Isabel’s business is a store in her house.  She now only has one daughter that is dependent upon her.

She needs another loan in order to have a greater variety of daily consumption food products.  She wants to have other types of products.  A lot of people come looking for her at her house late at night in order to make purchases.  

During the time she has worked with the loan she has not had any problems.  She has increased her sales in comparison to the other stores where she lives.  Her greatest wish is to be able to adapt and stock her store.  Perhaps she will carry plastic items that some people need and come to ask for.  This will help her continue to give her youngest daughter an education.

loans.use: to buy daily consumption food products.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es: José Gabriel tiene 59 años, el ha sabido ganarse la vida por lo que su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de soldador. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que cuando el inicio fue desde muy joven que empezó en un taller y decide establecer su propio negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de estaño, soldador eléctrico, soplete con cartuchos y otros. Su deseo es tener su propio lugar de trabajo.
texts.en: José Gabriel is 59 years old.  He has learned to make a living by offering his services as a welder.  He has been making his living in this business for more than 22 years.  When he first started, he was very young and worked in a workshop.  He has decided to set up his own business.  The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of solder, an electric soldering iron, a gas welding torch with cartridges and other items.  José Gabriel's wish is to have his own work place.

loans.use: to purchase a solder, an electric soldering iron, a gas welding torch with cartridges and other items.

loans.name: Fanny Fabiana

texts.es:
La Señora. Fanny es socia del banco comunal Rosas Rojas, vive en la comunidad de La Estancia que pertenece al cantón Paute, este  cantón  es de clima templado propicio para el cultivo de una gran variedad de frutas y también para el cultivo de flores, su gente se dedica al comercio y también se dedican a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
La Señora. Fanny tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años de edad. Con su trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
En su casa se dedica a la cría de animales, cría pollos y esta actividad la realiza hace un año, los vende en su comunidad vivos o pelados. También se dedica a la cría de ganado y la leche que obtiene la vende.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su séptimo crédito y los préstamos le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio, el dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio de pollos.
texts.en:
Señora Fanny is a member of the communal bank "Rosas Rojas" (Red Roses).  She lives in the community of La Estancia, which belongs to Paute Canton.  The canton has a temperate climate, which is favorable for growing a large variety of fruits and also flowers.  The people make their livings in businesses and also by raising animals and in agriculture.
 
Señora Fanny is 33 years old and a single mother of a 3 year old son.  Through her hard work and sacrifices, she has been able to build her own home.
 
Señora Fanny raises animals in her home.  She has been raising chickens for one year.  She sells them, live or plucked, in her community.  She also makes her living raising livestock, and she sells the milk she gets from them.
 
Señora Fanny is in her seventh loan with the communal bank.  The loans have benefited her by allowing her to grow her business.  The money from the new loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed.
 
Señora Fanny's goal is to grow her chicken business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ermisenda Del Carmen

texts.en: Ermisenda lives in Danli, Honduras where she has operated a small convenience shop for the last 18 years. She has managed to grow her business over time and now employs two individuals to help at the store. Nonetheless, she is in need of a Lps. 20,000 loan to purchase additional merchandise such as: meats, cheeses, fruit, vegetables, snacks, milk, soft drinks, basic grains, cornmeal, salt, butter, cooking oil, basic household cleaning products, and personal hygiene products.

loans.use: to purchase meats, cheeses, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es socia del banco comunal Rosas Rojas, es oriunda del cantón Paute pero vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica y natural,  por su variada gastronomía y la calidez de su gente.

Doña Rosa tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 28, 26, 23 y 22 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan solo para sus gastos personales, su tercera hija es casada e independiente y su último hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo es operador de maquinaria pesada, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Rosa  se dedica al comercio vende todo tipo de ropa, esta actividad la desempeña  hace un año y trabaja en sus ventas los días domingos todo el día. Los demás días se dedica la cría de cuyes.

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para surtir su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener un local para vender su mercadería.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa is a member of the communal bank "Rosas Rojas" (Red Roses).  She is originally from Paute Canton but currently lives in the city of Cuenca.  The city is known for its architectural and natural beauty, its varied gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Doña Rosa is 43 years old, married and has 4 children ages 28, 26, 23 and 22 years old.  Her first two children work to support themselves, her third is married and lives independently, and her youngest attends a school in the city.  Doña Rosa's husband is a heavy machinery operator.  Through their hard work, she and her husband have been able to build their own home.
 
Doña Rosa makes her living in the clothing business.  She sells all types of clothing.  She started this business one year ago.  Her merchandise is available for sale all day long on Sundays.  On the other days of the week, she dedicates her time to raising guinea pigs.  

This is Doña Rosa's third loan, and she is going to invest in the purchase of pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing to stock up her business.
 
Doña Rosa's goal is to have a small store in which to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería hace mas de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. No es el primer crédito que tiene con Fundación León 2000 ya que sabe que por medio de los diferentes créditos ha logrado salir adelante porque son necesarios para que los negocio crezcan. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y comprar granos básicos, detergentes, sopas, enlatados y papel higiénico.
texts.en: Maria Auxiliadora is 28 years old.  Her business is a general store.  She has made her living with this business for more than 7 years.  This is not her first loan with Fundación León 2000.  She has been able to get ahead through the different loans she has been given.  She knows that the loans are necessary for businesses to grow.  This loan is for working capital and to purchase basic grains, detergents, soups, canned goods and toilet paper.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, detergents, soups, canned goods and toilet paper.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Rosas Rojas, vive en la comunidad de La Estancia que  pertenece al cantón Paute, este cantón  es de clima templado propicio para el cultivo de una gran variedad de frutas y de flores, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Doña María tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 27, 20, 16 y 9 años de edad, su primera hija es casada e independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su tercera hija estudia en el colegio y su último hijo en una escuelita del cantón. Con su sacrificio ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas las mismas que vende en su comunidad. Cría ganado, cuyes y gallinas y también las que vende en su comunidad.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes, ganado y  alimento de animales.

Su meta es tener más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Rosas Rojas ["Red Roses"] communal bank. She lives in the community of La Estancia, in the canton of Paute. This canton has a temperate climate which is well-suited for growing a great variety of fruits and flowers. Its inhabitants work in commerce, animal raising and agriculture. 

María is 47 years old and a single mother, with 4 children aged 27, 20, 16 and 9. Her oldest child, a daughter, is married and independent; her second child, a son, works and helps her economically; her third child, a daughter, is in secondary school; and her youngest, a son, attends a primary school in the canton. Thanks to her sacrifices, she has been able to build a house of her own. 
 
María works in agriculture. She grows vegetables, which she sells in her community. She also raises livestock, guinea pigs and chickens, which she likewise sells in her community. 

She is currently in her third loan cycle with her communal bank, and she will invest this loan in buying chickens, guinea pigs, livestock and animal feed. 

Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs, livestock and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nail polish, lipstick, vanity items and underwear.

loans.name: Gladys Maria

texts.es: Gladys Maria es una Madre de familia que tiene 44 años y vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Se dedica desde hace más de 10 años a ofrecer el servicio de fotocopiadora,  la ubicación del negocio es enfrente de la policía, ya que en ese sector no había este servicio, fue así que decide incursionar en este negocio.  Desea ampliar su negocio para captar más clientes y así poder percibir más ingresos que le permitan salir adelante. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de hojas, tinta y poder comprar otra fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Gladys Maria is a 44-year-old mother who lives together with her husband and her three minor children under her care. 

She has made a living for more than 10 years offering photocopying services. The business is located in front of the police. As this area did not have this service before, she decided to start this business. 

She hopes to expand her business to acquire more customers and therefore be able to receive a better income that will allow her to get ahead. This is why she is requesting this loan to purchase paper and ink and to be able to buy another photocopier.

loans.use: to purchase paper and ink and be able to buy another photocopier.

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Dolores Del Socorro se dedica a la venta de ropa en sus 9 años, siempre ha sabido trabajar y mantenerse muy independiente, el negocio fue iniciativa propia ella con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, pues su Madre le ha enseñado a ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. La inversión del préstamo será para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, y ropa interior.
texts.en: Señora Dolores Del Socorro has been selling clothes for 9 years, she has always known how to work and to to keep herself independent.  The business was her own initiative, and with much effort and sacrifice she has managed to get ahead, because her mother taught her to live her life in the most humble way. The investment of the loan will be for the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and underwear.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and underwear.

loans.name: Hubert

texts.es:
Hubert es de la zona rural de San Francisco, La Palmera.
El necesita un préstamo por el monto de ₡500.000, esta cantidad para lograr reparar su cochera, ya que la tiene en muy mal estado, y como parte de su casita desea que se vea mejor.
El pertenece a la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Francisco.
texts.en:
Hubert is from the rural area of ​​San Francisco in La Palmera.

He needs a loan in the amount of ₡500.  This amount is for him to be able to repair his garage, as it is in bad shape.  As it is part of his house, he wants it to look better.

He belongs to the Communal Loan Company of San Francisco.

loans.use: to repair his garage.

loans.name: Reina Maria

texts.es: Reina Maria se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inicio a este negocio desde hace 5 años esto fue con el propósito de obtener una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos. Ella siempre ha sido una Madre muy abnegada y responsable. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecer un buen servicio y además le gusta interactuar con sus clientes, ya que es su medio de vida. El crédito es para la compra de materia necesaria como perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, pintura de uñas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Reina Maria makes a living selling cosmetics. She began this business five years ago with the idea of acquiring a source of income to support her children. She has always been a very selfless and responsible mother. 

She has always been characterized by her good service and she likes to interact with her customers as it is her livelihood. This loan is for the purchase of necessary materials like perfumes, creams, treatments and nail polish among other things

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, treatments and nail polish, among other things.

loans.name: Wilmor Javier

texts.es: Wilmor Javier tiene 29 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que tiene este negocio por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que se han enfermado últimamente, pues él ha tenido que gastar en medicamentos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio ya que es de este negocio de lo que vive. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima golosinas, refrescos, pan, granos baciscos.
texts.en:
Wilmor Javier is 29 years old, his business is a general store.  He started this business more than 6 years ago, as his beginnings were very difficult.  He has 2 young children who have been sick lately, so he has had to spend on medicines.  With much effort he has managed to improve his business as it is the business on which he lives. 

The funding requested is for the purchase of goods such as candy, soda, bread, and basic grains.

loans.use: to buy goods such as candy, soda, bread, and basic grains.

loans.name: Yesenia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Yesenia De Los Ángeles tiene 27 años,  su negocio es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que tiene este negocio. Ella es una madre responsable y emprendedora tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, pero todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para salir a ofrecer sus productos. Ella tiene una gran variedad de clientes pues siempre sale a vender sus diferentes productos a sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Ella necesita este financiamiento para la compra de pintura de labios, pintura de uñas, perfumes, cremas y tratamientos pues hasta los momentos tiene bastante pedidos que le han solicitado.
texts.en: Yesenia De Los Ángeles is 27 years old, and her business is selling cosmetics.  She has had this business for more than 5 years. She is a responsible and enterprising mother who has 2 young children in her care, but every day she needs to get up early to go out and offer her products for sale.  She has a wide variety of customers so she always goes out to sell different products to her neighbors, friends and family.  She needs this funding to purchase lipstick, nail polish, perfumes, creams and treatments, as to this point she has received enough orders that have asked for these.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, nail polish, perfumes, creams and treatments.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
En el Municipio de El Sauce, departamento de león, el señor Luis A. se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y a logrado mantener en buenas condiciones su actividad ganadera. El se caracteriza por ser un excelente trabajador y con buenos valores Cívicos ha hecho que se gane el Respeto de muchas personas. 
 Actual mente a acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mantenimiento y reparación de su finca ya que cuenta con una propiedad de 90 manzanas de terreno, un buen inventario ganadero que le genera sus ingresos, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la chapia de potrero, para el repasto de su finca y pago de mano de obra para la mejora de su familia, con esto le brindara un mayor servicio y mejorara las condiciones de su propiedad.
texts.en:
In El Sauce, León, Luis A. is well-known as a hard worker on his cattle farm. He is well-respected in the community for his community values. 
He seeks a loan from Ceprodel El Sauce, to maintain and carry out repairs to his farm, which is 90 manzanas in size, supporting many head of cattle, his main source of income.  With this credit, Luis plans to repair the well and improve conditions on his grazing land, in order to better the conditions of his herd and farm.

loans.use: to maintain farm

loans.name: Gerónima

texts.es:
En el Municipio de El Sauce, departamento de león, el señora Gerónimo se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajador debido a que ha sabido llevar el bien estar de su casa y a logrado mantener a su familia que tanto ama y estima. Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente trabajadora y con buenos valores Cívicos ha hecho que se gane el Respeto de muchas personas de su lugar.  
 Actual mente a acudido a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejora de su negocio, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para aumentar el Capital de trabajo y abastecer todos sus cliente con este negocio, tales como: Venta de Pescado, Leche y cuajada, con esto le brindara un mayor servicio a los cliente y mejorara las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
In the town of El Sauce, in León department, Gerónimo is noted as being a very hard-working woman who has known how to look after the well-being of her household and support her family that she loves and is very fond of.  She is noted as being an excellent worker who has good civic values.  This has gained her the respect of many people in her area.

Gerónimo has come to Ceprodel El Sauce to request a loan with which to improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to increase her working capibal so that she can supply all her customers through her business with products such as fish, milk and 'cuajada' (milk curd).  This will enable her to provide her customers with a better service and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 'leche cuajada' (milk curd) and fish to sell

loans.name: Justo Antonio

texts.es: Justo Antonio tiene 29 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería, inicio con muy pocos productos a pesar de no tener mucho que ofrecer a sus clientes no ha desistido con seguir adelante con este negocio, el tuvo mucha paciencia pues logro aumentar sus productos y obtener la pulpería en su vivienda, lo más difícil para él es proporcionarle a sus clientes todos los productos que le solicitan. El financiamiento que está solicitando es para la compra de grano básicos, gaseosas, jugos, pan, y un poco de ropa para niños pues sus clientes compran sus productos por los ofrece manera favorable. El sueño de este hombre es que su negocio se mantenga.
texts.en:
Justo Antonio is 29 years old and his business is a grocery store.  He started out selling just a few products.  Although he didn't have much to offer his customers, he didn't give up on getting ahead in his business.  He had a lot of patience and managed to increase the number of products that he sold.  His store is located in his home and his most difficult task is providing his customers with all the products that they request.

Justo Antonio is requesting this loan to buy basic grains, soda, juice, bread and a few items of children's clothing.  Justo Antonio's dream is to keep his business going.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soda, juice, bread and a few items of children's clothing

loans.name: Maximiliano Pablo

texts.es: Maximiliano Pablo tiene 63 años.  Su actividad económica que es L. venta productos lácteos. Hace más D. 25 años que se dedica a este negocio. El dio inicio porque desD. muy joven trabaja en empresas privadas y tenía el conocimiento D. esta actividad fue así que deciD. establece su negocio. Su desafío ha sido problemas D. salud pues algunas veces el no se siente muy bien para orD.ñar y atender su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para L. compra D. cuajada, crema, leche, queso, leche agria entre otros.
texts.en: Maximiliano Pablo is 63 and for the past 25 years his business has been the sale of  dairy products.    He started this business because when he was very young, he worked in private companies and learned how, and that was why he decided to go out on his own.  His challenges have been health problems because sometimes he doesn’t feel well enough to milk the cows and take care of the business.  The loan he is requesting will help him buy curds, cream, milk, cheese, sour milk, etc.

loans.use: To buy curds, cream, milk, cheese,  sour milk, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy creams, colognes, clothes, footwear and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mariela Del Carmen

texts.es: Mariela se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 4 años en su negocio. Su negocio dio inicio porque no tenía la oportunidad de proporcionarle a su familia ingresos diariamente, fue con muy poco capital que logro empezar este medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de ropa en general, calzado, perfumes, lápiz labial y más productos. En un futuro quiere ver a sus hijos profesionales y que no pasen por el trabajo duro como ella lo ha hecho.
texts.en:
Mariela sells general merchandise.  She’s been in business for over four years.  Her business started because she did not have the opportunity to provide her family with daily income.  She started this way of life with very little capital.  

The reason for the loan is to buy clothing in general, footwear, perfume, lipsticks and more products.  In the future, she’d like to see her children become professionals so that they won’t have to work as hard as she has had to.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, perfume, lipsticks and more products.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is one of those few people who was able to turn her beloved pastime into a way to make a living. “I get so excited about making bags. I never thought I could do it as a real job!” Jennifer, of Jendarling Bags, began designing and producing bags in 2008 in the scarce free time her 9-5 job afforded her. Over the past three years, her hobby has quickly turned into an all-consuming endeavor: she debuted her first collection at the London Fashion Week, at an Ethical Fashion event, at The Hospital Club, and she has been featured by local news sources such as DailyCandy, Treehugger and San Francisco’s beloved local magazine, 7X7.  

Jen’s one-of-a-kind bags are a reflection of her diverse background and interests. With degrees ranging from nonprofit management and business to working at an environmental agency, she drew from each of these experiences when developing her company. 

As a businesswoman and an environmentalist, Jen prides herself on her business’ commitment to sustainability: various collections incorporate sustainable efforts such as using local, fair trade and organic materials. Many of the zippers are nickel-free, and she relies on mostly reclaimed materials for the bags. All of the leather comes from nearby Napa and is manufactured right here in the Bay Area, supporting local jobs and reducing the carbon footprint inherent in outsourcing. 

Jen recently landed a partnership to sell her bags in a high-end retail store. “I was thrilled to land this account because it will open my business to a whole new array of clients!” said Jen. However, when the retailer placed two orders for June and July, Jen realized she did not have the capital she would need to purchase nine different colors of leather to fill this large order.

Jen knew that her bank would not be interested in giving her the small loan amount she needed, nor would it be able to provide her a quick turnaround. Having learned about Opportunity Fund at San Francisco’s Small Business Week, she turned to the local microlender and was approved for a loan within days. This loan of $3,000 will help her to secure the large order with her new partner, affording her the opportunity to grow her business.

Jen takes pride in her fabrics, her mission and her commitment to sustainability. She dreams one day of opening up her own boutique devoted to the same values.

loans.use: to pay for more materials to make her handbags.

loans.name: Maria Simona

texts.es: La Señora Maria Simona se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva en sus 34 años, siempre ha sabido trabajar y mantenerse muy independiente. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, lo cuales siempre le ha proporcionado los ingresos necesarios. El negocio lo inicio porque de sus ahorros decidió comenzar esta actividad, ella con mucho empeño y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, pues su Madre le ha enseñado a ganarse la vida de la manera más humilde. La inversión del préstamo será para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, trajes faldas y otro tipo de vestimenta. Sueña con tener su propio establecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
María Simona sells new clothes.  In her 34 years she’s always known how to work and support herself independently.  She has four children in her care and she’s always provided them with the necessary income.  She decided to use her savings to start the business.  With much sacrifice and dedication she’s managed to get ahead for her mother taught her how to earn a living in the most humble way.

The loan will be used to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, skirt suits and other types of clothing.  She dreams with having her own establishment in the market.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, suits and other types of clothing.

loans.name: El Paraiso (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Paraíso está formado por 13 mujeres quienes son amigas, tienen sus propios negocios y también se dedican en la cría de animales y la agricultura, estas actividades les permiten aportar a la economía del hogar y salir en adelante con sus familias. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe, esta parroquia es de clima frió, su gente es muy trabajadora, se dedican a varias actividades y también han migrado en busca de mejores oportunidades.  Su gente muy amable, cordial y mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las socias  es la Señora María Doolores, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe. Ella se encuentra reingresando al banco comunal ya que hace un tiempo atrás pertenecía a otro banco. 

Tiene 60 años de edad pero su alma muy joven ya que tiene gran sentido del humor, es  viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, todos son solteros trabajan y le ayudan economícamente. Con el sacrificio y trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de animales, esta actividad la desempeña desde que tenía 20 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de animales como pollos, cuyes y chanchos para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en el negocio de venta de animales.

El niño de la fotografía que está sentado con una chompa roja es hijo de una de las socias.
texts.en:
The “El Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank is composed of 13 women who are friends, have their own businesses and also are dedicated to farming and to raising animals.  These activities allow them to contribute to household economy and to get ahead with their families.  They live around Cumbe Parish.  This is a cold climate parish whose residents are very hard working and dedicated to various activities; some of them have migrated in search of better opportunities.  Its people are very kind, cordial and they still practice their culture and traditions.

One of the members is María Dolores.  She lives around Cumbe Parish.  She is rejoining the communal band because a while back she was a member of a different one.

She is 60 years old but her soul is very young and she has a great sense of humor.  She’s a widow but in her marriage she conceived three children who are adults now.  They are all single and working and help her economically.  With work and sacrifice she managed to build her own house.

María is a small farm animal merchant.  She’s been in this line of work since she was 20 years old.  She works Sunday to Sunday.

She wants to use the money from her loan to buy animals like chickens, guinea pigs and pigs to continue in business.  Her goal is to continue growing in animal sales.

The little boy in the photo who’s seated wearing a red sweater is the son of one of the members.

loans.use: to buy chickens, guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Jairo Josue

texts.es: Jairo Josué tiene 25 años, tiene 2 hijos, su esposa se dedica al hogar. El se considera un luchador, ya que el negocio al que él se dedica es duro pero se busca la forma de ganarse la vida. El es ofrece el servicio de venta y repuestos de bicicleta. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Es algo cansado pero siempre trabaja para mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar cadenas, asientos, cables, aceite y grasa.
texts.en: Jairo Josué, 25, has two children; his wife’s a housewife.  He considers himself a fighter since the business he’s in is hard but he looks for a way to earn a living.  He offers bicycle sales and repair services.  He works every day from 7am until 8pm.  It’s somewhat tiring but he always works to improve his family’s living conditions.  He will use this loan to buy chains, seats, cables, oil and grease.

loans.use: to buy chains, seats, cables, oil and grease.

loans.name: Trancito

texts.es: Trancito tiene 57 años, tiene 2 hijos que trabajan de manera independiente, vive en el municipio de Somotillo. Se gana la vida trabajando en una pulpería desde hace más de 2 años. Esta actividad le permite sacar adelante a su familia por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de sí mismo. El desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Pues cada día se esfuerza más para realizarlo. Este crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, sopas, enlatados, papel higiénico, granos básicos y jugos  ya que su negocio ha crecido y tiene una mayor demanda. Esta acción le permitirá otorgarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Trancito is 57 years old and has two children who work independently.  He lives in the town of Somotillo.  He earns his living working in a grocery store; he’s been doing this for over two years.  This activity allows him to support his family so he always strives to give the best of himself.  He wants to do some home repairs so every day he puts in more effort to do so.  

This loan is to buy snacks, beverages, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, basic grains and juices because his business has grown and he has more demand.  This action will make it possible for him to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, soups, canned goods, toilet paper, basic grains and juices.

loans.name: Reyna Marlene

texts.es: La Señora Reyna Marlene tiene su negocio que es la venta de cosméticos y ropa, ella tiene 36 años y es casada. Ella realiza sus actividades diarias del hogar antes de salir a vender a ofrecer sus diferentes productos, Reyna trabaja desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 8 la noche por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar polvos, cremas, perfumes, pantalones, camisas y trajes. Por lo que se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Señora Reyna Marlene runs a business selling cosmetics and clothing. She is 36 years old and married. She completes her household chores before leaving for work each day at 8am. She finishes work at 8pm and is always seeking ways to increase her income.

Reyna is looking for a loan to buy face powder, lotions, perfumes, pants, shirts and dresses. She promises to pay back the loan according the established schedule of repayments.

loans.use: to buy face powder, lotions, perfumes, pants, shirts and dresses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses and children's clothes.

loans.name: Angela Azuncion

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 43 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 17, 15 y 13 años de edad y todos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.  Para ella este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ofrece la institución.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio,  vende  ropa de todo tipo, tiene un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad en el cual  cinco días a la semana se dedica a vender sus productos, nos cuenta que instala su negocio desde las 8h00 hasta las 18h00 que levanta sus productos y se va a su casa a realizar las tareas del hogar, nos cuenta que es sacrificado su labor pero tiene que hacerlo por el bienestar de su familia. Lleva más de diez años realizando esta labor. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Su sueño es  tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The Chimborazo Community Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish of the town of Portoviejo. It’s well known as a business hub, as well as for its traditional festivals and its fun-loving people.

43-year old Sra. Angela lives here. She is married and has three children aged 17, 15, and 13. They all attend high school. Her husband is a businessman. This is Angela’s third loan with the Community Bank which she enjoys because of the benefits that are offered.

As well as being a fine housewife, Angela sells all kinds of clothing from a small stall in the centre of town. She works there five days a week from 8am to 6pm when she packs up the merchandise and returns home to do the household chores. She says it’s a hard life but she has to do it for the sake of her family. She’s been doing this work for more than ten years and goes to Guayaquil to buy the merchandise.

Angela will use the loan money to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing. Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, and children’s clothing

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Sonia, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.
 
Es una muy buena ama de casa que realiza el crédito para su marido para que siga adelante en su negocio por el bienestar de su familia, él se dedica a la venta de controles remotos de todas las marcas, estuches y accesorios de teléfonos celulares, su forma de venta es informal, el recorre toda la ciudad ofreciendo y vendiendo estos productos, nos cuenta que son ya más de diez años que él se dedica a esta actividad comercial y que gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien ya que nunca le ha faltado para llevar el sustento diario al hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar controles remotos, accesorios y carcasas de teléfonos celulares. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con los créditos ella se siente útil y ayuda a su marido.

Sus sueños son tener una tienda y un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Chimborazo community bank meet in Picoaza parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for being very commercial.  It is also known for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo fiestas and for the cheerfulness of its people.

Here we meet 26 year-old Sonia who lives with her common-law husband and has two children aged 9 and 3.  Her eldest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Sonia is a good housewife who is taking out this loan for her husband so that he can get ahead in his business and improve their family's well-being.  Her husband sells all brands of remote control and also cases and accessories for cell phones.  He makes his sales informally and travels around the city selling his products.
