Sonia tells us that her husband has been in this business for more than ten years and, thanks to God, it has done well and they have never been unable to support their household.

Sonia's husband will use this loan to buy remote controls as well as accessories and cases for cell phones.  Sonia has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it because the loans are useful and help her husband.

Sonia's dreams are to own a store and to enjoy a better future.

loans.use: to buy remote controls, and cell phone accessories and covers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, lime, bags and a 'comal' (a special dish for cooking tortillas)

loans.name: Jenny Rosario

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad, el mayor estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa interior tanto de damas, caballeros y niños, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  a base de pedidos que sus clientes le realizan, trabaja tres días a la semana de tres a cuatro horas dependiendo del tiempo que tenga, ya que también tiene que estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos y del hogar en general. Nos cuenta que lleva un año y medio  y que le ha ido muy bien ya que con estos ingresos ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. 

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ropa interior para damas, caballeros y niños.  Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella pudo poner su negocio. 

Su sueño es  tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
The Chimborazo Community Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish of the town of Portoviejo. It’s well known as a business hub, as well as for its traditional festivals and its fun-loving people.

32-year old Sra. Jenny lives there. She is married and has two children aged 9 and 2. The older one attends school. Her husband is a businessman. As well as being a good housewife, Jenny sells men’s, women’s, and children’s underwear door to door. Depending on the orders she gets from her customers and the time she has available, she works three days a week, three to four hours a day, as she also has to attend to the needs of her children and the house in general.
 
Jenny has been doing this work for a year and a half and all has gone very well. She is able to help her husband with household expenses. She goes to Guayaquil to buy the merchandise whenever new stock is needed. 

With the loan Jenny plans to buy more underwear. This is her fourth loan cycle with her community bank and she enjoys being a member as with one of the loans she was able to start a business. Her dream is own a second business.

loans.use: to buy men’s, women’s, and children’s underwear

loans.name: Carmen Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos  ha podido mejorar su vida. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos de 15, 11, 9 y 2 años  de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los dos siguientes en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una gran esposa que además de estar al tanto del hogar y de sus hijos le ayuda a su esposo en el negocio, ellos se dedican al comercio, venden ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y  bajo pedidos que sus clientes les realizan, nos cuenta que mientras su esposo se desplaza  a lugares más alejados ella se dedica a vender por su casa, trabaja tres días a la semana unas tres o cuatro horas dependiendo del tiempo que tenga y más que todo en las mañanas, ya que a esta hora sus hijos están en la escuela. Lleva tres años en esta actividad, pero su marido lleva mucho más tiempo. La mercadería su esposo  la va a comprar a Guayaquil cada vez que necesita.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Sus sueños es  tener un local en su casa y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Chimborazo” communal bank meets every two weeks in Picoaza Parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional feast days of Saints Peter and Paul and for the cheerfulness of its people.

Carmen is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she’s been able to improve her life with the loans.  She’s 34 years old, married and has four children who are 15, 11, 9 and 2 years old.  The oldest is in secondary school and the next two are in elementary school.  Her husband’s a merchant.

She’s a great wife who besides taking care of the home and children helps her husband with the business.  They are merchants.  They sell all types of clothes door to door and based on orders they get from customers.  She tells us that while her husband goes off to places that are farther away she sells nearer to home.  She works three days a week for one to three hours depending on the time she has available and mostly in the morning which is when her children are at school.  She’s been in this line of work for three years but her husband’s been at it for a much longer time.  Her husband goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise whenever he needs to. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.

Her dreams are to have a store in her house and to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Bera Cruz

texts.es: Doña Bera Cruz se dedica a una pulpería desde su casa de habitación. Dio inicio a este negocio desde hace 22 años, inicio primeramente vendiendo golosinas para los niños, y poco a poco fue reinvirtiendo en su negocio de tal manera que pudiera vender granos básicos, que es lo que más compra la gente. Ella afirma que su objetivo al establecer este negocio fue buscando una fuente alternativa para brindarle manutención a sus hijos, sin embargo este negocio les ha servido muchísimo para salir adelante, ya que sus hijos pueden tener la oportunidad de estudiar. Actualmente está solicitando un este crédito para la compra de golosinas, granos básicos, detergentes, pan, sopas y enlatados.
texts.en: Bera Cruz has a grocery store which is located in her own home.  She started her business 22 years ago.  She initially started out selling candies to children and gradually re-invested in her business.  This enabled her to start selling basic grains which is what people buy the most.  She confirms that her aim on setting up her business was to find an alternative source of support for her children.  The business has been a great help to her in getting ahead in life since her children have been able to study as a result.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy candies, basic grains, detergents, bread, soup and canned goods.

loans.use: to buy candies, basic grains, detergents, bread, soup and canned goods

loans.name: Angela Agustina

texts.es: Ángela Agustina tiene su actividad que es la venta de comida, desde hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar en Fundación. A pesar de sus problemas de salud, ha sabido sobrellevar su negocio sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar los deliciosos platillos que ofrece. Con el crédito comprara frijoles, queso, maduro, carnes, verduras y otros productos.
texts.en: Angela Agustina has had a food sales business and she has dedicated herself to this activity for more than 4 years. This is not the first time that she has a loan. She has been with Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for a long time. Despite her health problems she has been able to maintain her business. Her clients always come looking for the delicious meals which she offers. With the loan she will purchase beans, cheese, plantains, meats, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to purchase beans, cheese, plantains, meats, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 30 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Nuestra amiga se dedica tanto al hogar como también a un pequeño trabajo que realiza para ganarse algo propio y así poder de alguna forma ayudar a su marido con los gastos del hogar que cada vez son mayores, ella además de hacer él crédito para ella también lo realiza para el negocio del marido el cual se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, ella se dedica a pintar uñas y esto lo hace tanto en su casa como a domicilio. Nos cuenta que tiene bastante clientes que siempre la llaman o que visitan su casa ya que les da un buen servicio y a costos razonables. Lleva más de cinco años dedicada a esto y le va bien ya que es poco lo que invierte y le deja buenas ganancias.

Este crédito lo va emplear una parte para comprar esmaltes de uñas, quita esmaltes y algodón para su negocio y otra parte para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños para el negocio del marido.  Es fundadora del banco y le gusta porque en el banco se divierte con sus compañeras. 

Su sueño es  tener un  centro de belleza.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Chimborazo" meats every two weeks in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known to be a highly commercial region and it is known for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo and for its joyful population.

Here we meet Maria. She is 30 years old and she is married common-law. She has two children aged 9 and 7 and they are both in school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Our friend dedicates as much time to the home as she does to her small business. Her small business earns her own money and this is how she is able to help her husband with the household expenses, that are always increasing. She has accessed the loan for herself but also for her husband's business. He sells all types of clothing. She gives manicures and she does this from her house and at her clients' homes. She tells us that she has many clients who always call her or come to see her in her house for the good service and reasonable prices.  She has dedicated her time to this for more than five years and it has gone very well. Her investments are small and the profits are good.

She will use this loan in part to purchase nail polish, acetone, and cotton balls for her business and another part will be used to purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts, and kids' clothing for her husband's business. She is the founding member of the communal bank and she appreciates ithe bank because she has fun with her colleagues. 

Her dream is to have a beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, acetone, cotton, pants, blouses, t-shirts, and kids' clothing.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 29, is married and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Maria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Maria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gloria Ramona

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gloria, tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 12, 11 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  la mayor parte de su mercadería la vende bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja tres  días a la semana desde las 8h00  hasta las 11h00 ya que a esa hora tiene que llegar  a su casa a preparar la comida  para cuando lleguen sus hijos de la escuela y en las tardes a veces cuando tiene tiempo también se va  a  hacer sus ventas. Deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que tiene pedidos. Lleva 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien ya que cuenta con bastante clientela.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el banco comunal desde sus inicios y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con estos créditos.

Su sueño es seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Chimborazo” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its commercial activity, its traditional festivals for St. Peter and St. Paul, and the cheerfulness of its people.

It is in the place that one can meet Sra. Gloria. She is 35 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 12, 11, and 8) who are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Gloria sells all types of clothing and works by going door-to-door. She also sells from her home where she has a small store. Gloria says that most of her merchandise is sold through orders placed by her customers. She works three days a week from 8am to 11am. After that, she returns home to prepare food for her children when they come back from school. Sometimes Gloria will make sales in the afternoons when she has the time. She offers her products on credit and collects payment every Sunday. Gloria buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every time she receives orders. She has been in business for six years and has done quite well since she has many customers.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. She has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys the assistance she has received through the loans. Her dream is to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es: Marvin Antonio tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de refrescos y golosinas. Tiene más de 11 años en este negocio, es una persona luchadora que disfruta de su actividad. El negocio lo inicio cuando decidió invertir en ciertos productos fue así que con la ayuda de los financiamientos su negocio ha podido crecer. Ahora el solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsas, frutas, azúcar, pajilla, vasos desechables y una gran variedad de golosinas.
texts.en:
Marvin Antonio is 34 years old and has a business selling refreshments and candy. He has been in business for more than 11 years. Marvin is a determined person who enjoys his work. He started this business when he decided to invest in certain products. With the help of loans, he has been able to grow his business.

Now he is requesting a loan to buy bags, fruit, sugar, straws, disposable cups, and a variety of candy.

loans.use: to purchase bags, fruit, sugar, straws, disposable cups, and a variety of candy.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 60 years old and married. She has six children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. 

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Violeta has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Violeta aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edelmira De Los Angeles

texts.es: Edelmira De Los Ángeles tiene 24 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 7 años en su negocio, ella siempre busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos ya que todos los días la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de productos. Inicio este medio de vida con capital propio a pesar de no tener muchos productos tenía una gran cantidad de clientes, fue así que decide iniciar y continuar con este medio de vida. el crédito es para la compra de bolsos, cosméticos, ropa en general y cremas.
texts.en:
Edelmira De Los Ángeles is 24 years old and has a business selling general merchandise. She has been in business for more than seven years and is always looking for ways to improve her income. Every day a majority of her customers are requesting a wide variety of products. Edelmira started her business with her own capital. Despite not having very many products, she was able to attract a large number of customers. For this reason, she decided to continue with her business.

This loan will be used to buy bags, cosmetics, clothing, and crèmes.

loans.use: to purchase bags, cosmetics, clothing, and crèmes.

loans.name: Yessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Yessica es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos. Tiene 27 años, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad los mismos que estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es comerciante informal.

Es una gran ama de casa que divide su tiempo entre el hogar y el comercio, se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también trabaja a base de  pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Trabaja dos  días a la semana en las mañanas y los domingos se dedica a cobrar ya que sus productos los deja a crédito, nos cuenta que solo vende en las mañanas porque aprovecha que sus hijos están en la escuela y en las tardes ella tiene que ayudarles en sus tareas escolares. Su mercadería  la compra en Picoaza en un lugar que le dejan a buen precio. Lleva 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.

Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Chimborazo” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its commercial activity, its traditional festivals for St. Peter and St. Paul, and the cheerfulness of its people.

Sra. Yessica is a founding member of the Communal Bank and enjoys the credit services. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children (ages 12 and 7) who are in school. Her husband is an informal merchant.

Yessica is an excellent housewife who divides her time between her home and her business. She sells all types of clothing by going door-to-door. Yessica also accepts orders from her customers. She works two days per week during the mornings and then on Sundays she collects payment for the products she offers on credit. Yessica says that she only sells in the mornings because she wants to take advantage of the time when her children are in school. In the afternoons, she helps them with their school work. Yessica buys her merchandise in Picoaza at a place that offers good prices. She has been in business for two years and has done well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. Her dream is for her children to study and become good people.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 50 years old and married. She has two children.

Rosie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been running the variety store for eight years and also earns an income from raising pigs. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like juice, powdered milk, groceries, etc., to sell in her variety store. Rosie has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rosie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like juice, powdered milk, groceries, etc., to sell in her variety store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 52 years old and married. She has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elma has a variety store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Elma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like eggs, soap, shampoo, beverages and other groceries to sell.

 Elma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like eggs, soap, shampoo, beverages and other groceries to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cruz Encarnacion

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Chimborazo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Cruz, tiene 42 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  20 y 13 años  de edad, el menor estudia en colegio, sus dos hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc.  En ella trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados, nos cuenta que aunque su tienda es pequeña ella allí tiene de todo ya que así sus clientes no se van a comprar en otra parte.  Tiene más de diez años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le gusta porque ha hecho más amigas en el grupo. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y aumentarlo  cada día más.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Chimborazo” meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza of the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for its commercial activity, its traditional festivals for St. Peter and St. Paul, and the cheerfulness of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Cruz. She is 42 years old, married, and has two children (ages 20 and 13). Her younger child is in high school and both children live at home. Her husband is a merchant.

Cruz has a general store in her home where she sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other items. She works every day from 6am until 8pm, and sometimes much later. Her children help with the business whenever they are not busy. Even though her store is small, she says her customers can find whatever they need and do not plan to shop anywhere else. Cruz has been in business for more than 10 years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to restock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats, and other basic necessities. Cruz has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and likes the fact that she has made many friends within her group. Her goals are to continue with her business and expand it each day.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cured meats, and other basic necessities.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 43 years old and married. She has two children.

Leah is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 20 years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Leah requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

In the future, Leah would like to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a vehicle repairs business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending.  Analyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase a new machine for her repair shop business. 

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new machine for her repair shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Olga Cristina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Américas se reúne cada quince días en  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde tiempos coloniales  como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, por la inmensa cantidad de arboles de esta fruta de ahí este nombre, con el que se lo conoce hasta la actualidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora  Olga, ella tiene 65 años, en la actualidad está soltera  pero de una  relación que tuvo hace muchos años  tiene dos hijos de  34 y 22 años de edad  los mismos  aun viven con ella y estudian en la universidad. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y nos cuenta que le agrada la forma como trabaja la institución, ya con los créditos se ha ayudado a muchas personas como a ella.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para que a sus hijos no les faltara nada desde hace muchos años se  dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende productos naturales de la marca Nature Garden, tarjetas de telefonía celular, además de esto también vende aguas, colas y gelatinas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 9h00 hasta las 19h00. Entre los productos que más vende están el vita toro, Esperoline, vita cerebral, gel reductor, entre otros. Los productos los recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo. Nos cuenta que gracias a Dios siempre le ha ido bien y con esto  ha podido darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar gaseosas, aguas y  productos naturales.
 
Su sueño es tener casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Américas” meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known since colonial times as the city of “Reales Tamarindos” because of the large number of tamarind trees that continue to exist today.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Olga. She is 65 years of age. Olga is currently single, but she was in a relationship for many years. She has two children (ages 34 and 22) who live with her and are studying at the university. Olga has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and says she appreciates the way Fundación ESPOIR has worked with her. The loans have already helped many people like her.

Olga is a wonderful homemaker, but she has also worked as a merchant for many years so that her children would not lack anything. She has a small shop in her home where she sells natural products made by Nature Garden as well as mobile phone cards, water, sodas, and gelatin. Olga works every day from 9am to 7pm. Among the products that she sells the most are “Vita Toro” (an energy supplement), Spirulina, “Vita Cerebral” (a supplement to enhance memory and cognition), anti-cellulite gel, and other items. She obtains her products from a distributor in Portoviejo. Olga says that thanks to God, she has always done well and was able to provide a good education for her children.

This loan will be used to buy natural products, water, and sodas. Her dream is to own a home since she currently lives in a rental property.

loans.use: to purchase various natural products, as well as water and sodas.

loans.name: Hazell Yaoska

texts.es: Hazell Yaoska tiene su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 7 años en su negocio, inicio con fondos propios y con la ayuda de sus hermanos. La mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos, amigos, familiares y compañeros ya que algunos saben que Hazell vende productos en su vivienda pero usualmente ella sale a vender de manera ambulante. Todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana se prepara para salir a ofrecer cada uno de sus productos. El crédito es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, cremas y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Hazell Yaoska has a business selling general merchandise. She has been in business for more than seven years. Hazell started out with her own funds and the help of her siblings. Most of her customers are neighbors, friends, relatives, and colleagues. Some of them know that she sells products from her home, but Hazell usually generates her sales as a traveling merchant. Every day at 7am, she prepares herself to go out and start offering every one of her products.

This loan will be used to purchase bags, shoes, cosmetics, crèmes, and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase bags, shoes, cosmetics, crèmes, and clothing.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 55 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Carmencita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Carmencita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Carmencita has been in this business for 10 years. Carmencita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Agustina Alexandra

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Américas se reúne cada quince días en  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde tiempos coloniales  como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, por la inmensa cantidad de arboles de esta fruta de ahí este nombre, con el que se lo conoce hasta la actualidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Agustina, ella tiene 37 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 11 y 8 años, la mayor esta en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su marido es mecánico automotriz.

Ella para tener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo.  También tiene un restaurante en la casa de su mamá, en el cual prepara deliciosos platos y el preferido de sus clientes es el viche de mariscos. Trabaja de lunes a sábado en su restaurante y allí mismo aprovecha para vender la ropa ya que la mayoría de sus clientes llegan hasta su restaurante, nos cuenta que deja a crédito y el dia domingo se encarga de cobrar. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil. Nos cuenta que lleva más de 10 años dedicada a esta actividad.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, ropa de niños y algunos víveres para preparar los alimentos. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.
 
Su sueño es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Américas” meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known since colonial times as the city of “Reales Tamarindos” because of the large number of tamarind trees that continue to exist today.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Agustina. She is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children (ages 15, 11, and 8). Her oldest child is in high school and the younger ones are in elementary school. Her husband is an automobile mechanic.

In order to have her own income and help her husband with the household expenses, Agustina works in retail by selling all types of clothing. She also manages a restaurant at her mother’s house where she prepares delicious dishes. The preferred dish of her customers is the seafood ceviche. Agustina works Monday through Saturday at the restaurant. She also takes advantage of selling clothes to a majority of her customers who come to her restaurant. Agustina says she extends credit and collects payment on Sundays. Her merchandise is purchased in Guayaquil. She says that she has been in business for more than 10 years.

This loan will be used to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, and a few ingredients for preparing her dishes. She is a founding member of the Communal Bank and likes the very low interest rates. Her dream is to have a larger restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase trousers, shirts, blouses, children’s clothing, and a few ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 40 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a Sari Sari  (variety) Store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari Sari Store for 15 years and also earns an income from E-loading (prepaid cell phone credits).

Marilou aspires to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: José Amadeo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Américas se reúne cada quince días en  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde tiempos coloniales  como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, por la inmensa cantidad de arboles de esta fruta de ahí este nombre, con el que se lo conoce hasta la actualidad.

Aquí conocimos a don José, tiene 56 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad el mismo que estudia en colegio. Su mujer se dedica a las labores del hogar. 

Don José se  dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado los días de feria. Nos cuenta que esto lo realiza los tres últimos días de la semana, él se va el jueves  a los campos a comprar los productos directamente de los agricultores para que le salga más barato y luego los lleva al mercado a distribuirlos tanto al por mayor como al menudeo. Lleva dedicado a esta actividad tres años ya que en los otros días y desde hace muchos años también se dedica a realizar servicios de transporte escolar.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas, verduras y legumbres. Él está en el Banco Comunal hace tres ciclos y está muy contento por la ayuda que recibe tanto del banco como de la institución.
 
Su sueño es comprar un camión más grande y poder llevar productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Américas” meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known since colonial times as the city of “Reales Tamarindos” because of the large quantity of tamarind trees that continue to exist today.

It is here that one can meet Don José. He is 56 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has a 14-year-old son who is in high school. His wife takes care of the household duties.

Don José sells fruits and legumes at the market on the days when the fair is in session. He says that he sells during the last three days of the week. On Thursdays, he goes to the fields to buy products directly from the farmers since he can get a cheaper price. He then takes his goods to market where he can sell in bulk and in smaller amounts. José has been in business for three years. For many years he has also been providing transportation services for school children on the days he is not running his business.

This loan will be used to buy fruits, vegetables, and legumes. José has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and is very pleased with the assistance he has received from both the Communal Bank and Fundación ESPOIR.

His dream is to buy a larger truck so that he can bring his products to other cities.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, and legumes.

loans.name: Nelly Mireya

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Las Américas se reúne cada quince días en  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde tiempos coloniales  como la Ciudad de los Reales Tamarindos, por la inmensa cantidad de arboles de esta fruta de ahí este nombre, con el que se lo conoce hasta la actualidad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly, ella tiene 41 años, está soltera  pero de una relación que tuvo hace mucho  tiene  cuatro hijos de 20, 18, 13 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en Universidad, colegio y escuela.

Ella es una abnegada madre que para que sus hijos tengan un buen futuro y que nunca les falte nada se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo tanto nacional como colombiana de algunas marcas, también vende productos de Yanbal (artículos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorio para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y bajo pedidos, nos cuenta que lo que más vende es la ropa íntima de mujer que son muy solicitada por las damas y los perfumes tanto de damas y caballeros. Trabaja todos los días unas cinco horas por dia, su mercadería la deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, nos cuenta que lleva como 15 años dedicada a esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería, como camisas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Está en el Banco hace cuatro ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos se ayuda mucho.
 
Sus sueños son  tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es arrendado y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Américas” meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known since colonial times as the city of “Reales Tamarindos” because of the large number of tamarind trees that continue to exist today.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Nelly. She is 41 years old and single, but was in a relationship for many years. Nelly has four children (ages 20, 18, 13, and 8) who are studying either at the university, high school, or elementary school.

She is a devoted mother who wants her children to have a good future and lack nothing. Nelly sells clothing through catalogs but also carries garments made by Colombian brands. In addition, she sells products made by Yanbal (a company known for beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Her sales are generated by going door-to-door and taking orders. She says that the products that are most requested are women’s lingerie and fragrances for both men and women. Nelly works every day for approximately five hours each day. Her merchandise is offered on credit and she collects payments on a weekly basis. She says that she has been in business for 15 years and has done very well.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as shirts, blouses, trousers, undergarments, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics. Nelly has been with the Communal Bank for four loan cycles and enjoys being a member because the loans have been a great help.

Her dreams are to own a home since she currently rents and to see her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, blouses, trousers, undergarments, perfumes, crèmes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Alejandra has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling recycled materials.

Alejandra aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 53 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Carmencita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Carmencita requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Carmencita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Carmencita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely works hard to support her family. She is single and has an "abaca"-weaving business in the Philippines.

Emely requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for "abaca" making. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Emely would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for "abaca" (natural fiber) making.

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is 60 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rodita has an "abaca" weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca-making.

Rodita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Rodita would like to provide good living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for "abaca" (natural fiber) making.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. She is single and has a candle-making business in the Philippines.

Margie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy wax, coloring materials, wicks and a variety of containers for her candle-making. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Margie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wax, coloring materials, wicks and a variety of containers for her candle-making.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gualberta

texts.en:
Gualberta is 59 years old and married. She has a retail business in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She sells RTW shirts and jeans to the people in her community. She also raises pigs to fatten and sell.

Gualberta has requested a loan and plans to use it to purchase piglets, feed and more RTW clothes to sell. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and more Ready-To-Wear (RTW) clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dorothea

texts.en:
Dorothea is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dorothea is 49 years old and has one child who is in school.

Dorothea has a food vending business in the Philippines. Dorothea requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Dorothea has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Dorothea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle transport business.

Lorena has been in this business for 14 years. Lorena earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Lorena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her tricycle tranport

loans.name: Trinitas

texts.en:
Trinitas is 59 years old. She is separated from her husband and has seven children. 

Trinitas has a shop that buys and sells bananas. She has had this business for five years.  She requested a loan for 7,000 PHP to finance her buying and selling business.

Trinitas has been a member of HSPFI for five years. In the future, Trinitas hopes to expand her business for the benefit of her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from cosmetics sales and raising pigs. Nenita is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear item products for her clothing sales business.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear item products

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She is borrowing 20,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for 11 years. Marissa also earns additional income from photocopying services. Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Leovira

texts.en:
Leovira is a married woman with two young children aged 6 and 4. She is 29 years old and has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for four years. Her husband is a motorcycle driver.

Leovira sells items like eggs, canned goods, and coffee to the people in her community. She works hard to provide the needs of her family and save for her children's future. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as noodles, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is married, 32 years old, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Maricris requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricris has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricris would like to save money to provide a financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Khurelpurev

texts.en:
Mr. Khurelpurev is 22 years old, a waiter, and lives with his mother in a house bought on a mortgage in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a laborious and diligent young man who is trying to improve his life and private career. 

Khurelpurev has been working as a waiter in Grand Khan Irish Pub LLC from 06.00 pm-midnight on weekdays since March 2010. Until 06.00 pm, he does a taxi business using his car which is old. Recently his old car is becoming bad and he needs to renew it immediately. This business is the main income source for him and his mother. Now he has saved up the amount of 1.500.000 MNT for buying a new taxi. 

Therefore, he needs a 2.100.000 MNT loan to renew his old car to improve his taxi service business. "If I have a new car, I will try harder and it will be a most important support to my business and our life," he said.

loans.use: To renew his old second-hand car to improve his taxi service business.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Julieta is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma  is 50 years  old.  She  is married  with two children. 

 Emma   is engaged in buying and selling seafood products like fish, shrimp, shells and crabs.  She has had this business for three years.  She  requested a loan of 8000 to  buy more seafood products to sell.

 Emma  has been a member of HSPFI  since the year 2008.  In the future,  Emma  hopes to have a better business to be of more help to her family.

loans.use: To buy more seafood products to sell.

loans.name: Genelie

texts.en:
Genelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Genelie has been in this business for 14 years. Genelie earns additional income from rice and vegetable farming.

Genelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en:
Christy is 38 years old. She is married with three children. 

She has a shop that sells variety of food products like snacks, canned goods and juices. She has had this business for three years.  She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to sustain her variety store.

Christy has been a member of HSPFI for two years. In the future, Christy hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell like snacks, food products and drinks

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 24 years old and is a married woman with a 2 year old child. Her husband is a farmer.

Clara is running a sari-sari store business. She sells canned goods, biscuits, shampoo and other daily use products to the people in her community. She also helps her husband grow rice at their farm, when she can.

Clara has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, detergent soap and sugar. She hopes to have a bigger store someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, detergent soap and sugar.

loans.name: Bebie Elena

texts.en:
Bebie Elena is 48 years old. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. 
 
Bebie Elena owns a mini restaurant that caters food like different meats and rice for an affordable price. She had this business for 1 year. She  has requested a loan to buy more ingredients and utensils for the business.

Bebie Elena has been a member of HSPFI for this year, 2011. In the future, Bebie Elena hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the menu.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 41 years old. She is a married woman with 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Leonida is in the business of food vending. She makes rice cakes, banana cue (deep fried banana), and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar and flour. She hopes to have a stable business in the future to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Renerio

texts.en:
Renerio is 50 years old. He is married and has 5 school-aged children. 

Renerio has a shop that sells a variety of products like food snacks, candies, drinks and more. He had this business for 1 year. Previously, he was involved in buying and selling of bananas. He has requested a loan to finance and sustain the mini grocery store business.

Renerio has been a member of HSPFI for the past year, since 2010. In the future, Renerio hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like food products, detergents, shampoos and more.

loans.name: Bayarbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Bayarbaatar, 37, lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife, Baasarsuren, works in a pawn shop. His daughter, Maralmaa, is a student in secondary school. 

In 2003, he graduated from the National University of Mongolia as a lawyer. Since his childhood, he has always been interested in fashion design. However, he is not a professional designer. He has been designing and sewing dresses lately. Sometimes he needs to hire some workers to support his business when he has a high work load. Now he would like to renovate his work shop and to buy new textiles and fabrics for his tailoring business. 
The loan that Mr. Bayarbaatar is taking will be devoted for these reasons.

loans.use: to renovate his work shop and to buy new textiles and fabrics for his tailoring business.

loans.name: Mendsaihan

texts.en:
Mendsaihan lives with his wife and six children in a "ger", a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His older daughter who is 19 years old goes to a college. His wife owns a shoe-making business and works as a decorator during the summertime with monthly salary of 200,000 to 300,000 MNT. He manages a wood selling business in his town. 

He started his business in 2009. He is planning to continue his business in the future. He is polite man who says, “One must work hard in order to achieve success." He is requesting a 400,000 MNT to purchase more wood for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood.

loans.name: Kholmurod

texts.ru: Холмурод проживает в районе Восеъ. Ему 63 года. Он женат. У него 6 детей. Его жена занимается торговлей парфюмерии. Сам Холмурод имеет средне - специальное образование, он шофер. По специальности он проработал 5 лет. Сейчас Холмурод занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где сеет пшеницу. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для повторного посева пшеницы.
texts.en: Kholmurod lives in Vose.  He is 63 years old, married, and has six children.  His wife sells perfume.  Kholmurod has a vocational education as a driver.  He worked in his profession for five years.  Now he farms.  He rents a plot of land where he grows wheat.  He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer for a second wheat harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer for a second wheat harvest.

loans.name: Lam

texts.en: The borrower, age 30, resides of Siem Reap Province. He and his wife have been working altogether in farming business, and is earning around $6.25 each day for financial expenses. The couple has three single children, all of whom are single and still depend on their income. Rainy season is coming now, and it is the good time to start to put in his crop. As he doesn’t have immediate cash in hand for doing farming, he has decided to ask for a loan for Kiva to buy seed, fertilizers and other farming material to support him in the farm field. With the loan, he wishes to increase the size of his crop and rebuild his old house to make it bigger at than present.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizers and other farming material to support him in the farm field.

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Sainbayar is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a "ger", a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His older daughter is a pupil while the younger two are in kindergarten. He manages a grocery trading business in his town. He is responsible for purchasing and transporting products and his wife is responsible for selling them to their customers. 

In addition Sainbayar conducts a taxi service business in order to supplement his earnings. They collect and put aside 5000 MNT daily, so they can have  savings for future use. Sainbayar is a polite man who says, "I am doing my best to better my living conditions." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira was born in 1974 and lives in Yerevan with her husband and 5-year-old son. She is an accountant and has a Bachelor's degree in economics. After university Naira worked as an accountant in different organizations.

Three years ago Naira with her husband set up their own bakery in rented place. They produce various sorts of bread and "lavash" (typical Armenian  flat unleavened wheat bread). Naira’s parents-in-law help with the  business and her husband distributes their production to city food shops. 

Thanks to the profit from their business, Naira and her family bought the necessary furniture for their house and also they are able to support Naira’s and her parents-in-law families. 

Naira is asking for a $ 2,000 loan to buy flour supplies, oil, yeast, etc. for her bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour supplies, oil, yeast, etc. for her bakery.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 31-year-old mother who is blessed with three children. Ana is a farmer working in the Philippines and she earns PHP 4,000 per month. 

Ana is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers such as manure. Ana has been growing root crops for almost five years.

In the future, Ana hopes to have a plentiful harvest and earn more income for the sake of the future of their children. She is thankful that KIVA lenders offer a financial assistance to improve their source of income. She hopes that they continuously accord her loans in the business so she will be able to start another kind of business in the future and uplift their way of living.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 26 years old and married. He has two children, the older of whom is two years old while the younger is only 6 days old. Kim is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing rice for eight years now. He earns about 7000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Kim plans to use his loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. He hopes to be able to save for his children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Kadammurod

texts.ru: Кадаммурод проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 40 лет. Женат. У него семеро детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Более четырех лет Кадаммурод занимается торговлей на рынке. У него имеется магазин бытовой техники. Кредит берет для приобретения новых моделей техники для продажи.
texts.en: Kadammurod lives in the region of Hamadoni. He is 40 years old. He is married and has seven children. He has secondary education. For more than four years Kadammurod has been selling on the market. He has a store where he sells household appliances. He is asking for a loan to buy new models of electronics for sale.

loans.use: to buy new models of electronics

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 33 years old and is a married woman with two children ages 10 and 13 years old. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for nine years.

She plans to use her loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor. Marites is hoping for an increased harvest and income. She also hopes for her children to someday finish college and find jobs for themselves.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and fuel for the tractor

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Дилшод житель района Восеъ. Возраст, 31 год. Женат. У него трое детей. Он имеет высшее образование. Дилшод преподаватель урока физкультуры. На сегодняшний день он занимается растениеводством. Арендует участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Dilshod lives in the Vose region. He is 31 years old. He is married and has three children. He has higher education. Dilshod is a teacher of physical education. At this time he does crop growing. He rents out a plot of land where he sows wheat and grows vegetables for sale. He has been in this business for more than eight years. He is taking out the loan to buy mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Shryl

texts.en:
Shryl is a 25 year old married woman with 1 child. She and her husband are farmers. She helps her husband till their land located in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. They primarily grow rice to sell.

Shryl has requested a loan to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to increase profit and improve her family's living conditions. Shryl also hopes to save for her child's future.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is  35 years of age, married with 6 school age children. Teresita is a farmer working in the Philippines who grows root crops. She has been doing it for almost 10 years.and earns PHP 3,000 per month. 

Teresita is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. 

In the future, Teresita hopes to have a plentiful harvest in order to have a higher income to finance the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 39 year old mother who is blessed with 3 school age children. Annie is a farmer working in the Philippines. She earns PHP 5,000 per month. 

Annie is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Annie grows root crops and has been doing it for almost 8 years.

In the future, Annie hopes to increase their crop yields in order to earn more income to be used in financing the tuition fees and allowances of their children. She is thankful that Kiva lenders offer their financial assistance for them to improve their income source. She believes that someday she will be able to start another kind of business to give their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is a 41 year old married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 21 years old while the youngest is only 7.

Cerila has been farming for 20 years. She helps her husband grow rice to sell. The farm is the main source of income of her family. Cerila works hard to help provide for the needs of her family. She plans to use her loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and to pay for labor.

Cerila's goal is to send all her children to school and have them finish college so that they can have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and to pay for labor

loans.name: Shella

texts.en:
Shella is a 23 year old mother blessed with 2 children. Shella is a farmer working in the Philippines who grows root crops. She has been doing it for almost 5 years and she earns PHP 3,000 per month. 

Shella is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure.  

In the future, Shella hopes to improve their source of income in order to give her children a better future and  to improve their standard of living. She was thankful when she found out Kiva lenders would assist them to improve their source of income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat is a caring lady. She keeps herself busy doing household work. She prefers staying at home and taking care of her family. 

Her husband has a food stall where he sells Punjabi food items called samosas (made with flour filled with potatoes and served with sweet & chilly sauces) and also pakodas (made with gram flour and also served with tomato and chilly sauces). 

These are the most demanded food items among his customers. He has been doing this work for many years. In his working experience, he has got a good reputation and earns well. 

Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy gram flour, potatoes, spices, flour and cooking oil, etc. for expanding his food stall by providing good and quality food items to his customers. 

Mussarat is hopeful that her husband's business will expand further after the loan investment and her family will be able to enjoy a better standard of living as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Mussarat.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients for food stall business.

loans.name: Boturkhon

texts.ru: Ботурхон проживает в районе Восеъ. Возраст, 50 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Ботурхон занимается посевом пшеницы. Кроме того он выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более 20 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Boturhon lives in the Vose region. He is 50 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. Boturhon sows wheat and also grows vegetables for sale. He has been in this business for more than twenty years. He is taking out the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
51-year-old Emma is a farmer from the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for twenty years. Emma works hard with her husband to provide for their needs and send their children to school. 

Emma has applied for a loan to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farming necessities. She hopes for their business to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer and other farming necessities.

loans.name: Aida

texts.pt:
Natural de Chibuto, Provincia de Gaza sul de Mocambique casada mãe de 3 filhos,de idades entre 7 a 22 anos de idade os mais novos vão a escola. Fez 10a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta  mais ninguem.   
Saiu de Chibuto para Maputo com os seus pais ainda pequena, é funcionario permanente no ministerio da educação ha mais de 10 anos onde consegue um salario de 4.200.00mt  por mês  que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são   clientes desta instituiçao e este e o seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construão (cabos electricos, pagamento de contracto da electrecidade e outros) para concluir a  sua residencia.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades e um dos seus sonhos e concluir a casa e construir um murro, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
The applicant comes from Chibuto, in the southern Mozambican Province of Gaza. She is a married mother of 3 children whose ages range from 7 years to 22 years old, the youngest of whom attend school. The applicant attended school until the 10th Grade when she had to stop going due to her financial situation. She lives in her own home with her family and they are not supporting anybody else.
The applicant left Chibuto with her parents when she was still a young girl, for the last 10 years she has been in permanent employment as a clerk at the Ministry of Education, where she earns 4,200Mts each month. She uses her earnings for the household expenses and saves the remainder in her bank account.
She has never borrowed money from other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through friends of hers who are also Hluvuku clients. This is her second loan for 10,000Mts which she intends to use to buy building materials (electrical cables, and to pay electricity bills among others) in order to finish building her home.
She is confident that she will easily be able to meet the repayments and one of her dreams is to finish the building work on her home and to erect a wall. She intends to apply for further loans in order to achieve these aims.

loans.use: to buy building materials (electrical cables, payment of electricity bills among others).

loans.name: Euhila

texts.en:
Euhila is 46 years old and married with one child. She has been running a general store in the Philippines for thirty years and earns an income from pig fattening and a carinderia (restaurant) as well.

Previously Euhila borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock for her general store.

Euhila works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her general store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Regina, who is in her late 20s, is married with three children, two of whom go to school. She has been running a small food shop and charcoal business for three years now. She works from 7:00 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

Regina is the leader of her loan group, "Msasani," which has a total of fourteen members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. She is requesting a “motisha” loan, a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania which allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.

This will be Regina’s fourth motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. She used those loans for household expenses, school fees, shop inventory and her charcoal business. She plans to use her portion of this loan to build her charcoal business.

Regina’s dream is to send her children to a good school and on to a higher education.

loans.use: to build her charcoal business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who sells wholesale and retail stocks of seafood in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eighteen years. Ruth also earns income from raising livestock and through a tricycle transport enterprise.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of crab, fish and other seafood to sell.

Ruth dreams of building and improving her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of crab, fish and other seafood to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Republica da Africa do Sul, é viuva e maê de 10 filhos cuja as idades ja não se lembra, mas quase todos ja independentes. Fez 4a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus netos que vivem com ela.   
Saiu da Africa do Sul para Maputo ainda muito nova, veio com seus pais, mais tarde constitui a sua familia. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos alimetares ha mais de 20 anos, não tem empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00 a 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas comerciantes que tambem são   clientes desta instituiçao. Este é o seu oitavo emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (refrescos, cigarros, cervejas, sumo e outros) para aumentar a mercadoria no seu estabelecimento.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades e um dos seus sonhos e ampliar o seu negocio, e construir um estabelecimento comercial condigno, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Born in the Republic of South Africa, the applicant is a widowed mother of 10 children, whose ages she can no longer remember, but almost all of them now live independently. She attended school up to the 4th grade and then stopped going owing to her financial situation. She lives in her own house and cares for her grandchildren who live with her.
She left South Africa with her parents when she was still young and later started her own family. She has run her own business selling food for the last 20 years. She does not have any employees and she manages to earn around 3,000-4,000Mts each month, which she uses for household expenses and saves the remainder in her bank account.
She has never borrowed money from any other bank. She heard about Hluvuku through business colleagues who are also Hluvuku clients. This is her eighth loan for 10,000Mts, she intends to use this to buy merchandise (refreshments, cigarettes, beer, juices and other items) to increase her business current assets.
She is confident that she will meet the repayments without any difficulty. One of her dreams is to expand her business and to build a proper commercial establishment. She intends to apply for further loans in order to achieve these aims.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (refreshments, cigarettes, beers, juices and other items).

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 53 years old and married with five children. She has been running a sari-sari store in the Philippines for three years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Irene has borrowed and repaid seventeen loans from NWTF before this loan. She is now requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Irene works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is 46 years old and is a married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 28 years old and the youngest, six.

Florinda is a farmer and has been growing rice for twenty years. She sells her harvest at the market and earns about 5000 PHP per month. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pay for laborers.

She hopes to increase her income so as to support her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 31 years old and married with two children who are in school.

For the past three years Madeline has had a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Madeline has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Madeline is a very hardworking entrepreneur. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.pt:
Natural de Maputo, Provincia de Maputo sul de Mocambique solteiro não tem filhos. Fez 7a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com os pais e não sustenta  mais ninguem.   
Nunca saiu de Maputo, é funcionario temporario numa empresa ha mais de 1 ano onde consegue um salario de 2.500.00mt  por mês, para alem de seu emprego exerce uma actividade pesqueira onde tambem consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de visinhos que tambem são   clientes desta instituiçao. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar redes de pesca para ampliar o seu negocio. O emprestimo anterior foi de 6.000.00mt foi para o negocio.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades e um dos seus sonhos é concluir a casa, e iniciar um  outro negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Born and raised in Maputo, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo, the applicant is a single man who does not have any children. He attended school up to 7th Grade and then stopped going for financial reasons. He lives in his own home with his parents and does not support anybody else.
He has never left Maputo and for the last year or so he has been working in a temporary job as an office clerk where he earns 2,500Mts each month. As well as this job, he also works in the fishing industry where he earns a further wage of around 3,000Mts each month, which he puts towards the household expenses and saves the remainder in his bank account.
He has never borrowed money from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through his neighbours who are also Hluvuku clients. This is his second loan for 15,000Mts which he plans to use to buy fishing nets to expand his business. His previous loan for 6,000Mts was also for his business.
He is confident that he will meet the repayments without any difficulties. One of his dreams is to finish building his house and to start another business. He intends to apply for further loans with Hluvuku to achieve these aims.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets to expand his business

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
This is Fely, fifty years old and a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Felicisimo, an electrician, and is the mother of five children. By the grace of God, Fely has managed to support her children's schooling. This is a dream for most poor Filipino parents like Fela, as she is a college graduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave their children.

Fely is a sugar retailer. She buys sacks of sugar from wholesalers, repacks them and sells them in 1/4, 1/2, and 1 kilo sizes to individuals, general store owners and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, Fely is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy more stocks of sugar to expand her inventory. She expects a boost in income from this expansion. 

Fely dreams of giving all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work. She also hopes to have a store in the community market. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of sugar needed in her business.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng, 29 year old, is married with two children, six and three years old. Every month Heng spends $43 on food and $18 on other expenses.

Heng is a garment factory worker, and her husband sells sand. Their income totals $7.50 a day. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for the family’s use. Her husband’s business is progressing, and she wants to extend his business to make more income.

Heng plans to repair her house so as to be more comfortable and will work hard with her husband to send her children to study at the university. She wants them to work in a bank or in a microfinance company just like CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family’s use.

loans.name: Carlitos

texts.pt:
Natural de Gorue, Provincia de Zambezia norte de Mocambique casado pai de 6 filhos,de idades entre 4 a 22 anos de idade. Fez 6a classe e parou para ir ao serviço militar obrigatorio. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta  mais ninguem.   
Saiu de Zambezia para maputo quando foi transferido atraves do sevirço militar obrigatorio                                mais tarde formou sua familia.
