É pencionista do Ministerio da Defesa ha mais de 15 anos, exerce tambem uma actividade comercial onde consegue 4.000.00mt de rendimento por mês e 5.000.00mt da sua pensão onde aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são   clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas, cimento, cantoneiras e electrodes) para melhorar a sua obra.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades e vai solicitar mais emprestimos para continuar com a sua obra e desenvover o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Originating from Gorue, in the northern Mozambican province of Zambezia, Carlitos is a married father of 6 children, aged between 4 and 22 years old. He attended school up to the 6th Grade and left to fulfill military service obligations. He lives in his own home with his family and does not support any others.
He left Zambezia when he was transferred to Maputo during his military service, before starting his family. He has been in receipt of a pension from the Ministry of Defense for 15 years. He also carries out some business activity for which he earns 4,000MZN each month, along with his pension for 5,000MZN which he uses for household expenses and puts some more away as savings in his bank account.
He has never borrowed from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through some friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This is his third loan for 15,000MZN, which he intends to use to buy building materials, such as sheeting, cement, angle bars and electrodes, to improve his work.
He is confident of easily meeting the repayments and he is going to apply for further loans in order to continue with his work and develop his business.

loans.use: to buy building materials (sheeting, cement, angle bars and electrodes).

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 58 years old and is a widow with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. 

Lorna aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Emerita works hard to support her family. She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Emerita is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy pigs and a cow to slaughter and sell for her meat vending business.

Emerita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to buy farmland.

loans.use: To buy pigs and a cow to slaughter for sale as meat.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Natural da Matola, Provincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique solteira mãe de 1 filho de 8 anos de idade. Fez 10a classe e parou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos pais. vive na casa propria com o seu filho e sustenta a sua maê mandando dinheiro para ajudar nas despasas de casa.
Saiu da Matola para Boane com os pais ainda pequena, mais tarde devido as dificuldades da vida inicia um negocio proprio de venda de roupa diversa. Exerce esta actividade ha mais de 7 anos onde consegue um rendimento de cerca 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (fatos e roupa diversa) para aumentar a quantidade da sua  mercadoria e obter mais rendimento. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt, 7.500.00mt, 6.000.00mt e 12.000.00mt tambem para o comercio.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem problemas, no futuro pretende solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku para poder ampliar seu negocio e construir um estabelecimento condigno.
texts.en:
Originating from Matola, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo, Gloria is a single mother to her 8 year old son. She attended school up to the 10th Grade then stopped going due to her parents' financial difficulties. She lives in her own home with her son and she also supports her mother, sending her money to help out with the cost of household expenses.
She left Matola and moved to Boane with her parents when she was a little girl. Owing to difficulties in her life, she later started her own business selling clothing and she has been doing this now for 7 years. She earns around 4,000MZN each month which she spends on household expenses and saves a little in her bank account.
She has never borrowed money from other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through friends of hers who are also Hluvuku clients. This is her fifth loan for 10,000MZN which she intends to use to buy merchandise, such as suits and other clothing, in order to increase her stock and profits. Her previous loans for 6,000MZN, 7,500MZN, 6000Mzn and 12,000MZN were also invested in her business.
She is confident of easily meeting the repayments; in the future she intends to apply for further loans with Hluvuku in order to expand her business and to build a proper place of business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (suits and other clothing).

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa is married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Clarisa is 35 years old and has three children who are in school.

Clarisa has a livestock raising business in the Philippines. Clarisa requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy "carabao" (water buffalo) to raise.

Clarisa has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Clarisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy "carabao" (water buffalo) to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy produce (refreshments, beers, cakes, biscuits and other items).

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Natural de Maputo, Provincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique viuva mãe 4 filhos,de idades entre 12 anos a 27 anos de idade. Fez 7a classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta as irmas que vivem com ela.   
Nunca saiu de Maputo , e comerciante ha mais de 25 anos onde consegue um rendimento de 10.000.00mt  por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são   clientes desta instituiçao e este e o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar mercadoria (refrescos, cigarros, cervejas, sumo e outros) para aumentar a mercadoria no seu estabelecimento.
Esta confiante que vai pagar sem dificuldades e um dos seus sonhos e ampliar o seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Originally from the city of Maputo, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo, Elisa is a widowed mother of 4 children, aged between 12 and 27 years old. She attended school up to the 7th Grade then stopped going owing to her financial situation. She lives in her own home with her children and also supports her sisters, who live with her.
She has never left Maputo. She has been running a business for 25 years from which she earns 10,000MZN each month. She uses this money for household expenses and puts some away as savings in her bank account.
She has never borrowed money from other banks. She heard about Hluvuku through some friends, who are also Hluvuku clients. This is her first loan for 12,000MZN and she intends to use this to buy goods, such as refreshments, cigarettes, beers, juices and other items, in order to increase her business stock.
She is confident of easily meeting the repayments and one of her dreams is to expand her business. She intends to apply for further loans to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to buy stock (refreshments, cigarettes, beers, juices and other items).

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Gloria has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from dried fish vending.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of  her fishing boat.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique é casada e mãe de 1 filho de 3 anos de idade que ainda não frequenta Escola. Fez 12a classe e continua com seus estudos frequentando neste momento o ensino superior. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta seus pais mandando dinheiro para alguma ajuda alimentar.
Saiu da Matola para Boane quando se casou, é funcionaria permanente do Ministerio da Educação ha mais de 5 anos onde recebe um salario de  6.848.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no banco Millenium Bim para habitação e pagou sem problemas, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são clientes desta instituição e dicidiu solicitar o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 11.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento,areia,varões e outros) para dar continuição a sua obra de construção da sua casa.
o seu sonho e concluir a sua obra e iniciar um pequeno negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Elisa was born in the city of Matola, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo. She is a married mother of a 3 year old son, who does not yet attend school. She attended school herself up to the 12th Grade and she is currently continuing with her studies in higher education. She lives in her own home with her family and she supports her parents by sending them money to help out with their food costs.
She left Matola and came to Boane when she got married. She has had a permanent position as an office clerk at the Ministry of Education for the last 5 years, for which she receives 6,848MZN each month. She uses this money for household expenses and puts some away as savings in her bank account.
She has already borrowed money from the Millenium Bim bank for work on a bedroom, and she repaid this without any problems. She heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also Hluvuku clients and she decided to apply for her first loan of 11,000MZN. She intends to use this money to buy building materials (cement, sand, rods and other materials) to continue with the building work on her house.
Her dream is to finish this work and to start a small business. She hopes to apply for further loans to achieve these aims.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, sand, rods and othe rmaterials).

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 55, a resident of Queson City, Philippines. She is married to Alberto. With her husband, she manages the family household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alicia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Alicia earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Alicia hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and to repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Releiza Joy

texts.en: 28-year-old Releiza is a farmer who works in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She is married and has 3 children aged 10, 9 and 7. She has been growing rice for 5 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She said that this loan will truly help her business. She hopes to earn better and to be able to sustain her children's education until college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina, 52, a resident of Queson City, Philippines. She is married to Delfin, a welder. With her husband, she manages the family household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Regina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Regina earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 45,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and also to buy a freezer for her soft drinks. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Regina hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products, inventory items and equipment needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a meat vending business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase more meat to sell. Helen has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell.

loans.name: Baatarsukh

texts.en:
Mr. Baatarsukh, 43 years old, is an army man. He lives with his wife and his 4 daughters all together in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working in the army for 11 years. His wife is an assistant teacher in a day-care center. 

Mr. Baatarsukh is a careful father who wants to help his children start their independent lives. One of his daughters needs land to start her own life and have a vegetable farm business. Therefore, the loan he is taking will be used to purchase the land to build a new house and to start a vegetable business.

loans.use: to purchase the land to build a new house and to start a vegetable business.

loans.name: Vantha

texts.en: Vantha, 28 years old, is a hair cutter with $6 per day as income. His wife is staying home taking care of their child. They have one child and he is 5 years old. Every month, Vantha has to spend $55 on food, $12 on electricity, and $15 more on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1200 to buy farmland and hair cutting equipment. He wants to have a small grocery shop for his wife in the market, so that they both can make good income doing other things in the future.

loans.use: To buy farmland and hair cutting equipment.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola, Provincia de Maputo, sul de Moçambique casado e pai de 8 filhos, e não lembra as respectivas idades. Fez 5a classe e parou devido a falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua maê e os sobrinhos que vivem com ele.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, apenas deslocou se de um bairro para o outro durante o preiodo da guerra. Trabalha como segurança numa empresa e é comerciante ha mais de 8 anos onde tem um salario de 2.500.00mt por mês na empresa de segurança e cerca de 2.000.00mt de rendimento no seu negocio, este valor aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes desta instituiçao e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 12.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para o seu estabelecimento (refrescos, cervejas, batatas e outros) para aumentar a mercadoria ,e obter mais lucros. 
o seu sonho e construir um estaleiro de venda de carvão vegetal e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the city of Matola, in the southern Mozambican province of Maputo. He is a married father of 8 children, whose respective ages he cannot remember. He attended school up to the 5th Grade and left owing to his financial situation. He lives in his own home with his family and supports his mother and his nieces and nephews, who live with him.
He has never left Maputo, although he has moved from one neighbourhood to another during the war. He works for a security company and he has also been running his own business for the last 8 years. Each month he earns 2,500MZN from the security company and around 2,000MZN from his own business. He uses this money for household expenses and puts some away as savings in his bank account (BIM).
He has never borrowed money from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also Hluvuku clients, and this will be his first loan of 12,000MZN. He intends to use this money to buy goods for his business, such as refreshments, beers, potato snacks and other items) in order to increase his stock and profits.
His dream is to build a yard in which to sell charcoal; he intends to apply for further loans to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to by goods for his business (refreshments, beers, potato snacks and other items).

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam is 53 years old, widowed, and she did not want to struggle in this life by being unemployed, so she opened a grocery store one year ago.
Little by little she was able to fill the store with the most wanted items in the neighborhood, until it became one of the most visited grocery stores in the area.

Now Khitam has applied for this loan to buy a fridge and a freezer to add cold products such as drinks, yogurt, meat, chichen, and other cold products.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and a freezer for her grocery store.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Orn, 40 years old, is running a karaoke shop. Her husband is a chief of construction for a company and states, their income is $15 per day. They have two children, and both of them are studying. 

Every month, On has to spend $70 on food, and $12 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy pigs and pig-feed, then sell those pigs when they are big enough to sell. If she could save more money, she would like to buy grocery goods to sell in front of her house. As for the children, she wants to support them in their studies until they finish university.

loans.use: To buy pigs and pig-feed.

loans.name: Raad

texts.en: This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has two children. Raad has had a barber shop since 2000. He offers shaving and massage services. He has long experience and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. He is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate the furniture of his shop and to purchase additional products. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To renovate the furniture of his shop and to purchase additional products.

loans.name: Remilyn

texts.en:
Remilyn is a 30-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. Her husband works as a farmer and driver.

Remilyn is also a farmer. She helps her husband till their land and prepare it for cropping. They grow rice crops to sell. Remilyn does her best to support her family. She has applied for a loan to help fund their farm. She plans to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Remilyn hopes to be able to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Cloudimit

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Cloudimit works hard to support her family. She has a rug making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tropical fish. Cloudimit is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed in her rug making business.

Cloudimit has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in her rug making business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Run, 56 years old, is a cake seller at a state school. Her husband is a farmer. They have 4 children, two are working in the factory and one is working as construction worker. Every month, she spends around $65 on family expenses. She would like to request a loan of $700 to buy car spare parts because she wants to start a career of car repair with her son. If her son can make a good income, she will extend her small shop at school by buy more cakes from market to sell in the school.

loans.use: to buy car spares equipment.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying & selling of crabs business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000, through NWTF, to buy more stock of crabs to sell for her buying & selling of crabs business.

Lenie has been in this business for 6 years. She earns more income from fishing. Lenie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of crabs to sell.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 57 years old and married with 3 children. Leonor works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Leonor has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 1 year and also earns an income from farming copra, rice and fruits trees.

Leonor aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling furniture in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years and also earns an income from her sari-sari (variety) store. Ligaya has been sustaining her businesses through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF.

Ligaya is requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more furniture to sell. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to sell

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 33 years old and is single. She has been operating a well-organized business selling women's clothes for one year. Her business is open from 7am until 5pm daily. She employs one person to help her.

Francine has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more women's clothes to sell. With the profit, Francine will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing to sell

loans.name: Saros

texts.en:
Saros, 49 years old, is a housewife. Her husband sells electric equipment and makes 7.5 USD per day for his income. They have 5 children, three are studying and two are helping their father to sell electric equipment in other provinces. They can make 7 USD per day. 

Every month, Saors has to spend 170 USD on food, 50 USD on school fees and 20 USD on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of 900 USD to buy a motorbike for her husband's career. She also wants to buy more electric equipment to sell.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband's career

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 20-year-old father who has an infant child. Robert has a motorcycle he uses to give passengers rides. He has been in this business for almost 7 years. 

Robert is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase new tires for his motorcycle in order to provide better service. He usually earns about 5,000 PHP each month in this business.

In the future, Robert hopes to have more earnings in order to start another kind of business as a source of income. He hopes that Kiva lenders will continuously assist him so he can able to reach his business goals someday.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his motorcycle in order to provide better service

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
As a married parent of 6 children, Marlene works hard to support her family. She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Marlene is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business.

Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Savorn

texts.en:
Savorn, 38 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is an artist, he draws along the pagodas. Their income is 11.5 USD per day. They have two children, one is working in the factory and one more is an artist like his father. 

Every month, Savorn has to spend 60 USD on food and 20 USD on transportation. She would like to request a loan of 400 USD to buy drawing paint. She expects to save some money to buy grocery goods to sell in front of her house. More than that, she wishes to repair her house because it is not in good condition.

loans.use: to buy drawing paint

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 27 years old, single and lives with four family members (one of whom works). Hasan has owned a gym since 2005. He has a deep understanding of the field of training, fitness nutrition, health advice and consultation. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. 

Hasan is requesting a $2700 loan. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a generator.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and is married with four children, three who are in school.

Teresita buys and sells ready-to-wear products. She has been in this business for five years. She has requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more bags, blouses, body lotions and perfumes to sell in her stall.

Teresita is a very hardworking Filipina entrepreneur. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bags, blouses, body lotions and perfumes to sell in her stall.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dalinq

texts.en:
Dalinq, 23 years old, is married and has one child who is two years old. Every month she has to spend $80 on food.

Dalinq is a garment factory worker, and her husband is a construction worker. Together their income is $5.60 per day.

Dalinq would like to request a loan of $200 from Credit MFI to buy construction materials to repair her house. Because her house is not in good condition, she needs zinc to repair the walls.

In the future she hopes her husband will become a construction chief and make more money than he is now.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 61 years old and married with six children. She has run a sari-sari store in the Philippines for the past twenty years and also buys and sells rice grain and livestock.

Milagros has already borrowed and repaid fifteen loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to stock in her store.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 30 years old and married with two children, ages one and eight. For the past eight years, she has been engaged in farming. She grows rice to sell at the market. 

Sheryl is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. She hopes to improve her earnings and be better able to provide for her children’s education through college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and farm inputs

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 64 years old and married with three children. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she works hard to provide for her family. She has been running her store for five years and she also earns an income from buying and selling rice and raising pigs. Nilda has borrowed and repaid 16 previous loans through NWTF.

Nilda is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari store. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Yorm

texts.en:
Yorm is 55 years old and is a single mother with two children. One of her children is studying and the other works in a garment factory. Yorm sells food and earns a daily income of 5 USD. Her monthly expenses include 55 USD for food, 15 USD for electricity, and 20 USD for school fees.

Yorm is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a mechanized fishing boat to fish during the rainy season. In the future, she expects to open a small shop and also plans to repair her house so that it is more comfortable to live.

loans.use: to buy a mechanized fishing boat

loans.name: Regelyn

texts.en:
Regelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who runs a farm machinery rental business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past three years and earns additional income from raising pigs and ducks. Regelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.

Regelyn is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts to repair and maintain her rental machinery and equipment. She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair and maintain machinery

loans.name: Hazem

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. Hazem has had a food market since 2003, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area, so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Hazem is requesting a $2400 loan for paving his market and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pave his market and add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in the town of Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur with her family. Like most people in her town, her main livelihood is rice farming.

She works hard to keep her farm productive. She applied for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Sukhum

texts.en:
Sukhum is a housewife. Her husband is a motor taxi driver with $2.50 per day for his income. She has three children, all of them are working in the factory and they can make $5 per day for their income. 

Every month, Sukhum has to spend $77 on food, and $5 on electricity. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her son to do motor taxi driving like his father. If she can save more money, she will buy a van for her husband to transport the factory workers to their location which will bring more income to her family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her son

loans.name: Khureltogoo

texts.en:
Mr. Khureltogoo, 28, has been a meat salesman in the bazaar since 2008.  He lives with his wife and 4-year-old son in their poor house. His wife is a seamstress in a small factory. 

This family needs a new good house and wants to plant some trees inside their fence. So, the loan Khureltogoo is borrowing will be used to purchase the construction materials and some beautiful trees for the improvement of their life condition.

loans.use: To purchase the construction materials and some beautiful trees for the improvement of their life condition.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 34-year-old married woman with one child. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for six years. She sells her harvest at the market and earns about 5,000 PHP per month. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to have a successful business. She also hopes for her child to be able to finish college and have a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jumakhon

texts.ru: Чумахон проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 52 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он имеет среднее образование. Уже четыре года как он занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания. Кредит берет для покупки необходимых продуктов.
texts.en: Jumakhon lives in Hamadoni. He is 52 years old, married, and has four children. He has a secondary education. He has been working in trade for four years.  He has a grocery shop. He is taking out a loan to buy necessary products.

loans.use: to buy necessary products.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has three children. He lives with eight family members, of whom three work. Mohamad has had a wholesale grain shop since 2000. He has long experience in this field and has a good reputation. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and is loyal to his clients.

Mohamad is requesting a $2700 loan to rebuild the walls of his shop and to add more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to rebuild the walls of his shop and to add more inventory.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a married woman with a 5-year-old child. She is 34 years old. She has been engaged in farming for 12 years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month from farming. 

Julie requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides. Julie hopes for her business to be stable. She dreams for her child to be successful someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Saadiyeh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 47 years old, married and has four children. Saadiyeh has had a food market since 2005, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs . Her market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Saadiyeh is requesting a $1800 loan to buy a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her market. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a generator and to add more foodstuffs to her market.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a 30-year-old married mother of five children, lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, where she has been selling food for snacks to earn a living for the past three years. A member of PMPC for a year, she is requesting a loan for 3000 to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending. In the future, Marilyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle, a 26-year-old married mother of two children aged five and three, is a farmer, an occupation she shares with her husband. Michelle helps him grow rice crops and makes sure the farm is free of weeds and pests. Her current monthly income is 4000 PHP.

Michelle does her best to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs, hoping for their farm to expand and for their children to someday finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Utkir

texts.en:
A humble man, Utkir earns a living in the cattle business, working hard everyday to be able to meet his three children's needs. It is important to note that his business requires a lot of physical work mainly because he needs to transport the animals from one point to another, crossing long distances under the exposure of the sun. This can cause illnesses and can weaken the body. Nonetheless, Utkir continues to work hard and has now come to IMON International to obtain a loan that will allow him to purchase young bulls to raise and sell in his area.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Irene has a jewelry business, which she has had for 1 year.         
	
To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase jewelry for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Irene hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her younger sister. In the future, Irene hopes to own a shop that sells jewelry. Irene is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Bamtare Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BAMTARE a été créé il y'a trois années de cela,il est composé de 14 femmes issues du meme village ayant pour activité principale l'agriculture et le commerce.

Madame khadidia en position assise à l’extrême droite;levant le bras,est responsable du groupe de solidarité BAMTARE.Son activité est la transformation de l’arachide en pâte destiné à la vente.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité  pour l'avoir pratiquer plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en arachide et en quantité suffisante pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. 

Son objectif est d'accompagner ses enfants dans leurs études, en payant les frais de scolarité.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bamtare was created 3 years ago. It is made up of 14 women, all from the same village, and whose main activity is farming and retail.

Mrs. Khadida, seated, far right, with her arm raised, is the group's leader. She makes groundnuts into paste for retail. She has been doing this for several years, so she has plenty of experience. The loan will allow her to buy enough  groundnuts  to meet her customers' demand. Her goal is to see her children continue their studies, by paying for their school fees.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.en:
Zulkhumor is an entrepreneur from Khujand. She lives there with her husband and 3 children. Zulkhumor sells men's shoes at the market. All merchandise she offers for sale in her business is trademark quality at affordable prices. When Zulkhumor launched her enterprise 15 years ago it was pretty frugal. However, she was consistently increasing her clientele and assortment of trendy discount shoes imported from other countries. Zulkhumor is seeking a loan of 5,000 Somoni to add to her stock and meet the growing demand for shoes. At this point one of her business goals is to find reliable and accountable suppliers to partner with. Zulkhumor has already repaid one loan to IMON International without any delinquencies. IMON believes her outstanding credit history and willingness to strive for higher goals will help her repay the current loan and reach success in her business.  
  
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Ariuntuya

texts.en: Ariuntuya is 28 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Sansar Area, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son who is 6 years old goes to a kindergarten while her husband manages a taxi service business. She conducts a hair salon at a rented apartment. She started her business in 2007 and gained much experience. Recently she bought a plot of land to build a house for her family. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to finish construction work of my house soon." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital and to buy  construction material for her house.

loans.use: To buy construction material for her house

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, single and lives with six family members. Haydar has owned a shop for household items and gifts since 2008. He has good experience in this field and has a good reputation. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and is loyal to his clients.

Haydar is requesting a $2400 loan to renovate his shop and to purchase more inventory. He is aiming to gain more profit so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is 43 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Manzura has run her own business for more than 8 years. She embroiders traditional national skull-caps for men and women. Manzura produces skull-caps of various types. She has many clients and usually has many orders. Because Manzura's customers are always expecting new goods, her business is stable, allowing Manzura to contribute significant income into the family budget. Today Manzura requests 13,000 Somoni to purchase fabrics needed for embroidering national skull-caps. Manzura thanks all those supporting her and promises to pay the loan in time.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for embroidering traditional national skull-caps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more eggs for her business.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a house in Sansar Area, Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His older son is a student while the younger two are pupils. He manages a photo studio with the help of his wife at a rented apartment. He started his business in 2008. Before starting this business, he sold construction materials for 5 years. He now conducts a Canon service business in addition to photography services. He is a polite man who says, "I want to expand my business in order to earn more money so I can pay tuition fees of my children." He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a heater for his house, which is a he build by himself.

loans.use: To purchase a heater

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has 1 child. Her child is not in school.  Phiona has a business of tailoring, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Phiona has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Phiona hopes to generate greater profits to take care of herself. She would like to buy clothes for herself. In the future, Phiona hopes to build a house of her own. Phiona is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to improve in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and 4 children in their home. After purchasing his cattle, Amir provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, Amir sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale. Currently he needs to purchase cattle to raise and is turning to IMON International to obtain a loan of 5,000 Somoni for this reason. Amir thanks Kiva for the support that Kiva presents to small entrepreneurs.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase young cattle for sale

loans.name: Erhembayar

texts.en: Erhembayar lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her two sons, both attend secondary school. Her husband works as a driver at his older brother's company. She manages a clothing making business in her town. She started her business in 2004 and built a strong customer base. She sews 4-8 pieces of traditional Mongolian clothing in a month and receives 15,000-20,000 MNT from each of them. She is planning to continue and expand her business in the future. She is an honest and hardworking lady who says, "My customers are increasing day by day." She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Nasrullo

texts.ru: Насрулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 25 лет. Холост. Имеет среднее образование. Он предоставляет услугу. У него имеется дилерский центр, где он пополняет балансы и продает панели телефонов. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для приобретения панели телефонов и сим-карты.
texts.en: Nasrullo lives in Hamadoni. He is 25 years old and single. He has a secondary education. He provides a service. He has a mobile phone shop where he adds minutes to phones and sells cell phone covers.  He has been doing this work for two years.  He is taking out a loan to buy cell phone covers and SIM cards.

loans.use: to buy cell phone covers and SIM cards.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga is 36 years old and lives in his older brother's ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. He manages a photography business in his town. He makes and prepares photo albums for students and pupils. He is planning to renew his equipment with the loan received from Xacbank, one of the biggest banks in Mongolia. He is polite man who says, "I want to have my own photo studio in the future." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for his photo studio

loans.name: Shiela Alona

texts.en:
Shiela Alona is 33 years old and lives in Ozamis City. She is married with 3 children.

Shiela works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish for sale. 
Shiela has been a member of PMPC for one year.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar city. Her older son, age 11, goes to a secondary school while her younger son, age 4, is in kindergarten. She manages a hair salon at a rented apartment in Ulaanbaatar city, the capital of Mongolia. She started her business in 2006 and has gained much experience. Now she has many regular customers. She is a kind woman who says, "I want to have my own apartment for my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction equipment to repair and expand her beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase construction equipment to repair her salon

loans.name: Hazratkul

texts.en:
Hazratkul makes a living using his taxi to transport people around Penjikent and surrounding areas. Personal vehicles are too expensive for most people to afford in Tajikistan. Transportation services such as buses and taxis like Hazratkul’s provide a valuable means of getting around for many, many people. Hazratkul currently makes around $10-$20 per day, enough for him to support himself and his family. Hazratkul has requested a loan of 5000 Somoni to help him with some maintenance on his taxi. He has been in business for 11 years and has put a lot of kilometers on his car. Eventually he’d like to purchase a much newer car, but until that time, this loan will help him keep his vehicle in good working order.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to maintain his taxi

loans.name: Uyanga

texts.en: Uyanga is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a house in the Sansar area of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two sons, aged 8 and 12, both attend secondary school, while her husband is a taxi driver. She manages a clothing trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2010 and has gained much experience. Now her working capital exceeds 2,400,000 MNT with a daily net profit of 60,000-80,000 MNT. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to expand my business in the future." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more clothes and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Ayubjon

texts.en:
Ayubjon is a married father of two children. His family lives in Kumsangir where Ayubjon runs a small grocery store selling food products downtown in his home town. Ayubjon's store is well known in this neighborhood as he serves his customers well and works late hours. This is very convenient for many customers who work late and go shopping after work. Ayubjon has been in this business for a year. Currently he is seeking a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase foodstuff to increase his product range. Ayubjon had some struggles as his business was growing and becoming self-sustainable. However, he handled all these challenges pretty well and is looking toward to the future with much enthusiasm and optimism.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff to increase his product range

loans.name: Abdel Khalek

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 33 years old, married and has three children. 

Abdel Khalek has had a store for household items and gifts since 2009. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to pave and paint his shop and to add more inventories. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pave and paint his shop and buy more stock

loans.name: Mahulolo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHULOLO est formé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Micheline, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Micheline est âgée de 40 ans environs et est mariée à Vincent, un comptable. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés et qui vivent ensemble avec eux. Micheline et son mari supporte ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Micheline a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et s'impliquer dans les diverses charges du ménage, Micheline prépare de "Atassi" (aliment local fait à base de riz et de haricot) et aussi de la bouillie de maïs, qu'elle vend à son domicile depuis une vingtaine d'année. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Micheline n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Micheline et les autres membres du groupe MAHULOLO sollicitent ensemble un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group Mahulolo is composed of five residents of the same district in Benin. The group's representative, named Micheline, is raising her hand on the picture. This is the second time that this group is requesting AliDé's financial support in order to increase their level of activity.
Micheline is about 40 years old and is married to Vincent, an accountant. The couple has two children who both attend school and live together with them. Micheline and her husband provide for the family together. Micheline had very little schooling. To support herself and participate to the household expenses, Micheline prepares "Atassi" (a local dish made from rice and beans) and corn porridge, which she has been selling from her home for about twenty years. Customer demand is growing, and given her limited means, Micheline no longer manages to satisfy it well.
In view of this and taking into account their limited resources, Micheline and the other members from group Mahulolo are requesting a collective loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase cereals, condiments for sauces, and peanut oil.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en:
Nabeela is a 30-year-old housewife and a mother of a one-year-old baby boy. Since she and her husband are starting a new family, she thought that she could help him increase their monthly income to provide their future children a good life.

Two years ago, Nabeela started selling cosmetics and beauty products at home. At the same time, she took a few courses to learn how to be a hairstylist and added that to one of her services at home.

Now, Nabeela is applying for this loan to buy a barber seat as a start to creating a professional beauty salon at home, and then opening her own beauty salon in the area.

loans.use: To buy a barber seat

loans.name: Mithak

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, married and has three children.

Mithak has had a barber shop since 2007 where he offers shaving and massage services.
He is very experienced and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $2,200 loan to pave and paint his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To pave and paint his shop.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Macanja, Provincia de Tete ao norte de Mocambique casado e pai de 3 filhos de idades entre 20 a 27 anos. Fez o nivel superior e parou quando foi incorporado ao serviço militar obrigatorio. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mae enviando algum valor para algumas despesas de casa.
Saiu de tete para Maputo em missão de serviço, trabalha como funcionario permanente das Forças de Defesa de Mocambique ha mais de 31 anos. Nao tem empregado  e recebe um salario de 20.612.70mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja teve emprestimos no BIM, que aplicou no inicio da construçao da sua casa. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (cimento, vidros, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com o melhoramento da sua casa.
O seu sonho é ver a sua casa concluida e confortar melhor a sua familia. Pretende comprar uma viatura ,para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Arnaldo was born in Macanja district, in the northern Mozambican province of Tete. He is a married father of 3 children, aged between 20 and 27 years old. He completed higher level studies before leaving school to fulfil his military service obligations. He lives in his own home with his family and supports his mother, sending her money to help out with her household expenses.
He left Tete and came to Maputo during his military service. He has been in permanent work as an office clerk for the Mozambique Defence Forces for 31 years. He does not have any employees and he receives 20,612.70MZN each month, which he uses for household expenses and puts some away as savings in his bank account (BIM).
He has already borrowed money from BIM, which he used to begin building his house. He heard about Hluvuku through friends who are also Hluvuku clients. This is his first loan of 25,000MZN and he will use it to buy building materials, such as cement, glass, timber and other materials, to continue with his home improvement.
His dream is to see his house finished and see his family in greater comfort. He would like to buy a car and he intends to apply for further Hluvuku loans to achieve this aim.

loans.use: to buy building materials (cement, glass, timber and other materials).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials (cement, bricks, iron, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Salwan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old and married.

Salwan has had a shop for entertainment and electronic games since 2008. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate and enlarge his shop. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To renovate and enlarge his shop.

loans.name: Akpedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKPEDJI est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Julienne Rufine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Julienne Rufine est âgée de 50 ans et est une veuve qui a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, il ne reste qu'un seul à la charge de Julienne Rufine. Julienne Rufine assure seule ses besoins. Pour y parvenir, Julienne Rufine mène comme activité, la vente de cartes de recharges téléphoniques et divers autres produits dans un marché du Bénin. Julienne Rufine s'approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Julienne Rufine exerce cette activité depuis une quinzaine d'année. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Julienne Rufine désire renforcer son activité par l'augmentation du stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Julienne Rufine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKPEDJI, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group Akpedji is composed of three residents of the same district in Benin. The group's representative, named Julienne Rufine, is raising her hand on the picture. This is the first time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support in order to increase their level of activity.
Julienne Rufine is 50 years old and a widow with four children, who all go to school. Among the children, only one still depends on her financially. She supports herself on her own. For this, Julienne Rufine is in the business of selling prepaid phone cards and various other products at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's largest markets. She has been in this business for about fifteen years.
To better satisfy her customers' demands, Julienne Rufine wishes to strengthen her activity by increasing her stock of products. To achieve this, Julienne Rufine and group Akpedji's other members are requesting a loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy prepaid phone cards and various products.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
Natural  de Maputo, povincia de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 6 filhos de idades entre 1 a 25 anos. Fez a 4a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo , trabalha na pedreira estevele a mais de 30 anos e tem um salario de 2.900.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este é o seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (cimento, areia, vidros, barrotes e outros) para a construção da sua casa,os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 4.460.00mt, 8.400.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt e foram para habitacao.
O seu sonho é ver a sua casa concluida, confortar melhor a sua familia e iniciar um negocio,  para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Armando is from the city of Maputo in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of 6 children who range in age from 1 to 25.  He finished studying through the fourth grade and stopped because of the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

He has never left Maputo.  He has worked at the Estevele quarry for more than 30 years and makes 2,900 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is his fifth loan in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, glass, beams, etc.) to do construction on his home.  His previous loans were for 4,460, 8,400, 10,000, and 15,000 meticals and all went towards his home.

His dream is to finish his house so he can provide greater comfort for his family and start a business, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, glass, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Vicente

texts.pt:
Natural  de Manjacaze, povincia de Gaza ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 10 a 25 anos. Fez a 2a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois netos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Manjacaza para Maputo a procura de emprego, é pencionista no Ministerio de Administração Estatal ha mais de 30 anos e tem uma pensao de 5.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este é o seu quarto emprestimo no valor de 10.100.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (cimento, areia, barrotes, portas e outros) para a construção da sua casa. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 8.000.00mt, 10.000.00mt, e 10.000.00mt.
O seu sonho é ver a sua casa concluida e confortar melhor a sua familia e iniciar um negocio ,para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Vicente is from Manjacaze in the province of Gaza in southern Mozambique.  He is the father of four children who range in age from 10 to 25.  He studied through the second grade and didn't continue due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and also supports two grandchildren that live with him.

He left Manjacaza for Maputo in search of employment.  He has managed pension accounts at the state ministry of administration for more than 30 years.  He makes 5,500 meticals per month and applies it towards his home's expenses and also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is his fourth loan in the amount of 10,100 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, sand, beams, doors, etc.) to do construction on his home.  His first loans were for 8,000, 10,000, and 10,000 meticals.

His dream is to finish his home to provide his family with greater comfort and to start his own business, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (cement, sand, beams, doors, etc.)

loans.name: Alexandre

texts.pt:
Natural  de Chibuto, povincia de Gaza ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 4 a 11 anos. Fez a 3a classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Gaza para Maputo a procura de emprego, trabalha como segurança na empresa agro-alta a mais de 1 ano e tem um salario de 6.000.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este e os seu segundo emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (bloco, cimento, areia e outros) para a construção da sua casa. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.200.00mt habitacao.
O seu sonho é ver a sua casa concluida e confortar melhor a sua familia e melhorar o seu negocio ,para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Alexandre is from Chibuto, in the province of Gaza, in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 4 children, who range in age from 4 to 11.  He finished studying through the third grade and stopped due to the lack of financial resources.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

He left Gaza for Maputo in search of employement.  He has worked as a security guard in the Agro-Alta company for more than a year.  He makes 6,000 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account in the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is his second loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, sand, etc.) to do construction on his home.  His first loan was for 10,200 meticals and also went towards his home.

His dream is to finish his house to provide better comfort to his family and to improve his business, for which he plans on requesting more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials (bricks, stone, cement, beams, etc.)

loans.name: Joao

texts.pt:
Natural  de Maputo, província de Maputo ao sul de Mocambique casado e pai de 2 filhos de idades entre 3 e 10 anos. Fez a 12a classe e continua a estudar. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, trabalha como professor a mais de 11 anos e é do quadro do Ministério da Educação, tem um salário de 3.790.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem sao clientes desta instituiçao e este e os seu quinto emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construçao (areia, pedra, cimento e outros) para a construção da sua casa,os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 9.200.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 12.000.00mt, 13.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt.
Tenciona ver a sua casa concluida e confortar melhor a sua familia e para tal vai solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Joao is from the city of Maputo in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique.  He is married and the father of 2 children, who are 3 and 10.  He finished studying through the 12th grade and continues taking classes.  He lives in his own home with his family and doesn't support anyone besides them.

He never left Maputo.  He has worked as a teacher for more than 11 years and works for the Ministry of Education.  He makes 3,790 meticals per month, which he puts towards his home's expenses.  He also saves some in his bank account at the BIM bank.

He has never had a loan with another bank.  He became familiar with Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution.  This is his fifth loan in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to buy construction materials (sand, stone, cement, etc.) to do construction on his home.  His previous loans were for 9,200, 12,000, 12,000, and 13,000 meticals.

He plans to finish his home to provide better comfort to his family, and he is going to request more loans from Hluvuku to do so.

loans.use: to buy construction materials (sand, stone, cement, etc.)

loans.name: Ines

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, província de mesmo nome ao sul de Mocambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 24 e 26 anos de idade. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sobrinha enviando dinheiro.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, e funcionaria permanente a mais de 15 anos na Direcção de aguas ARA-SUL e tem um salário de 3.500.00mt por mes que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigas que tambem são clientes desta instituição e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, chapas, e outros)os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, e 12.000.00mt para habitação.
