El motivo del crédito es para la compra de telas, zipper, botones, hilos, tijeras y agujas.
texts.en: Nubia is 60 years old, she is a seamstress and has been offering sewing services for more than 43 years. Since her young ages, she was taught by her parents to strive and to work very hard to be able to provide for her family. Even though she is able to work under pressure, time is still one of the main challenges she has to face, as sometimes she is given too little time to complete the orders she receives. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, scissors and needles.

loans.use: To buy fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, scissors and needles

loans.name: Malik

texts.en:
Malik is a 29 years old man, who got married recently.

He opened a supermarket one year ago that has a lot of space in it that allows people to shop easily and also provides them with good quality food products.

 Now Malik has applied for a loan to add new kinds of frozen items such as meat and chicken to his supermarket.

loans.use: To add frozen meat and chicken to the items he sells in the supermarket.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been selling clothes for the last four years. She is a hardworking 36-year-old businesswoman who supplements her income from selling mobile-phone credit cards. In the next five years, she hopes to expand her business and to reach more customers. Her dream is to have a better future. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has become self independent.

She wants to start dairy farming; hence she has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana Maria tiene 53 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 30 años que tiene este negocio, es una persona muy responsable y disfruta de su actividad económica ya que la mayoría de sus clientes saben del buen carisma que ella ofrece. Inicia desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, pues tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado en donde circulan una gran cantidad de clientes. Este es el motivo del financiamiento para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, bolsos, ropa en general, toallas.
texts.en: Juana Maria is 53 years old and she runs a general store. She has been engaged in this activity for more than 30 years, she is a very responsible person and she enjoys her job as the majority of her customers choose her for her charisma. She works form 7 am to 7 pm, as she owns a small stall in the market attended by a great number of customers. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, cosmetics, bags, clothes and towels.

loans.use: To buy shoes, cosmetics, bags, clothes and towels.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela de 44 años es una mujer muy emprendedora, que vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 3 y 7 años en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene un negocio a través de cual realiza varias actividades, por un lado ofrece servicios de internet y de telecomunicaciones, así mismo vende ropa, chancletas, útiles escolares y accesorios, en un punto comercial ubicado en su propia casa al que llamó “Variedades Lina Marcela” Su idea de negocio lo inició desde hace 5 años, cuando entusiasmada por sus hermanos también dedicados al comercio al detalle, observó que les iba  muy bien y fue así como decidió emprender  su propia aventura, vendiendo ropa en barrios diferentes al de su residencia, donde construyó su primera clientela. Desde hace tres años se mudó a otra vivienda y fortaleció su negocio en un local bien acondicionado,  allí no solo empezó a exhibir su ropa sino nuevos artículos, como la papelería accesorios y variedades en general y finalmente añadió nuevos equipos y enseres para diversificar su oferta y convertir su negocio en lo que hoy es; en él cuenta con 4 computadores y sus respectivas cabinas, porque vende también el servicio de telefonía móvil. Su negocio lo desarrolla con su sobrina que es su gran colaboradora, allí vende principalmente de contado  a vecinos del sector y su sueño es convertirlo en un punto de referencia para ubicar sucursales, las que en un futuro fortalezcan el emprendimiento de sus hijos, con los que sueña y tiene el gran desafío de ofrecerles las oportunidades de estudio, que le sean posible, con tal de llevarlos a que sean profesionales y potencialicen su éxito.  El credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Graciela hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará ropa, fantasías, artículos de papelería y helados para diversificar aún más su oferta, porque como mujer Santandereana, Graciela afirma “que sabe mucho de negocios, porque esa una gran tradición de los oriundos del departamento de Santander y es su característica principal.
texts.en: Graciela is a 44-year-old enterprising woman. She lives with her partner and their two children, ages 3 and 7, in the city of Barranquilla. She has a business there that offers many types of services. On the one hand she offers Internet and telecommunication services. She also sells clothes, sandals, school supplies and accessories. At a commercial corner in her own house, this business is called “Lina Marcela’s Variety Store”. She began this business five years ago. Her brothers, who also have a similar business, motivated her. She saw that their business went well and that is why she started her own business, selling clothes in different neighborhoods around her house. This is how she obtained her first customers. Three years ago she moved to another house. She installed her business in a good place. She was able to display clothes and also other articles such as stationary and general supplies. Finally she added new display counters and goods in order to expand her offerings. Her business now has four computers and their respective booths; She also sells mobile telephone services. She developed her business with her niece, who is a great teammate. She sells her items by layaway to her neighbors. Her dream is to convert her business into a main location with branches. It will help pay for the education of her children. She hopes for them to become professionals and successfully reach their potential. This loan from KIVA is the first loan that Graciela has received from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With it she will buy clothes, jewelry, paper articles, and ice cream in order to offer a greater diversity of products. As a Santander woman, Graciela says, “She knows a lot about business as it is what the people of the Santander Department are famous for and it is their principal characteristic”.

loans.use: to buy clothes, imitation jewelry, paper articles and ice cream in order to diversify her business.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob has been a mechanic for the past 22 years. He also sells motor vehicle spare parts. He is an aggressive and hard working 49 year old business man. He is married and blessed with six children who are school going. In the next five years, he wants to have trained young mechanics and to have a wholesale shop. His dream is to own his own garage and provide employment for other mechanics.

He wants a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 42-year-old artistically-gifted married woman, who is very handy when it comes to embroidery.

She adds embroidery to head covers, dresses, table covers, and she even makes embroidered wall hangings as shown in the picture.

Now Iman wants to buy an embroidery machine that can help her produce her pieces faster to be able to serve all her customers on time.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Aminatu

texts.en: Aminatu is married and has six dependents. She sells gari, maize and rice at Abura, which she has done for 10 years. Her husband is an Agric officer. She adds her income to that of her husband’s, to pay school fees and utility bills. Aminatu will use the loan to purchase additional bags of gari and maize for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aminatu plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional bags of gari and maize for sale.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is standing in front of the gallon barrels that she uses to store palm oil. At the time of the visit, Comfort had run-out of stock. She is a palm oil extractor at jukwa, a village at Abura. She has received junior high education. She is married to a teacher and has five children. Her husband is a teacher. Comfort has been a palm oil extractor for 8 years. She responsibly supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to process and to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruits to process and sell.

loans.name: Kusi Cuna Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Kusi Cuna esta compuesto por la siguiente mesa directiva: el  presidente del grupo  es el señor Grover, se dedica a la repostería en su propio domicilio se dedica a la elaboración de pan, galletas pero mas empanadas,  su especialidad son las empanadas de queso se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 13 años, su familia esta compuesta de su madre el es soltero, el mantiene a su familia una gran responsabilidad para el, el monto que solicito es para comprar  harina y manteca por mayor  principalmente para la elaboración de sus empanadas, es un joven muy trabajador, con ganas de superación su deseo es el de poder tener su propia pasteleria y realizar variedad de galletas y tortas, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que es un aoportunidad para salir adelante.
texts.en: The 'Kusi Cuna' community bank has a board of directors.  The group president, Grover, makes and sells confectionery from his own home.  He makes bread, cookies and empanadas.  His speciality is cheese empanadas.  He has been in this business for 13 years.  His family consists of his mother and himself.  He is single.  He supports his family which is a great responsibility for him.  He is requesting this loan to buy flour and butter wholesale, mainly for making empanadas.  Grover is a very hard-working young man who has a desire to improve himself.  He would like to own his own cake shop and make a variety of cookies and cakes.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided which has provided him with an opportunity to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy flour and butter for making empanadas

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: At a village called Jukwa, Adwoa sells second-hand clothes. She has been in this trade for 5 years and has been through junior high school. She is divorced and has three children. As a single parent, she pays school fees, feeds and clothes her children. She wishes to invest the amount she is going to receive into the clothing business so that she can take care of her children properly. The new profit that will be realized will be reinvested back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to invest into the clothing business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
The picture of Sarah was taken whilst she was on her rounds in the vicinity of Abura. She is a peddler of dried salted fish. She also makes palm oil. Some families use this type of fish in their soups and stews. The business is about 15 years old.

Sarah is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has received education up to junior high level. Sarah assists her husband in paying utility and other household expenses. The loan, when received, will be added to her capital to expand the fish business.

loans.use: to be added to her capital to expand the fish business.

loans.name: Yarlin Janette

texts.es: Yarlin Janette tiene 36 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 3 años en su negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ella siempre se esfuerza por complacerlos en los diferentes pedidos que le realizan. Ella tiene que alistarse muy temprano por las mañanas para preparar su bolso en donde transporta la mayoría de sus productos que son de manera ambulante. es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de cremas, bolsos, calzado, ropa en general, cosméticos, toallas, sabanas, shampoo, tratamientos y otros.
texts.en: Yarlin Janette is 36 years old and she has been a retailer for more than 3 years. The majority of her customers know that she always makes every effort to satisfy their different requests. She has to wake up very early in the mornings to prepare the bag in which she carries the majority of her products, since most of her sales are made out in the street. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy creams, bags, shoes, clothes, cosmetics, towels, bed sheets, shampoos and health treatments among other products.

loans.use: To buy creams, bags, shoes, clothes, cosmetics, towels, bed sheets, shampoos and health treatments.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua makes donuts and millet porridge for sale. She prepares this dish in the early hours of the morning, since most people prefer to eat it as breakfast. Ekua has received a senior high educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy flour, millet, sugar, salt, oil, and other ingredients. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy flour, millet, sugar, salt, oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Roberto Enrique

texts.es: Roberto, con su anterior credikiva agregó una línea telefónica, compró una vitrina y mercancías con las cuales surtió perfectamente y rotó los artículos de manera rápida. Él está muy contento por eso recurre a su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancías variada a un mayor volumen, que le permita obtener descuentos y ofrecerle buenos precios  a sus clientes para seguir posicionándose en el sector. Roberto envía el siguiente menaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Su apoyo es muy fundamental, ya que es una ayuda importante para que muchas familias que no tiene la oportunidad ni acceso a entidades prestatarias de recursos, para poder seguir adelante” . y “Que sigan con esta gran labor.”   Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Roberto ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/218344
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Roberto added a phone line, purchased a display case, and restocked with more merchandise that sold quickly. He is very pleased to be receiving his second Kiva loan so that he can buy merchandise in greater volume. This will allow him to obtain discounts and offer good prices to his customers so that he can continue positioning himself in this sector.

Roberto sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “Your support is very essential and has already been a great help to many families who do not have the opportunity or access to resources from lending institutions so that they can move forward and continue with their work.”

To learn more about Roberto’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/218344

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in greater volume.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children aged 11 and 9. She has been running a computer bureau for the last six years.  She does photocopying, typing and scanning. She wants a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a CPU, cartridges, toners and empty CDs. In the next five years, she wants to have opened up a cyber café and a photo studio.

loans.use: To buy a CPU, cartridges, toners and empty CDs

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. She is a palm oil extractor. Ama also sells corn and cassava dough (as in the photo above) at Abura. As part of her responsibilities, she assists her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more bags of corn and cassava to process into dough for sale. She anticipates reinvesting back into the business any increase in income as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase bags of corn and cassava to process into dough for sale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has four children. Her husband is a driver. Her schooling is up to the junior high level. In the photo above, Abena has some ceramic plates, jewelry and bowls around her. She moves from one area to another to sell them. She is also a baker. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Abena will use the loan to purchase more bowls and plates for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more bowls and plates for resale.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is divorced and has three children. She is a palm oil extractor at Abura, which she has done for seven years. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her children. The loan will be used to purchase more palm fruit to process to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to process to sell.

loans.name: Cayetana Evangelista

texts.es: Cayetana Evangelista tiene 56 años, su actividad es la producción de ladrillos. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, siempre se preocupa por brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes es una persona muy responsable y sabe que ha sido muy difícil mantener este negocio, debido a la gran competencia que existe, pero Cayetana siempre le brinda a sus clientes un buen servicio y excelente calidad en sus productos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de leña, arena, entre otros.
texts.en: Cayetana Evangelista is 56 years old and she produces bricks, an activity she has been running for more tan 20 years. She always does her best to offer a good service to her customers, she is a very responsible woman and she is aware that it has been very difficult to keep her activity going because of the existing strong competition, but Cayetana always offers her customers a good service and excellent quality products. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy firewood and sand among other products.

loans.use: To buy firewood and sand.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells large and small quantities of maize and gari (flour made from cassava) at Abura. She has a senior high educational background.  Esi is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize and gari to sell.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and gari (flour made from cassava) to sell.

loans.name: Diokore Endam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité diokoré endam a été créé il y'a trois années,il compte en son sein  20 membres issus du meme village.Elles ont pour activité principale le commerce.

Madame Fatou, levant le bras, vêtue d'une écharpe jaune, est responsable du groupement;elle est âgée de 54 ans,est mariée et mère de 07 enfants.Sa principale activité est l'élevage des moutons.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour cette activité puisqu'elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter d'autres moutons afin d'augmenter son troupeau.

Son objectif est  de renforcer sa capacité d'épargne en vue de faire l'élevage bovine.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Diokoré Endam  was created 3 years ago. It is made up of 20 women, all from the same village. Their main activity is trading.

Mrs. Fatou, hand raised, with a  yellow scarf, is the group's leader. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. Her main activity is raising sheep. She has plenty of experience, as she has been doing this for several years. The loan will allow her to buy more sheep so that she can increase her flock. Her goal is to increase her ability to save, so that she can raise cattle later on.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy large quantities of palm fruit to process for sale.

loans.name: Karambenor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Il  est  constitué de cinq femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge cinq autres enfants confiés par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en: This community group was created on the 3rd June 2010, and is made up of five women who live in the same quarter. They are all owners of small businesses. Madame Mariama (on the right of the photo with her hand raised) is the group leader. She is a 42 year-old married mother of eight, and looks after another five children. She has sold vegetables for a living for several years. This loan will enable her to boost her working capital and to better develop her business. The profits generated will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food and clothing etc.) and to increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 64, widowed and has four children. Her elder son is engaged in taxi services and the younger one is her main helper in her trading business.  She started it in 2004 with initial capital of 5,000 KGS and managed to raise her floating capital to 40,000 KGS. With the revenue, she was able to broaden her shop’s assortment of products. Amina has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS, part of which she needs for purchasing more foodstuff for the summer season like ice-cream, juices and water, and the rest of the sum is needed to buy a milk cow. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff for the summer season and to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Romain Preira Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Il est  constitué de huit femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Awa qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de savon. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This community group was created on the 3rd of June, 2010 and is made up of eight women who live in the same quarter. They all run small businesses. Madame Awa, who is on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is the group leader. She is 38 years old, and married with two children. She looks after another two children placed in her care by their parents. 
She has sold soap for a living for a number of years, and this loan will enable her to boost her working capital and develop the business. The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing etc) and to increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to purchase soap

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a hard-working 42-year-old businessman. He has been selling milk for the last eight years. He supplements his income from this venture by running a shop. Previously, he was selling groceries. He is married and blessed with four children who are in school. In the next five years, he wants to be a major distributor of milk. He wants a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase a milk can, empty egg trays and milk.

loans.use: To buy a milk can, empty egg trays and milk

loans.name: Batiyaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Il est composé de neuf femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit.

Madame Fatou Touty qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de bonbons. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This community group was created on the 3rd of June, 2010 and is made up of nine women who live in the same quarter. They all run small businesses. Madame Fatou Touty, who is on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is the group leader. She is 51 years old, and married with five children. 
She has sold sweets for a living for a number of years, and this loan will enable her to boost her working capital and develop the business. The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing etc) and to increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to purchase sweets

loans.name: Leuk Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Le groupe est composé de dix femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit.

Madame Binta qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants.

Elle s’active dans la vente de sac à main et d'habillement. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu'elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture etc.…).
texts.en:
This community group was created on the 3rd of June, 2010 and is made up of ten women who live in the same quarter. They all run small businesses. Madame Binta, who is on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is the group leader. She is 49 years old, and married with seven children. 
She has sold handbags and clothes for a living for a number of years, and this loan will enable her to boost her working capital and develop the business. The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing etc) and to increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to purchase handbags and dresses

loans.name: Batiyaye Djisofor Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Le groupe est  composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Dialika qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de six enfants à sa charge. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de balaies. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This community group was created on the 3rd of June, 2010 and is made up of eleven women who live in the same quarter. They all run small businesses. Madame Dialika, who is on the right with her hand raised in the photo, is the group leader. She is 51 years old, and is a widow with six children. 
She has sold rakes for a living for a number of years, and this loan will enable her to boost her working capital and develop the business. The profits will enable her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing etc) and to increase her level of savings.

loans.use: to purchase rakes

loans.name: Nicasio Antonio

texts.es: Nicasio Antonio tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años  que tiene esta actividad, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de manera muy independiente. Debido a que él se había jubilado quería un ingreso estable que le proporcionara ayuda para su familia. El financiamiento que ofrece es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, pan, refrescos, papel higiénico, enlatados y sopas. Su objetivo es surtir su inventario para proporcionar a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en: Nicasio Antonio runs a corner shop, an activity he has been engaged in for more than 6 years, as he has always liked working independently. After having retired, he wanted to earn a regular income that would help his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, detergents, bread, drinks, toilet paper, canned food and soups. His goal is to supply his inventory to offer a wide variety of products to his customers.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, detergents, bread, drinks, toilet paper, canned food and soups.

loans.name: Diamoral Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03 juin 2010. Ledit groupe est  constitué de douze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Mba Fatoumata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 28 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge deux autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce secteur d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…).
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 3, 2010. It comprises twelve women who live in the same area. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Mba Fatoumata (at the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's official. She is 28 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She also supports two other children entrusted to her by her parents. 

She is active in selling vegetables. She has good experience in this sector of work, since she has been working at it for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.).

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Dona Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DONA est formé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Alice, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Alice est âgée de 46 ans et est une veuve ayant quatre enfants dont un reste encore à sa charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Alice vit donc seule avec son enfant encore à sa charge. Il y a près de vingt ans que Alice prépare de la bouillie de maïs et de sorgho, qu'elle vend de façon ambulante. Parallèlement à cette activité qui lui procure des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens, Alice vend également de l'"akassa" (aliment local préparé à base d'amidon de maïs) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Alice s'approvisionne dans un marché du  Sud du Bénin. Dans le souci de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Alice désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Alice sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DONA, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The DONA group is made up of four persons who live in the same neighborhood in Bénin. The representative of the group, Alice, is the one who is raising her hand in the photo. It's the second time that this group is requesting financial aid from  ALIDé in order to raise the level of their businesses. 

Alice is 46 and a widow with four children, of whom one is still under her care. Among her children, some are enrolled in school. Alice lives alone with the child she is still raising. For almost 20 years she has been making maize and sorghum porridge and selling it on foot. At the same time as this business, which brings in income to cover her daily needs, Alice makes "akassa" (a local specialty made of cornstarch) which she sells at her home. 

Alice buys her supplies in a market in the south of Bénin. Wishing to bolster her business and better respond to the needs of her clientele, Alice would like to request, together with the other members of the DONA group, a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Soforal Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 03juin 2010. Il est composé de quatorze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Diariétou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants. 

Elle s’active dans la vente de rafraichissement(crème glacée, de la bouillie de mil etc...). Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on June 3, 2010. It comprises fourteen women who live in the same area. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Diariétou (at the right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's official. She is 53 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children. She is active in selling refreshments (ice cream, millet porridge, etc.) She has good experience in this domain of work, since she has been working at it for several years. 

This loan will enable her to boost her capital and to develop her business further. The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health, food, clothing, etc.) and to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, "monkey bread", and some ingredients

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia nació en la ciudad de Espinar del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 46 años de edad. Actualmente, Julia vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus cinco hijos. Julia es cocinera y trabajaba en el restaurante turismo “Yanapay” pero tuvo que renunciar. Ahora, Julia piensa abrir un cafetín en la ciudad de Espinar y con el préstamo que pide desea comprar vajillas como por ejemplo platas, tazas y copas. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoq Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Julia was born in Espinar, a town located in the Cusco department, and she is 46 years old. Julia currently lives in the town of Cusco with her five children. Julia is a cook: she used to work in the tourist restaurant “Yanapay” but she had to resing. Julia is now considering opening a small café in Espinar, and she wants to use the loan she is requesting to buy crockery such as silverware, bowls and glasses. She is a responsible and hardworking person, and thanks to these qualities her fellow members invited her to become a member of “Mosoq Killa”, a communal bank of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: To buy silverware, bowls and glasses.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a hard-working 36-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children aged 10 and 8. Samuel has been running a milk bar for the last seven years. He earns extra income by operating a cafeteria. In the next five years, he wants to be a major distributor of milk in his local community. Samuel wants a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more milk.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria de 45 años de edad es una mujer consagrada a su único hijo de 2 años de edad, con el que sueña construirle un futuro exitosos, trabajando fuertemente en su negocio, a través del cual vende mercancía al detal, principalmente ropa, cremas y en general productos de belleza, mediante el sistema de contado en punto comercial y a crédito y en plazos pactados de acuerdo a las posibilidades de pago de sus clientes. 
Desde el año 1985 Maria trabajó durante 22 años en Venezuela, país fronterizo, logrando ahorrar un dinero con el que regresó en el año 2007 a su querida Colombia y compró mercancía para dedicarse al negocio ya mencionado.  Ella inició con un mercado doméstico entre sus más cercanos familiares, vecinos y amigos, vendiéndole ropa interior, deportiva, cubre lechos, artículos para el hogar, pero gradualmente su clientela ha crecido y también ha diversificado su mercancía, agregándole especialmente productos de belleza en una vitrina que surte en su propia casa, como punto comercial, además de un local en un centro comercial bien posicionado, donde exhibe sus mercancías.  Su sueño más adelante es contar con una vivienda propia y apoyar el emprendimiento en su familia, igualmente  ampliar su negocio, con nuevos puntos comerciales para continuar día  a día generando ingresos que le permitan crecer y fortalecer su sueño de bienestar con su pequeño hijo. Su Credikiva es el primer financiamiento, que Maria hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con él comprará mercancías que le permitirán actualizar sus inventarios con los productos que más rotan, pues son apetecidos por su clientela, por la que cada día perfecciona sus estrategias mercadológicas con tal de fidelizarla.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and she is a woman who is devoted to her only child, a 2-year old son, to whom she dreams of giving a successful future. She works very hard in her business and through it she sells merchandise in retail, primarily clothing, skin lotions, and general beauty products. She completes her sales in cash and on credit. Payments are worked on based on the clients' ability to pay.

Starting in 1985 Maria worked in Venezuela for 22 years, a neighboring country. She managed to save some money and in 2007 she returned to her beloved country, Columbia. She purchase merchandise to start the above-mentioned business. She started out in a local market, among her closest relatives, but gradually her clientele increase and she diversified her merchandise. She included beauty products displayed in a display case in her own home. She also has a store in a well situated shopping district where she displays her merchandise. Her dream for the future is to own her own home and to support small businesses in her family. She also wants to expand her business and to generate new business opportunities to continue to earn money day after day. It will help her to grow and strengthen her dream to provide her son with wellbeing. Her Kiva loan is her first loan that Maria accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it she will purchase merchandise which will permit her to supply her inventory with the products that sell best, those that her clients demand the most. Every day she perfects her market strategies with the goal of earning their loyalty.

loans.use: to supply her inventory of products which are in highest demand.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al bA. comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El bA. está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de librería, el vende cuadernos, libros, lápices y tarjadores, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor para la librería.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco. 

She is 36 years old, married, and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her office supply business. She sells notebooks, books, pencils and binders. She works from 7am to 6pm. It is through this business that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her office supply business. She requests a loan to purchase merchandise in wholesale for her supply store.

She is happy for her loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies in wholesale for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and renovate her business premises

loans.name: Marbet

texts.es:
La señora Marbet  vive en a la localidad de Emiliano Zapata ella es casada con el señor Obet y con quien procreo  cuatro hijos quienes tres ya están  casados  y uno está a su responsabilidad  de la edad de dieciseis años.

    Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas, compra su mercancia en la ciudad de Tuxtla Gutiérrez para luego salir a venderla en la comunidades cercanas de  su localidad, en esta actividad lleva  veinte años y comenta que le va  bien  ya que con ello ha estado apoyado a su esposo ha sacar adelante a sus hijos  y se siente muy orgullosa de cada uno de ellos.

    Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su mamá ya que le dijo que es un negocio muy bueno que da resultados y deja una mejor ganancia con la que se apoyaría para mejorar su estado económico.

     Su más grande deseo es que con el préstamo y su actividad pues lograr incrementas más día con día para que su clientela se sienta satisfecha con una mejor calidad de ropas y con ellos mismo pueda ahorra para tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
Marbet lives in the community of Emiliano Zapata. She is married with Obet and they have four children together. Three are already married and one is still in their care and is 16 years old. 

She buys and sells clothing. She purchases her merchandise from Tuxtla Gutierrez to later resell to the communities near her house. She has been in business for twenty years and she stays that it is going well. With it she has been able to help her husband to provide for their kids and she is very proud of each one of them.

The motivation for her business came from her mother. She told her that it is a very good business and that it yields results, which it will provide her with better earnings with to help improve her finances.

Her greatest dream is to increase her business day after day with the help of her loan. She wants to keep her clients satisfied with a better quality of clothing, and to save to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for later resale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 71 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, el tiene un terreno de cultivo en el distrito de Limatambo en la provincia de Anta y también el socio es cesante de una empresa que venden fideos, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de cultivo de paltas. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar maquinaria para cultivar las paltas.
                                                 
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
He is a member of the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco, and the department of Cusco.

He is 71 years old, married, and he has 3 children. He alternates his daily activities with his agriculture business. He has land for cultivation in the district of Limatambo in the province of Anta. He also has a business selling pastas. It is through these businesses that he is able to provide for his children. He wants to expand his avocado cultivation. 

He is happy for his loan and he is committed to making his loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase equipment that will help him cultivate avocadoes.

loans.name: Rocio De Jesus

texts.es:
Roció de 47 años vive ene le municipio de Soledad con su esposo y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 22 y 29 años. Desde las Gaviotas, el barrio donde habita se dedica a la venta de refrescos y bebidas, negocio con el cual logra apoyar el sustento de su hogar. 
Roció trabajaba anteriormente como jefe en una lavandería y por enfermedad debió abandonar su empleo por insistencia de su esposo y de sus hijos. Posteriormente cuando estuvo recuperada decidió emprender su propia aventura vendiendo cervezas, inicialmente una sola canasta, y gradualmente  agregó algo de música y aumentó el volumen de ventas. Así mismo decidió vender productos de belleza, vitaminas, accesorios, mediante  guías especializadas, a varias empresas empezando con los compañeros de trabajo de su esposo, amigas, vecinos referidos y poco a poco ha ido   creciendo en ambos negocios pues aprovecha toda oportunidad de venta de manera simultánea.  En la actualidad requiere aumentar su capital de trabajo para compra cajas de cervezas en mayor volumen, productos de nutrición y reparaciones al piso del exterior de su negocio; todo esto preparándose para la segunda temporada del año, época en la cual repuntan sus ventas desde Junio con las nivelación en los ingresos y gastos, por efecto causados por las primas y bonificaciones que reciben los empleados durante este mes. Su meta más adelante,  es tener un punto de encuentro sano y divertido estilo campestre, donde las familias se reúnan para integrarse y pasarla rico comiendo, bebiendo y bailando.
texts.en:
Rocio is 47 years old and he lives in the municipality of Soledad with her husband. They have two children, aged 22 and 29. In her community of Gaviotas she sells soft drinks and alcoholic drinks. It is a business through which she is able to support her household.

Rocio worked previously as the manager of a laundry shop but for health reasons she left her employment. Her husband and children insisted. Later, when she had recovered, she decided to start out her own adventure, selling beer. She started out with only one case but later she added some music and her sales volume increased. She also started to sell beauty products, vitamins, accessories through specialized catalogues. She sold to various companies, her husband's work colleagues, friends, neighbors, and to references. Gradually she has increased both businesses, taking advantage of every opportunity for simultaneous sales. She wants to increase her working capital to purchase cases of beer in greater quantities, nutrition products, and to carry out repairs to the flooring outside of her business. All of this is done in preparation for the second season of the year. This time of year sales rebound, starting in June when earnings and expenses are leveled. This occurs because during this month employees receive their bonuses and benefits. Her goal for the future is to have a healthy and fun country life where all the families come together and spend comfortable times eating, drinking, and dancing.

loans.use: to purchase beer in greater quantities, nutritional supplements, and to repair the flooring in her business.

loans.name: Book  Khol Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Book khol est crée le 31 mai 2007. Il est composé de de femmes toutes habitant le même quartier et qui mènent la même activité. La dame en médaillon (membre du groupe) était absente lors de la prise de la photo.

Mariama debout à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant la main est la responsable. Elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de jus de fruits et de glaces au niveau de l'école du quartier. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de financer son activité par l'achat de produits et d'intrants pour la vente.

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de sa progéniture et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Book Khol was created on May 31, 2007. It is composed of women who all live in the same area and who have the same work. The lady in the photo insert (group member) was absent when the photo was taken. 

Mariam (standing at the far right in the photo with her hand raised) is the group's official. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She sells fruit juices and ice at the district's school. 

Her new loan will enable her to finance her business by the purchase of products and ingredients to be sold. Her goal is to help support her children and to boost her savings.

loans.use: to buy raw materials ("monkey bread", hibiscus flowers), sugar, and ingredients for juices; and water and plastic pouches.

loans.name: Marco Alexander

texts.es: Marco Alexander  nació en la ciudad de Arequipa (Perú) y tiene 37 años de edad. Actualmente, Marco Alexander  vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con sus cinco hijos. Marco Alexander  es músico de profesión y es especialista en percusión, el también tiene un pequeño grupo musical llamado “Son Bahía” y anima fiestas patronales, matrimonios y otros eventos. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Marco Alexander y su esposa julia desean abrir un pequeño cafetín en la ciudad de espinar y desean el crédito para implementar el local y desean comprar vajillas como por ejemplo platos, cuchillos, tazas, vasos, copas y otras cosas más. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Marco Alexander was born in the city of Arequipa (Peru) and he is 37 years old. Currently Marco Alexander lives in the city of Cusco together with his five children. Marco Alexander is a musician by profession, specializing in percussion. He also has a small group band named "Son Bahia" and they play on feast days, weddings, and other events. He has been in business for 25 years and it has gone very well given the determination he invests in his work. Marco Alexander and his wife, Julia, want to open a small cafeteria in the city of Espina. They want the loan to set up the store and to purchase implements such as plates, knives, cups, glasses, wine glasses, and other items. He is a responsible and hardworking person and it was for these qualities that his colleagues invited him to participate in their communal bank, named "Mosoc Killa", a member of Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase kitchen implements such as plates, knives, cups, glasses, wine glasses, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  tiene 64 años de edad y es casada y tiene 6 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de golosinas, ella vende chupetes, caramelos, chicles entre otras golosinas, ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante  a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como chupetes, caramelos y chicles. 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

She is 64 years old, married, and she has 6 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business selling sweets. She sells suckers, caramels, gum and other sweets. She works from 6am until 8pm. It is through this business that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her sweets business. She requests a loan to purchase sweets such as suckers, caramels, and gum.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase sweets such as suckers, caramels, and gum.

loans.name: Maria De Refugio

texts.es:
La señora María de Refugio, vive en la  localidad de Emiliano Zapata, ella es madre soltera con tres hijos quien, una ya está casada y dos estan su responsabilidad y son: Palmira Anahi de catorce años y el más pequeño es Roberto de seis años de edad.
   Ella se  dedica a  su cocina económica y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en a compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de comidas,en donde lleva doce años y ocho meses, ella comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso en su actividad.
   Lo que lo inspiro fue su propia decisión ya que su esposo la abandono y para salir adelante tenía que tener una actividad la cual le dejara una buena ganancia  para darles lo más necesario a sus dos hijos.
   Lo que más desea  es que con esta pequeña actividad logre tener un ahorro  de lo que más delante pueda disponer para seguir apoyando a su  hijos que está estudiando y su hijo más pequeño.
texts.en:
Maria de Refugio lives in the community of Emiliano Zapata. She is a single mother of three children. One of them is married and two are still her responsibility. They are: Palmira Anahi, 14 years old, and the youngest is Roberto, 6 years old.

She sells fast foods and she requests a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare her foods. She has been in business for twelve years and eight months. She says that it has gone well and that she has earned good profits with her business.

She was motivated by her own decision after her husband left her. In order to move forward she needed to have a business that would earn good profits, to provide her two children with what they needed most.

What she wishes most is to save some money through her small business so that in the future she will continue to be able to support her children who are in school, and to support her youngest son.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to prepare foods.

loans.name: Amen Group

texts.fr: AMEN est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Afiavi Nadine(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Afiavi Nadine est mariée à un certain Ernest. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Afiavi Nadine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges du foyer. Afiavi Nadine a appris la coiffure et exerce cette activité depuis sept ans environs. A côté de cette activité qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables, Afiavi Nadine vend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches dans son atelier. Afiavi Nadine achète ses produits au Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Afiavi Nadine sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les membres du groupe AMEN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: AMEN is a two-person group whose members live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, Afiavi Nadine (raising her hand in the photo), is 32 years old and lives in Benin. Afiavi Nadine is married to a man named Ernest. They have three children in their care, two of whom are their own. All children go to school. Afiavi Nadine and her husband live together with their children and jointly provide for various household needs. Afiavin Nadi is a learned hairdresser and has been working in this trade for about seven years. In addition to this work, which brings her significant income, she also sells cosmetics and hair extensions in her salon. Afiavi Nadine stocks up in Benin and in Nigeria. Striving to meet her clients’ needs, Afiavi Nadine is seeking a second loan as part of the AMEN group. This loan will help group members better meet customer demand and increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de una consultoría sobre ingeniería, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar en su trabajo. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la licitación de su empresa que presta servicios.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". It is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

She is 38 years old, married common-law, and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily activities with her engineering consulting company. She works from 8am to 7pm and it is through this work that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to improve her work. She requests a loan to cover the tender fees incurred by the business' services.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: to cover the tender fees incurred by the business' services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cold cuts to meet the demand from 250 school cafeterias.

loans.name: Estelle Rajy

texts.fr:
Femme de 33ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant âgée d'une année, ayant arrête ses études en terminale et n'ayant plus de soutien financier elle se lance dans le commerce en 2009. Son revenu journalier a augmenté  de 50000frs à 100000frs par jour. 

A l'octroi de son troisième prêt, elle compte approvisionner son stock en ajoutant des cartons de viande et de cuisse de poulet, poissons frais, volailles, condiments, cartons de tomate, bidon d'huile... 

Elle s'approvisionne dans les chambres froides et marches de la place, toujours prêt a réserver un bon accueil a ses clients, offrir ses meilleurs services, faire des prix abordables, et respecter les heures d'ouverture de son resto son ses priorité.

Nous avons constaté que son activité s’est élargie ainsi que ses prestations car elle à maintenant plusieurs plats qu’elle offre à ses clients et ceux grâce au second prêt qu’elle avait obtenu. Pour  l'avenir elle pense ouvrir un grand restaurant et épargner plus, pour soutenir son enfant et acheter un terrain.
texts.en:
This is a 33-year-old unmarried woman who is the mother of a 1-year-old child. Having dropped out of her senior year of high school and having no more financial support, she started working in commerce in 2009. Her daily income has increased from 50,000 to 100,000 francs per day. 

Upon being granted her third loan, she intends on stocking up by including boxes of meat and chicken thighs, fresh fish, poultry, condiments, boxes of tomatoes, containers of oil… 

She gets her supplies from cold rooms and local markets. Always ready to accommodate her customers, her priorities are to offer her best service and affordable prices and to keep to her hours of operation at her restaurant.

We have noticed that her business has expanded, as well as her range of offerings, because she now has several dishes she offers customers, thanks to the second loans she had obtained. For the future, she is thinking of opening a big restaurant and saving more money, so as to support her children and to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy chicken thighs, fresh fish, and poultry

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Mwajabu, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children who are going to school.  She has had a business selling clothes for 10 years now.  She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the clothes sales and also for a poultry business. She has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan so she can start distributing her clothes upcountry.  Her dream is to one day be an international businesswoman.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Karibu View" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To distribute  her clothes upcountry

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía  es de la localidad de Emiliano Zapata, ella es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos quienes ya todos están casados y son su mejor orgullo.
Ella se dedica a la compra de trastes de peltre como son: ollas, platos, vasos, tazones, entre otros, también elabora panes  y solicito el préstamo para  apoyarse con la compra de  ingredientes como son: harina, huevo, aceite, queso, entre otros y con lo demás va a comprar más trastes, es así como ella trabaja el préstamo que ha estado solicitando.
Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su familia ya que para salir adelante tenía que buscar la manera de poder solventar sus gastos que se generaban día con día en la educación de sus hijos y con ellos lleva treinta y dos años y le va bien.
Su único deseo es que la sigan apoyando con el crédito para seguir trabajando hasta que dios  le preste vida.
texts.en:
Sofía is from the community of  Emiliano Zapata. She is divorced and has four children. All of them are already married and they are her pride and joy.  
She buys and sells plastic dishes such as bowls, plates, glasses, and cups, among others. She also needs the loan for support in the purchase of ingredients such as flour, eggs, oil, and cheese, among others. With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy more dishes. That is how she will work with the loan she has asked for.  

What motivated her to do this activity was her family, since in order to get ahead, she had to look for a way to pay her daily expenses raising her children. She has been with them for 32 years and it has gone well for her.  

Her only wish is to continue to be supported with the loan in order to keep working as long as God gives her life.

loans.use: to buy plastic and then sell it in the same community. Also, to buy ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Sugheylis

texts.en:
Sugheylis worked two jobs to save up for her new neighborhood deli. She enjoys being self-sufficient and having the opportunity to help family members back home in Venezuela and Mexico. Sugheylis works full-time as a personal administrative assistant at a wholesale fish distributor and works at her deli on the weekends while her fiancé manages it during the week. Although she is proud of the growing family business that she has created, Sugheylis realizes that she needs better restaurant/food equipment to increase sales and efficiency.
 
With this loan from ACCION USA, Sugheylis will be purchasing a new grill, freezer, and air conditioner for her deli. She looks forward to starting her own family in the future and hopes that the business that she created will be something of which the entire family can be proud.

loans.use: to purchase a new grill, deli freezer and air conditioner for her deli

loans.name: Marie Irene Ida

texts.fr:
Femme de 49ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varient entre 22 à 10 ans. Ayant quitté sa scolarité tôt par manque de soutien financier elle s'est lancé dans le commerce de vente des ustensiles de plastiques, des sandales, des bombons, biscuits en 1990 afin de palier à la crise financière et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.son revenu journalier varie de 20000frs à 25000frs. Étant trésorière de son groupe elle à bien conduit son groupe et à fait preuve d’un bon remboursement du prêt précédent.  

Avec ce troisième prêt elle compte renforce son activité en achetant des plastiques tel que des paniers, des cuvettes, des bassines, des bols, des sceaux, des sucreries (bombons, biscuits kwik, biscuit téléphone, biscuit chocolat), des sandales (slip, soutien) et bien d'autres choses. 

Sa stratégie est de bien ranger son étalage afin de mieux attirer ses clients, le bon accueil, et épargner du jour au jour. 

Elle a pour vision d'avoir une grande boutique dans le futur, s'acquérir un terrain et mettre ses enfants dans des bonnes conditions. Elle est un bon exemple des femmes de son quartier.
texts.en: This is a 49-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children, aged 10 to 22 years. Having dropped out of school early due to a lack of financial support, she got started in commerce selling plastic ware, sandals, candy, and cookies in 1990 in order to alleviate the financial crisis and to support her family. Her daily income varies from 20,000 to 25,000 francs. As the treasurer of her group, she has conducted her group well and has proven herself by repaying the previous loan. With this third loan, she intends to bolster her business by buying some plastic ware, such as baskets, cups, basins, bowls, and buckets, and some sweets (candies, Kwik cookies, telephone cookies, chocolate cookies), sandals (slip, soutien), and many other items. Her strategy is to fix up her display in order to attract more customers, accommodate them, and save money from day to day. Her vision is to have a big store in the future and to acquire a plot of land, and to put her children in a good environment. She is a good example for the women in her district.

loans.use: to buy plastic ware, such as baskets, cups, and basins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new tires, used chairs and fresh paint for his livery cab

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new ingredients and seasonings to expand his product offering.

loans.name: Damola

texts.en:
Damola started his publication wholesale business in 1999 to provide both a voice and opportunity for urban entrepreneurs. The business distributes wholesale books, magazines and DVDs to a distributor which ships the publications to large bookstores. The business also sells retail and Damola deals directly with 1,000 small businesses.  Up until now, Damola has distributed four print magazines and a yearly DVD series.  Beginning this month, he is launching a new digital application that will allow his readership to purchase digital magazine content, as well as video and audio content. Damola began developing the digital application and content in March 2010, and at the same time he also invested in rebranding the business with cleaner logos and a wider target audience.  

In addition to the new digital content, Damola is also expanding into merchant services to exemplify the entrepreneurial focus of his publications.  On his website, he will resell merchant services for his readership and provide links to business-related websites.  He also plans to have a direct marketing campaign and will use the digital application to promote the merchant services available on the website.  

Damola would like a loan with ACCION USA to advertise his business. He hopes to continue being a guide for the modern entrepreneur through media and technology.

loans.use: to advertise his business and create a direct marketing campaign

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  juices, fruits, bags, straws, soda, bread, cookies and more.

loans.name: Don De Dieu Group

texts.fr: DON DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La présidente du groupe, Françoise (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Faustin. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. Françoise et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs deux enfants. Françoise a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au secondaire. Il y a deux ans environs que Françoise fait le commerce des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Françoise s’approvisionne au Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Françoise sollicite pour la première fois un crédit avec les autres membres du groupe DON DE DIEU.
texts.en:
DON DE DIEU is a group composed of three persons whose members reside in the same district. The group's president, Françoise (with her hand raised in the photo), is 30 years old and married to a teacher by the name of Faustin. They have two children, all in school and still in their care. Françoise and her husband live together with their two children. She has a secondary school education. 

For about two years, Françoise has been doing commerce in rechargeable phone cards. She is supplied from Benin. This business enables her to support herself and her children. Seeking to satisfy her customers, she, along with the others members of the group DON DE DIEU, is requesting a loan for the first time.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.es: Sebastián es una persona muy luchadora y disfruta de su actividad económica. Hace más de 39 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de sastrería, el ha sabido administrar su negocio y la mayoría de sus clientes saben que el ofrece un excelente servicio con sus prendas. El empieza su labor desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche el confecciona pantalones, camisas, trajes uniformes entre otros. El crédito es para la compra de materia prima como telas, zipper, botones, hilos, agujas, tijeras entre otros.
texts.en: Sebastián is a very hard-working person who enjoys his work.  For more than 39 years he has been providing a tailoring service.  He has known how to run his business and most of his customers know that he offers an excellent service.  He starts working at 7.00am and works until 9.00pm, making pants, shirts, suits, uniforms, etc.  He will use this loan to buy raw materials such as fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, needles, scissors, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, threads, needles, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Thes Jarrel

texts.fr:
Jeune commerçant de 27ans, célibataire et père d'un enfant âgé de 5ans. Ayant fini ses étude secondaire et n'ayant plus de soutien il débute son commerce avec la vente de boissons en 2007 avec un capital de 150.000 et se lance dans l'alimentation en 2008. Son revenu journalier est de 70000frs à 90000frs. Il a fait preuve d’une bonne gestion et d’un bon remboursement lors du 2e prêt.

Avec ce prêt troisième il aimerait agrandir son activité en achetant des cartons de lait, de boite de conserve, des friandises, des cartons de savons et des jus importés. 

Il à pour stratégie, d'ouvrir tôt afin d'être fidèle à l'accueil de ses clients, ouvrir un bon service, bien évaluer ses marchandises. Il veut épargner de jour en jour pour atteindre son but.

Il se bat pour l'épanouissement de sa famille et que ses enfants vivent dans des meilleures conditions. C’est un jeune qui est connu dans son quartier du petit au pus grand grâce à ses exploits.
texts.en:
A young entrepreneur, 27 years old, single and the father of a 5-year child. Lacking financial support after finishing high school, he launched a beverage selling business in 2007, with a starting capital of 150,000, and started selling groceries in 2008. His daily receipts are from 70,000 to  90,000. He manages his business well and repaid the previous loan properly.

With this third loan, he would like to expand his business in buying boxes of milk, canned [tinned] food, sweets, soap and imported juices. His strategy is to open early, offer a friendly welcome and good service and price his wares in a reasonable way. He would like to be able to save day to day in order to achieve his goals.
He is struggling to improve the well-being of his loved ones so that his [child] may have better life conditions. He is well-known by young and old in his neighborhood thanks to his business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of milk, canned food etc.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer. She operates a chop bar (a place where people come to eat different kinds of food) at Abura. In the photo above, she is standing by the bags of maize and cassava dough she uses to cook banku. She cooks food like banku and fufu (banku made from maize and cassava and plantain made by pounding together cooked cassava and plantain), rice bolls, etc. She wants to expand her business; a loan from Kiva will be invested to buy food items like bags of maize and cassava to cook to sell.

loans.use: a loan from Kiva will be invested to buy food items like bags of maize and cassava to cook to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through senior high school. Abena buys fresh fish to smoke for sale at Jukwa market near Abura in Cape Coast. She wants to sell other types of fish and so needs a loan to buy varieties of fish to smoke for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy varieties of fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Abena went to a vocational school. She has been a hairdresser at Abura for four years. She assists her husband to provide the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more hair creams, lotions, etc. to use on her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional hairdryer.

loans.use: to buy more hair creams, lotions, etc. to use on her customers.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is a widow taking care of two children. For the past seven years, she has been selling cosmetics, blouses and kente clothes at Abura. The income she is able to raise from the sale of these goods is used to educate her children. She wishes to increase her business and so needs a loan of 800 GHS to be able to buy more cosmetics to sell. Her future plan is to build a shop for the business.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Alba Marina

texts.es: Alba Marina tiene 56 años, su actividad es una librería. Ella tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación León 2000, por lo que se siente muy bien ya que los créditos han sido de gran ayuda. Inicio este medio de vida por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos del hogar, ya que no tenía un trabajo estable y con este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia. El crédito es para la compra de  lápices, hojas, cartulinas, lápices de colores, borrador, reglas y cuadernos.
texts.en:
Alba Marina is 56 years old and runs a stationery store.  She has been a client of Fundación León 2000 for a long time and she feels very happy because the loans have been a great help to her.  She started out in this business because she needed to cover her household expenses as she didn't have a stable job.  Through this business, she has been able to support her family.

Alba Marina will use this loan to buy pencils, paper, card, colored pencils, erasers, rulers and composition books.

loans.use: to buy pencils, paper, card, colored pencils, erasers, rulers and composition books

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni vive en el barrio Los Cedros del municipio de Soledad, con sus tres hijos en las edades de 14 a 21 años, con quienes sueña trabajar mucho para sentarle las bases de un futuro próspero.   Marleni tiene un negocio que consiste en vender mercancía en general como ropa, calzado, bolsos   productos domésticos, que distribuye entre comerciantes del centro de Barranquilla en calidad de créditos y recauda los fines de semana. Marleni está vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde hace 16 años en los cuales ha recibido 12 créditos, los que  ha invertido muy bien, logrando aumentar su capital de trabajo     y con ello sus ingresos  de manera significativa para aumentar el bienestar de su familia y su principal logro es que ha logrado mediante su trabajo persistente la  educación de sus hijos. Su credikiva es el financiamiento # 13 con el comprará jeans, calzado, carnes frías, suéteres y colonias, que tiene encargado con esta inversión planea  continuar incrementando su capital de trabajo una vez más, imprimiendo todo sus esfuerzos al fortalecimiento y la sostenibilidad de su negocio, cuya rentabilidad   es no menor del 43%.
texts.en:
Marleni lives in Los Cedros neighborhood, in the town of Soledad, with her three children who are between the ages of 14 and 21.  Marleni dreams of working hard so that she can lay the foundations for a prosperous future for her children.  She has a business selling general merchandise such as clothes, footwear, bags and household products which she delivers to salespeople in the center of Barrnquilla.  She provides the goods on credit and collects payment on the weekend.

Marleni has been working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for 16 years and has received 12 loans.  She invested them all very well and managed to increase her working capital and also significantly increase her income, thereby improving her family's well-being.  Her main achievement is that, through her persistent work, she has managed to provide her children with an education.  This Kiva loan is Marleni's 13th loan and she will use it to buy jeans, footwear, cold meats, sweaters and cologne which she has orders for.  Through this investment, she plans to continue increasing her working capital, putting all her efforts into strengthening her business and making it sustainable.  Her business profitability is no less than 43%.
