loans.use: to buy jeans, footwear, cold meats, sweaters and cologne

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: On Esther's head is a container holding various slippers which she sells by moving from one area to another at Abura. Esther has received senior high education. She is married and has been in this trade for three years. She helps her husband to take care of the home. The loan when received would be invested in buying slippers to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy slippers to sell.

loans.name: Los Trinfadores Group

texts.en: Rigoberto, Erika, and Reyna, all of whom reside in San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the “Los Trinfadores” solidarity group in June, 2011. Both Rigoberto and Erika make a living by selling clothing and small household appliances such as fans and irons. They are requesting loans of Lps. 5,000 with which to purchase merchandise. Reyna makes a living by running a small convenience shop, selling basic foodstuffs and household consumer products. She is requesting a loan of Lps. 5,000 to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, small appliances and convenience store merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa sells traditionally made soaps and pampers.  She is married and has 7 children.  Her husband is a carpenter. 

She uses her income to support her partner in the general upkeep of the home.  She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare soap to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare soap to sell.

loans.name: Everth Jose

texts.es: Everth José se dedica a una pulpería. Tiene más de 42 años, es un hombre muy trabajador. Inicio este medio de vida cuando no tenía el medio de ingreso necesario para mantener a su familia y necesitaba proporciónale el pan de cada día. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, detergentes, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas entre otras cosas. Sueña con mejorar cada día sus ingresos pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y proporcionar lo necesario.
texts.en: Everth Jose owns a store. He is 42 years old and a very hard working man. He started his business when he didn't have the necessary income to support his family and feed them every day. The reason for the funding request is to buy staples such as sweets, detergents, basic grains, juices, sodas and more. He dreams of  improving  his income  day after day  because  he has always enjoyed working and offering what's needed.

loans.use: to buy sweets, detergents, basic grains, juices, sodas and more.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is married and has 4 children.  She has been through senior high school.  Nana cooks rice, banku, and fried plantain at Abura, which she has done for 4 years.  

Her husband is a farmer.  Nana pays school fees and utility bills as a way of assisting her husband meet the needs of the home.  Nana will use the loan to purchase more food items to cook.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to build a better place for cooking.

loans.use: Nana will use the loan to purchase more food items to cook.

loans.name: Koko

texts.en:
Koko is into multiple businesses; hair dressing, selling cooking utensils, tops and jeans at Abura.  Koko went to a vocational school.  She is a single parent with a child. 

She is responsible for the well-being of the home.  Her loan will be used to buy more hair products to use on her customers hair.  Her new profit would be ploughed back into her businesses for further growth.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more hair products to use on her customers hair.

loans.name: Guadalupe Antia

texts.es: Guadalupe Antia tiene 37 años, ella tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo. Su actividad es la venta y elaboración de comida, tiene más de 4 años en este negocio a pesar de tener una gran variedad de clientes ella ha sabido satisfacer los diferentes gustos con sus platillos. Ella se levanta temprano todos los días ya que tiene que salir al mercado en busca de los diferentes productos para la elaboración de sus platillos y además empezar a cocinar para iniciar su labor a las 5 de la tarde hasta las 9 de la noche. El financiamiento es para la compra de frijoles, azúcar, arroz, aceité, verduras, platos desechables, bolsas, pollo y carnes.
texts.en: Guadalupe Antia is 37 years old and has one dependent child in her care.  Her business is making and selling food.  She has been in this business for more than four years.  In spite of the fact that she serves a wide variety of customers, she has known how to satisfy their different tastes with her dishes.  She gets up early every day since she has to go out to the market in search of different products with which to make her dishes.  She then starts cooking so that she can start her work at 5.00pm.  She works until 9.00pm.  This loan will be used to buy beans, sugar, rice, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, bags, chicken and meat.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, rice, oil, vegetables, disposable plates, bags, chicken and meat

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
For the past 5 years, Adwoa has been selling slippers, sandals and materials.  She is married and has 3 children.  Her husband is a mason. 

She has been through senior high school.  Adwoa, as part of her marital duties, assists her husband to pay utility bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more of the goods mention above to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase more slippers, sandals and materials to sell.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi sells utensils, plastics bucket, bowls and others at Abura in Cape Coast the Central Region of Ghana.  Asi has received a junior high education.  

She is a widow taking care of 2 children. She has been in this trade for 20 years. The loan when received would be added to her initial capital to buy utensils, plastic buckets and others to sell.  She would want to build a shop from the additional profit.

loans.use: to buy utensils, plastic buckets and others to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase half a ball of weaving yarns and one kilo of various colors of dyes.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is married and has 3 children. She attended senior high school. Ama sells palm oil, which she processes from palm fruit. Her husband is a farmer. Ama uses the income from her sales to support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. She will use the loan to purchase more palm fruit to process and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit to process and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of rice and other ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Castle Of Hope Group

texts.en: Alberto, Maria, and Doris all reside in San Lorenzo, Honduras.  They formed the "Castle of Hope" solidarity group in June 2011. Alberto and Maria both make a living by selling new clothing. In addition to clothing, Alberto also sells school supplies. Both are requesting loans of HNL 8,000 to purchase merchandise. Doris runs a small convenience shop in her village, selling basic foodstuff and household consumer products. She is requesting a loan of HNL 6,000 with which to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase shirts, pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, shoes, sandals, pens, pencils, paper and notebooks.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is holding some of the hair scarfs she sells. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a trader. Her business is just a year old and she wants to expand it by adding blouses to it.

The loan, when received, would be used to buy blouses in addition to the scarfs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Victoria plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to buy blouses in addition to the scarfs to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a seamstress in Abura and has received a junior high education. She is married and her husband is a teacher.

Gloria has been sewing for 3 years. She assists her husband in paying utility bills and other household expenses. Her loan will be used to buy materials, lining and other things so she can attract customers into her shop who will bring their dresses for sewing.  She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy an additional sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy materials, lining and other things so she can attract customers into her shop who will bring their dresses for sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to smoke for resale

loans.name: Basilio

texts.en:
Basilio’s acrylic-plastic fabrication business, Chito Plastics, is a culmination of his 31 years of experience in the plastics business.  Thirty-one years ago, Basilio began his career working with plastics fabrication as an employee at two plastics companies in Houston. Ten years later, he moved to El Paso, where he continued his work in acrylics. After 21 years, his employer in El Paso went out of business, leaving a giant void in the plastics market in his community. Basilio decided to start his business to fill the space left by the closure of his previous employer.

The idea to start his business, Basilio says, actually originated from his customers. After his previous employer went out of business, Basilio began to get phone calls from customers who remembered him from the quality work he had done for them. He says, “I had done a lot of work in El Paso and San Antonio, so customers knew me already. They began to call, and that’s what made me realize that I should try to go out on my own.”

Chito Plastics is founded on a simple philosophy of reliable customer service. The company offers literally any plastic product that fits a customer’s needs. Basilio has made products as varied as podiums for churches, museum displays, motorcycle windshields, bulk food containers and aquariums. He says, “When I do my work, I do it in a manner as professional and timely as possible. This causes people to refer my business to others, and that’s how I will keep my company successful.” In the future, he aims to continue growing his clientele base and keeping his current customers happy with his products.

Starting a business from nothing but a solid foundation of customer service and the promise of customers was not easy, however. Basilio began his business with $3,500 out of his own pocket, which he used to purchase machinery and materials. After he had exhausted his own finances, he turned to Kiva partner Accion Texas-Louisiana for the financial assistance he needed to complete his business’ start-up.

With this loan, Basilio will purchase the machinery and materials that he needs to complete his upcoming contracts. Without it, he says he would have had to go to commercial banks or exercise other credit options, such as credit cards, to complete these projects. It will allow him to continue to grow his business and reliably fill the plastic needs of his El Paso community.

loans.use: to pay for machinery and plastic materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salt by the 100lb bag

loans.name: Laure Rachel Estelle

texts.fr:
Femme couturière de 39 ans célibataire avec 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 7 et 21 ans. Quand elle finit sa formation en Coupe et Couture, sa mère lui fait cadeau d’une machine à coudre et elle ouvre un atelier de couture en 1996. Elle a une forte clientèle et elle a en moyenne 55000 a 60000 Frs par jour des recettes. 

Avec le troisième prêt qu’elle compte recevoir elle va acheter des tissus et pagnes et faire des camisoles, des chemises, des ensembles dames, des robes pour enfant qu’elle va vendre à ses clients et en dehors de cela il y a aussi les commandes de clientes qu’elle reçoit chaque jour. 

Les difficultés qu’elle rencontre se situent dans l’accumulation des commandes et les clients qui ne respectent pas leur rendez vous ainsi que par manque d’électricité stable qui ne lui permet pas de travailler jusqu’au soir. 

A l’avenir elle pense ouvrir une école de couture pour la réinsertion des jeunes filles mères et les aider à la longue à se prendre en charge Elle pense aussi continuer ses cours de designer pour être modéliste et faire des défiles de mode dans le futur.
texts.en:
Laure is a 39-year-old seamstress. She is single and the mother of three children whose ages vary between 7 and 21. When she finished her training in dressmaking, her mother gave her a sewing machine as a present. She opened a sewing shop in 1996. She has a strong customer base and brings in an average of 55,000 to 60,000 Frs each day.

With the third loan she is seeking, she plans to buy fabric and "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) and make camisoles, shirts, ladies' outfits, and children's dresses to sell to her clients. She also takes orders from her clients every day.

The difficulties she encounters include a backlog of orders, clients who miss appointments, and a lack of steady electrical supply which would allow her to work until the evening.

In the future she would like to open a sewing school for young, single mothers and help them learn to support themselves in the long term. She also plans to continue her design courses in order to become a designer and have runway shows in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabric and "pagnes" to make camisoles and shirts.

loans.name: Esther Maria

texts.es: Esther Maria tiene 46, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tiene más de 14 años en este negocio. A pesar de que no ha sido fácil mantener esta actividad la dedicación y empeño que ella proporciona le ha sido muy útil. Empezó por la necesidad de ayudar a su esposo a generar más ingresos para su hogar, juntos tienen un hijo menor de edad juntos luchan por proporcionarle ingresos necesarios Esther solicita el crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, shorts ya que sus clientes le solicitan variedad en sus productos.
texts.en:
Esther Maria is 46 years old.  She sells used clothing and has been in this business for more than 14 years.  In spite of the fact that it has not been easy to keep her business going, her commitment and effort have been very useful.  She started out in this business because she needed to help her husband make more income for their household.  The couple have one dependent child and they work hard to make the income they need. 

Esther is requesting this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and shorts as her customers are requesting variety in her products.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and shorts

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es:
Jairo nos visitó y manifiestá estar  muy feliz porque su hija Jaisa, cursará tercer semestre en la universidad y esto es gracias a los financiadores de Kiva,  que le han apoyado con este su tercer credikiva y muy seguramente le ayudarán hasta que se convierta en una profesional exitosa. Dice que su  hija es una excelente estudiante y merece todos los esfuerzos que la familia haga para que su futuro sea exitoso. El dice que su credikiva es un premio a las personas que tienen tiempo de estara vinculadas a la Fundación y que eso es muy bueno. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Jairo  puede ingresar a los siguientes enlaces:
http://kiva.org/lend/214472
http://kiva.org/lend/262004
texts.en:
Jairo visited us and told us that he is very happy because his daughter Jaisa is about to start her third semester at university and this is thanks to Kiva lenders who have supported him with this his third Kiva loan.  They will almost certainly help him until his daughter becomes a successful professional.  Jairo says that his daughter is an excellent student and deserves all the effort that her family is making to ensure she has successful future.  He says that the Kiva loan is a reward for people who have been working with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for some time and that this is very good. 

If you would like to know more about Jairo and his story, click on the following links:
http://kiva.org/lend/214472
http://kiva.org/lend/262004

loans.use: to educate his daughter

loans.name: Maribel Antonia

texts.es: Maribel Antonia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene más de 3 años de experiencia con este negocio. Inicio por una amiga que le sugirió que empezara a vender poco productos ya que Maribel no tenía mucho capital para  comprar variedad en sus productos, fue así que ella decide iniciar este medio de vida para mantener a su familia pues tiene un hijo a su cargo. Con el crédito comprara productos como bolsos, cremas, perfumes, calzado, joyas, ropa en general y otros.
texts.en:
Maribel Antonia's business is selling general merchandise.  She has more than three years experience in this business.  She started out through a friend who suggested she start selling a few products since she didn't have a lot of capital with which to buy a wide range of products.  She decided to start out in this line of work in order to support her family as she has one son in her care.  

Maribel Antonia will use this loan to buy products such as bags, creams, perfume, footwear, jewelry, clothes, etc.

loans.use: to buy bags, creams, perfume, footwear, jewelry, clothes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 21 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, el vende lápices labiales, perfumes y cremas y también tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi y también la socia estudia la carrera profesional de derecho, la socia quiere seguir adelante y ahorrar para seguir estudiando. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar comprar productos de belleza y para el pagar las mensualidades de sus estudios.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Patron san Sebastian Community Bank which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 21 years old and unmarried. As well as selling beauty products such as lipsticks, perfumes, and lotions, she has a car and runs a taxi service. She also is studying to become a lawyer. She wants to continue getting ahead in life and save some money so she can continue with her studies.

This member is seeking a loan to buy beauty products and to pay the monthly fees for her education. 

She is happy to be receiving a loan and promises to pay back the money.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and to pay the monthly fees for her education

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de hopedaje, ella es propietaria de una casa hospedaje donde atiende a turistas y estudiantes y también la socia estudia la carrera de diseño grafico, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de hospedaje y terminar de estudiar su carrera de diseño grafico. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la casa hospedaje y para pagar las mensualidades de su estudio de diseño grafico.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Patron san Sebastian Community Bank which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 23 years old and unmarried. As well as working in the hospitality business (she is the owner of a hostel for tourists and students), she is studying to be a graphic designer. She wants to expand her hospitality business and complete her graphic design course.

This member is seeking a loan to improve the hostel and to pay the monthly fees for her education. 

She is happy to be receiving a loan and promises to pay back the money.

loans.use: to improve her hostel and to pay the monthly fees for her education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, bread, detergent, soap, canned goods, toilet paper, and candy

loans.name: Mirian Suyapa

texts.en:
Mirian is married with three children and lives in San Lorenzo, Honduras. She makes a living by selling furniture, both made by her and procured elsewhere. In addition to furniture, Mirian sells small appliances and is able to use the family vehicle to make deliveries.

She is requesting a loan of 8,000 HNL with which to buy materials to make new pieces of furniture as well as purchase some appliances.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint, stain, sandpaper, glue, screws, and nails.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis vive en la localidad de  Emiliano Zapata, el vive en unión libre con las señora Mayra y con quien procreo tres hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Idar de tres años de edad, el otro es Miguel de dos años y el más pequeño es Luismar de once meses de edad.

El se dedica al campo y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de mercancía para surtir su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, en donde lleva  tres años  y  ocho meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ella  ha estado teniendo un buen ingreso en su actividad.
Su inspiración por esta actividad fue su familia ya que para darle lo mas necesario tenía que tener una actividad la cual el pueda darle un resultado para tener un mejor ingresos en su hogar.

Lo más desea es que con su pequeño  negocio pueda tener un menor ingreso y con el tiempo agrandar mas su tienda para seguir adelante y darle una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Luis lives in the town of Emiliano Zapata together with his common-law wife Mayra.  The copule have three children who are still in their care: 3 year-old Idar, 2 year-old Miguel and, their youngest, 11 month-old Luismar. 

José Luis works on the land.  He requested this loan to invest in buying merchandise to stock his small grocery store which he has run for three years and eight months.  He tells us that it is doing well and is making him good income.

José Luis' inspiration for his business was his family since, in order to cover their most basic needs, he had to have a business which would provide him with good results and make him more income for his household.

What José Luis wants most of all is for his small business to make him more income.  Over time, he would like to further expand his store in order to get ahead in life and provide his children with a better education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise with which to stock his grocery store

loans.name: Angelica Cecilia

texts.es: Angélica Cecilia tiene 36 años, su forma de salir adelante es muy humilde. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y disfruta cada día de su actividad como es la panadería, Angélica tiene 5 años de administrar su negocio. Inicio por su esposo quien tenía los conocimientos fue así que juntos decidieron iniciar este medio de vida y proporcionarles a sus hijos los ingresos que necesitan, Angélica tiene 2 hijos a su cargo de 13 y 15 años respectivamente. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de mantequilla, queso, harina, sartenes, leche, huevos entre otros.
texts.en: Angélica Cecilia is 36 years old.  Her way of making a living is very humble.  She is a hard-working woman who enjoys working in her bakery.  Angélica has been running her business for five years.  She started out through her husband who had knowledge in this area.  Together they decided to set up a business and provide their children with the income they need.  Angélica has two children in her care who are 13 and 15 years old.  She has requested this loan to buy butter, cheese, flour, skillets, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.use: to buy butter, cheese, flour, skillets, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 34 años de edad. Actualmente, Jaime vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con sus dos hijos. Jaime tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes turísticos, el nos cuenta que los dueños de hoteles se encargan de enviarle turistas nacionales e internacionales que se aventuran a visitar la ciudad del Cusco, el ofrece a estos turistas paquetes turísticos del Valle Sagrado de los Incas. Ya son 25 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Jaime en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar boletas turísticos y otras cosas más. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Jaime was born in the city of Cusco (Peru).  He is 34 years old and currently lives in the city in which he was born, together with his two children.  Jaime has a small tourist agency.  He tells us that hotel owners send him domestic and foreign tourists who want to visit the city of Cusco.  Jaime offers them tourist packages for visiting the Sacred Valley of the Incas.  He has been in this business for 25 years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.

On this occasion, Jaime needs a loan to buy tourist tickets and other items.  He is a responsible and hard-working person and, because of these personal qualities, his friends invited him to join Asociación Arariwa's "Mosoc Killa" community bank.

loans.use: to buy tourist tickets and other items

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr:
Femme de 34ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l'âge varie de 16ans à 2ans et a 3 personnes à sa charge, ayant quittée sa scolarité tôt après le décès de son père, étant ainé elle se lança dans la coiffure en 1995. Après avoir reçu son second prêt et faisant preuve d'une bonne gestion elle élargie son activité en se lançant dans les vivre frais au marché en fin mars 2011. Son revenu journalier est de 25000 à 45000 frs par jour.

Avec ce troisième prêt elle aimera agrandir son activité en achetant des vivres frais tels que des cartons de cuisse de poulet, des poissons de mer, des barbillons, des cartons de viande, des cartons de saucissons.

Sa stratégie est de faire des promotions de ses produits, avoir des prix abordable, avoir des meilleurs produits dans sa boucherie. 

Son ambition est d'aller acheter les produits de cheveux à l'étranger et être grossiste des produit vivre frais car elle pense beaucoup améliorer les conditions de vie de sa mère et de ses frères. Son entourage est content d'elle car elle se débrouille bien.
texts.en:
A 34-year-old woman, married with two children aged sixteen and two, she supports three persons. As an oldest child, she left school early following the death of her father. She started in hairdressing in 1995. After receiving her second loan and demonstrating good management skills, she expanded her business by venturing into selling fresh foods at the market at the end of March 2011. Her daily income is between 25,000 and 45,000 CFA.

With this third loan, she would like to expand her business by purchasing fresh goods such as boxes of chicken thighs, saltwater fish, coxcombs, and boxes of meat and dry sausages.

Her strategy is to promote her products, to offer affordable prices, and to have better products in her butcher shop.

Her ambition is to go purchase hair products abroad and to become a wholesaler for fresh products. She believes she can greatly improve the living conditions of her mother and her brothers. Her relatives are happy with her since she is doing well.

loans.use: to buy chicken thighs and saltwater fish.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita  es de una Localidad conocido como Emiliano Zapata, Municipio de Tecpatan Chiapas, ella es casada con el señor Javier y tienen un hijo de nombre Javier de siete años de edad.
Ella se dedica a la elaboración de comidas y solcito el préstamo para apoyarse con la compra de ingredientes como son: carne, verduras, tortilla, entre otros, en donde lleva dos años y esta contenta porque le va bien  ya que ha tenido un buen resultado.
Su inspiración por esta actividad fue su propia familia ya que deseaba tener un mejor ingreso, y decidio poner una cocina económica  ya que es un negocio que  deja buenas ganancias y le iría bien en su economía.
Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo ella pueda agrandar su local para mejoras su atención con sus clientes quienes llegan a consumir del diario, así  también  ahorrar para poyara su hijo que está estudiando.
texts.en:
Juanita is from a town known as Emiliano Zapata which is located in Tecpatan, Chiapas.  She is married to Javier and they have a son called Javier who is 7 years old.

Juanita makes food and she requested this loan to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables, tortillas, etc.  She has been running her business for two years and is happy because it is doing well.  She has had good results.

Juanita's inspiration for her business was her own family as she wanted to make better income for them.  She decided to set up a 'cocina económica' (a small, informal restaurant selling affordable home-made food) as this is a business that makes good profits and it would help her financially.

What Juanita most wants is to be able to expand her premises over time so that she can improve her service to her customers who come to her establishment to eat every day.  She would also like to save up so that she can support her son who is in school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto nació en la provincia de la Convención (Perú) y tiene 31 años de edad. Actualmente, Alberto vive en la ciudad del Cusco. Alberto tiene una pequeño taller de carpintería pero el local es alquilado, el nos cuenta que tiene clientes fijos y fabrica sus productos a pedido del cliente. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Alberto en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como laca, pintura, madera y otras cosas más. 

El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Alberto was born in the province of Convención, Perú and he is 31 years old. Currently, Alberto lives in the city of Cusco. He runs a small carpentry workshop that is in a rented space. He has steady customers and manufactures his products upon order by his customers. He has been running his business for twelve years and he does very well thanks to the dedication he puts into his work. Alberto needs the loan to buy raw materials such as lacquer, paint, wood and some other supplies. 

He is a very responsible and hardworking person, which is why his companions invited him to participate in the "Mosoc Killa" Communal Bank of the Asociación Arariwa (Arariwa Association).

loans.use: to buy lacquer, paint, wood and other raw materials.

loans.name: Alexander Jose

texts.es: Alexander José tiene 26 años, su actividad es la venta de lotería. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este medio de vida. Siempre ha sido una persona luchadora pues tiene 2 hijos menores de edad por los que tiene que luchar, el les brinda los ingresos necesarios. Inicio este negocio por un hermano que le enseño poco a poco como ganarse la vida diariamente. Alexander sale todos los días a ofrecer la lotería a muchos clientes, a pesar de tener muchas dificultades. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de lotería.
texts.en: Alexander José is 26 years old. His activity is selling lottery tickets. For more than ten years, he has been dedicated to this way of life. He has always been a fighting person since he has two young children for whom he has to fight. He provides them necessary income. He began this business through a brother who taught him gradually how to earn a daily living. Alexander leaves every day to offer lottery tickets to many customers, despite having many difficulties. The reason for the loan is to buy lottery tickets.

loans.use: Purchase lottery tickets.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia G. vive en la ciudadela 20 de Julio,  barrio que combina espacios productivos formales e informales, zonas comerciales, edificios, conjuntos residenciales, viviendas, supermercados, y principalmente es un lugar conocido en toda Colombia , porque muy cerca se encuentra uno de los escenario más importante de la ciudad y de Colombia: “El estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla” donde se juega el buen futbol profesional y es la sede  del Junior de Barranquilla,  equipo amado en la costa Norte de Colombia.  En este cálido y amable ambiente, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 13 y 21 años Alicia, quien se dedica a la venta de mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos como cosméticos, ropa y calzado principalmente.  Su negocio lo inició en el año 2010 pues trabaja como empleada de una empresa transportadora y haciendo  turnos nocturnos, se percató que podía atender un negocio simultáneamente por eso poco a poco ha construido su propia clientela, la cual gradualmente ha crecido. Sus principales clientes son empleados de empresas, trabajadores independientes a quienes les otorga créditos de acuerdo a sus posibilidades en plazos pactados. Su horario es variable  pero aproximadamente trabaja 6 horas diarias. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará productos que le ha solicitado su clientela y que rotan muy rápidamente, como cosméticos y ropa. Su meta es aumentar sus utilidades aplicando todo su esfuerzo e invirtiendo permanentemente en él y más aun  en este momento en el que cuenta con un capital de trabajo adicional producto de su credikiva.
texts.en: Alicia G. lives in the July 20 citadel, a neighborhood that combines formal and informal productive spaces, commercial zones, buildings, alongside residences, houses, supermarkets and it's mainly a place known in all of Colombia because nearby you can find one of the most important stages in the city and in Colombia: The Barranquilla Metropolitan Stadium where professional football is played and which is the headquarters of Barranquilla Junior, a team loved in the North Colombian coast. In this warm and friendly atmosphere, she lives with her husband and their two children who are 13 and 21 years old. Alicia is dedicated to selling merchandise through specialized product guides, such as cosmetics, clothing and footwear. She began her business in 2010 when she worked as an employee for a transportation company doing night shifts. She realized that she could manage a business simultaneously. For this, she has gradually built her own customer base, which has grown gradually. Her main customers are company employees, independent workers to whom she offers loans in accordance to their possibilities in agreed terms. Her hours are variable but she works approximately six hours a day. Her "crediKiva" is the first financing that she has made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will buy products that her customers have requested and that rotate very quickly, such as cosmetics and clothing. Her goal is to increase her profits by applying all of her effort and investing permanently in it and even now count on the additional working capital that is a product of crediKiva.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing in greater amounts.

loans.name: Rosa  Blanca

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Blanca, vive en un lugar muy bonito de Emiliano Zapata, ella es casada y a su responsabilidad tiene un hijo de  diez años de edad, en quinto de primaria.

     Ella es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en fundación realidad y es para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos por catalogo de la marca: Arabela, blondi, jafra, fuler, en donde lleva cinco años, en lo que nos comenta que le va bien  ya que con ello ha tenido un buen ingreso.

   Su motivo ha esta actividad fue la necesidad de tener un mejor ingreso  para así solventar sus gastos que se genera en  su pequeño hogar, también quiere apoyar a su esposo aportando un poco de dinero.

   Su más grande deseo es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda trabajar para mejorar su calidad de  vida para su  hijo que aún está creciendo.
texts.en:
Rosa Blanca lives in a very beautiful place in Emiliano Zapata.  She is married and has a ten year-old son in her care.  He is currently in the fifth year of elementary school.

This is the first time that Rosa Blanca has requested a loan from Fundación Realidad and she will invest it in buying Arabela-, Blondi-, Jafra- and Fuller-brand cosmetics from a catalog.  She has been in this business for five years and tells us that it is doing well and making her a good income.

Rosa Blanca's motivation to start working in this business was the need that she had to make income in order to cover the expenses created by her small household.  She wanted to support her husband by contributing a little money.

Rosa Blanca's biggest wish is to be able to work in this small business activity in order to improve her growing son's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy Fuller, Blondi, Jafra and Avon brand cosmetics

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elias nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 25 años de edad. Actualmente,  Elias vive en la misma ciudad donde nacio. Elias tiene un pequeño taller de mecánica pero el local es alquilado. Ya es medio año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Elias en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como laca, pintura, madera y otras cosas más. 

El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Elias was born in the city of Cusco (Perú) and is 25 years old. Currently, Elias lives in the same city where he was born. Elias has a small mechanic's workshop, but the building is rented. He has operated this business for half a year, and it is going very well for him thanks to the dedication he puts into his work. At this time, Elias needs a loan to buy supplies such as lacquer, paint, wood and other items.  

The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person, and thanks to these qualities, his fellow members invited him to participate in the “Mosoc Killa” communal bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as lacquer, paint, wood and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase shoes, skin lotions, hand bags, clothing in general, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Leana Alexi

texts.es:
Leana de 46 años de edad vive en el municipio de Malambo con su esposo y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 3 a 23 años. Malambo un municipio a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, es un lugar receptor de mucha población colombiana donde abundan las actividades informales en sus barrios y también se encuentra ubicado el parque Industrial de Malambo S.A. Pimsa donde ingresan Motonaves Marítimas procedentes de Estados Unidos, Centro y Sur América y el Caribe.
Leana comenzó a vender mercancías desde hace 10 años en una vitrina en su propia casa y posteriormente estudió preescolar y se dedicó a la docencia y además de desarrollar esta actividad, emprendió un negocio de papelería en un punto en su casa, para suministrar materiales  a las estudiantes del colegio. Leana en su tarea de generar ingresos permanentemente, también  se dedica a vender los uniformes de diario  en colegios.  Su meta es organizar cada vez más su negocio y  generar, mediante su trabajo, mayores ingresos para suministrar un mayor bienestar a sus hijos y fundamentar su éxito mediante la educación.  Su mayor desafió es el insuficiente capital de trabajo , esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, como su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el comprará varios Kid escolar, libros, uniformes y papelería en general, para surtir su negocio y responder a pedidos encargados, con lo cual su mercancía rotará rápidamente entre sus mejores clientes.
texts.en:
Leana is 46 years old and she lives in the municipality of Malambo with her husband. She has 5 children between the ages of 3 and 23. Malambo is a municipality located at 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla. it is a gathering place of many Columbian citizens and there is an abundance of informal businesses within the communities. Also located here is the industrial park Industrial de Malambo S.A. Pimsa where motorized water vessels are manufactured for the American, Central and South American, and Caribbean markets.

Leana started selling merchandise 10 years ago from a display case installed in her home. Later on she studied Early Childhood Education to become a teacher and in addition to this business, she started up an office supply store form her house. Her goal was to supply the students from the high school. Her emphasis is to always earn an income so she also sells uniforms to the schools. Her goal is to improve her business more each day and, through hard work, to generate a better income. It will help her provide her children with wellbeing and to support their success via their education. Her greatest challenge is an insufficient working capital. This is the reason why she requests a Kiva loan. It is her first loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it she will purchase various school supplies, books, uniforms and supplies in general to stock her business and to fill orders already placed. Her merchandise will sell quickly among her better clients.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies, books, uniforms, and office supplies in general.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 40 años de edad. Actualmente,  Lilian vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Lilian y su esposo tienen un pequeño taller de carpintería pero el local es alquilado, ella es la administradora del negocio y también se dedica a buscar clientes. Ya son 14 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Lilian  en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como laca, pintura, madera y otras cosas más. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Lilian was born in the city of Cusco (Peru) and she is 40 years old. Presently, Lillian lives in the city of Cusco together with her two children. Lilian and her husband have a small carpenter's shop but the shop is rented. She is the administrator of the business and she also is in charge of seeking out new clients. She has been in business for 14 years and it has gone very well thanks to the determination she invests in her business. Lilian currently requires a loan to purchase materials such as lacquer, wood, and other products.

She is a responsible and hardworking person and for these qualities she was invited to participate in the communal bank. It is named "Mosoc Killa" and it is a member of Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to purchase products such as lacquer, paint, wood, and other products.

loans.name: Darling Yanet

texts.en:
Darlin is the 32-year-old single mother of three children ages 3, 6, and 11. Darlin has been able to grow her small business of offering various food items through the previous loans from the field partners.

Darlin’s goal is to be able to continue to grow her business and provide a better life for her children. She bought candy, soft drinks, biscuits, detergents and basic grains. She is very appreciative of all of the support she has received from the lending community.

loans.use: to buy candy, soft drinks, biscuits, detergents and basic grains

loans.name: Maria Delfina

texts.en:
Maria Delfina is 40 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán in northern Ecuador. She is separated from her husband and lives with her two children aged 16 and 12. She is a humble woman who is dedicated to her home and her children. She is a hard worker and, above all, she works to help her children study. She calls her children her “reason to live.” 

Maria Delfina sells fruit in her shop. This loan, her third from FODEMI, is for the acquisition of more merchandise to sell. She wants to increase her working capital and purchase more fruit. She began her business twelve years ago when she moved from her natal village to Tulcán. Since there was no source of jobs available at the time, she took the initiative to begin to sell fruits on a cart and joined an association of street vendors. 

Maria Delfina reports that her business is going well. She has fixed clients that buy from her daily or weekly, supplies good quality fruit, and gives her clients great customer service. Her past loans have improved the quality of life for herself and her children because when she has more merchandise to sell, she obtains more profit. 

Maria Delfina has many goals for the future. Firstly, she wants a larger place where she can expand her business selling fruits and vegetables so that she does not have to sell fruit in the street. She wants to buy a small bit of land to build her own house in Tulcán. Finally, she dreams that her children will enter a university and study to be professionals. She was not able to attend university and she wants her children to have this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco,  y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia tiene 53 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. crianza D. pollos, ella venD. pollos en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como Anta e Izcuchaca, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. venta D. pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
She belongs to the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". It is located in the district of Cusco, and it belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

She is 53 years old, married, and she has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business raising poultry. She sells the poultry independently, offering them at various locations such as Anta and Izcuchaca. She wants to expand her poultry business. She requests a loan to purchase poultry and poultry feed.

She is happy for this loan and she is committed to making her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and poultry feed.

loans.name: Las Animadoras Group

texts.en: Petrona, Ingrid, and Juana, all of whom reside in San Lorenzo, Honduras, formed the “Las Animadoras” solidarity group in June 2011. Petrona and her husband make a living by selling seafood and vegetables out of their truck. Petrona is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 to purchase a bulk amount of seafood and vegetables which she will sell. Ingrid sells freshly prepared food out of her home and Juana operates a small convenience shop.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp, fish, tomatoes, carrots, corn, peppers, and plantains.

loans.name: Ayidekon-Fifa Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDEKON-FIFA est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Augustine Louise est celui dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Augustine Louise est mariée à un soudeur du Thomas et a sept enfants qui sont scolarisés. Des sept enfants, cinq sont à sa charge. Augustine Louise et son mari supporte ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Augustine Louise a très peu fréquenté l'école, mais a appris la couture. Augustine Louise exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans environs. A côté de cette activité, Augustine Louise vend des articles de mercerie dans son atelier. De façon secondaire, Augustine Louise vend des tissus, des chaussures, des sacs et des layettes dans son atelier. Augustine Louise s’approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Augustine Louise n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigences. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Augustine Louise et les autres membres du groupe AYIDEKON-FIFA sollicitent ensemble un  crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Group Ayidekon-Fifa is composed of three residents of the same district in Benin. The group's representative, named Augustine Louise, is the woman raising her hand on the picture. This is the third time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support in order to increase their level of activity.
Augustine Louise is married to a welder named Thomas and has seven children, who go to school. Out of the seven children, five depend on her financially. Augustine Louise and her husband take care of the family's various expenses together. Augustine Louise did not have much schooling, but she learned sewing. She has been in this business for about five years. In addition to this activity, Augustine Louise sells haberdashery items in her workshop. On the side, she also sells fabrics, shoes, bags and baby linen in her workshop. Augustine Louise gets her supplies in Benin and in Togo.
Demand from her customers is growing, and given her limited resources, Augustine Louise is having trouble meeting their requirements. Considering this and their limited resources, Augustine Louise and the other members of group Ayidekon-Fifa are requesting a collective loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, haberdashery items, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 56 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de preparación de tortas y venta de tortas, el prepara diferentes tipos de tortas, pasteles y panes, la socia trabaja en forma independiente en su casa, ella tiene pedidos de diferentes personas para cumpleaños, bautizos y matrimonios, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de preparación y venta de tortas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer las tortas como harina, mantequilla, azúcar y huevos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
She belongs to the communal bank "Patron San Sebastian". It is located in the district of Cusco, and it belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

She is 56 years old and she is single. She alternates her daily activities with her cake baking and sales business. She bakes various types of cakes, pastries and breads. She works independently from her house. She takes order from various individuals for birthdays, baptisms, and weddings. It is through this business that she is able to provide for her children. She wants to expand her cake baking and sales business. She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to bake cakes, such as flour, butter, sugar, and eggs.

She is happy for the loan and she is committed to making the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to bake cakes, such as flour, butter, sugar, and eggs.

loans.name: Jennifer Elieth

texts.en: Jennifer is a 29-year-old married mother of a 6-year-old.  For almost three years she has baked and sold cookies and various sweets door-to-door.  Jennifer intends to use the proceeds of the loan to buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients for her business.  Her dream is to grow her business until one day she can operate from a storefront.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de carros, el trabaja en el área de taller de mecánica, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de carros. El  socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal para comprar artefacto para su casa como un televisor.
                                                 
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Patron San Sebastian” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco within the Cusco department.

The member is 30 years old and has a live-in partner and two children. The member alternates his daily activities with a business in car sales. He works in the mechanic area. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Through this business the member helps his children get ahead. He wants to expand the car sales business. The member is requesting a loan to buy household appliances for personal use such as a television. 
                                                 
The member is happy about receiving the loan and he is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy household appliances for personal use such as a television.

loans.name: El Hadji Ali Ndiaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune agée de 31 ans. Il est marié et pére d'un enfant. Il vit avec ses  deux soeurs, son frére,sa mére et son pére. Il prend en charge les dépenses de location de la maison , l'alimentation de la famille, les frais de santé de sa mére ainsi que le paiement des factures d'eau et d'électricité.Il pratique l'activité d'aviculture depuis 2 ans.Il a demarré l'élevage de poulets de chair avec des économies faite sur son activité de menuisier ébeniste qui est sa véritable profession et dont il dispose d'un atelier dans sa localité.Il pratique aussi l'élevage de moutons entre deux opérations d'élevage de poulets.L'aviculture et l'élevage de moutons lui rapportent toutefois des revenus supplémentaires pour faire face aux besoins de la famille et à ses propres besoins.Il est sociétairte de l'IMCEC depuis 2008 et a obetenu quatres préts remboursés intégralement sans retards. Il sollicite pour son activité avicole un pret de   150 000f pour l'achat de 2 caisses de poussins de chair, de 4 sacs de 50kg d'aliment de poussins et des produits vétérinaires. La vente des poussins àprés deux mois d'élevage devrait lui rapporter des bénéfices substantiels qui l'aideront à faire face à ses dépenses de location, d'alimentation, de santé, d'eau et d'électricité.Il ambitionne plus tard de construire un grand poulailler sur un terrain qu'il a acquis reccement mais aussi et surtout de construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en: The borrower is a 31-year old man. He is married and the father of one child. He lives with his two sisters, brother, mother and father. He takes care of the house rent, food for the family, his mother’s healthcare expenses as well as water and electricity bills. HE has been raising poultry for two years. He started raising broiler chickens with the savings he was able to put together thanks to his work as a cabinet maker, which is his proper trade. He has a workshop in the village. He also raises sheep between two cycles of breeding chickens. Raising poultry and ship bring him necessary additional income to support this family and himself. He has been a member of IMCEC since 2008 and obtained four loans in the past, all fully reimbursed without delays. He is seeking a loan of 150,000 for his poultry business, in order to buy two cases of chicks, two 50-kg bags of chicken feed, and veterinary products. After selling chickens two months later, he should receive substantial income helping him to meet the costs of rent, food, healthcare, water and electricity. His future goal is to have a big chicken coop built on the land plot which he had recently bought, but also, and above all, to have a house built for is family.

loans.use: to buy two cases of chicks, 4  bags of chicken feed, and veterinary products

loans.name: Marquesa

texts.es:
Marquesa es una mujer  dedicada a todo lo que hace, es viuda y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 24 y 289 años, que son su motor para continuar esforzándose cada día más con alergia y tenacidad.  Desde el año 1983 vive en el sur de la ciudad y hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado, electrodomésticos, productos de catálogos de los cuales ofrece a sus clientes las mejores ofertas.  
Adquirió toda su experiencia  de su fallecido esposo, quien fue un excelente comerciante y muy dedicado a la venta de carros, de bienes raíces y hasta la venta de carne de res, pero hace 6 años murió víctima de un atraco, así fue que  Marquesa debió asumir ella sola toda la responsabilidad de su familia y especialmente la de su carnicería, de la que por su muy poca experiencia debió desprenderse y dedicarse al comercio de ropa, calzad y electrodomésticos, al cual posteriormente agregó cosméticos ofrecidos mediante guías especializadas de productos, todo esto  con tal de sacar adelante a su familia. El credikiva es el primer financiamiento, que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará electrodomésticos, aprovechando que hay una gran oferta que puede aprovechar y ya hizo la preventa de tal manera que conoce muy bien que va a vender y a quien. Su meta más adelante es lograr acceder a los mercados de los municipios del departamento y construir la segunda planta de su casa. Mientras esto sucede Marquesa continua esforzándose para superar la rentabilidad de su negocio que en la actualidad se encuentra en un 30%.
texts.en:
Marquesa is a woman dedicated to everything that she does. She is a widow and has two children ages 24 and 28 who are her motivation to continue working hard every day more with happiness and tenacity. Since 1983, she has lived in the south of the city and for ten years she has been dedicated to selling clothing, footwear, appliances, catalog products which she offers to her customers at great deals.

She acquired all of her experience from her late husband who was an excellent trader and very dedicated to selling cars, real estate, and meat. But six years ago, her died a victim of a holdup so Marquesa had to assume all of the responsibility of her family and especially of their butchershop that, due to her little experience, she had to detach from and dedicate herself to selling clothing, shoes and appliances, to which she later added cosmetics offered through special product guides. All of this with the goal of getting her family ahead. The crediKiva is the first loan made with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will purchase appliances taking advantage of the fact that there is a great offer that she can take advantage of and that she has already made and she already knows well what and to whom she'll sell. Her goal in the future is to gain access to the local markets and to build the second story of her house. In the meantime, Marquesa continues to work to overcome the profitability of her business which is currently at 30%.

loans.use: to purchase appliances.

loans.name: Heillin Maryinis

texts.en:
Heilin Marsinis is a single mother with two children, ages four and eight. For the last two years, she has owned and operated a small general store where she sells a variety of food items, drinks, and toiletries. 

Heilin Marsinis is requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety and higher quality of products to sell. Her dreams are centered on the well-being of her two children and providing for their future.

loans.use: to purchase various food items and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est agée de46 ans et est une femme célibataire. Elle vit avec sa mére et ses freres et soeurs. Elle exerce dans le commerce de produits alimentaire. Mais auparavant, elle se rendait dans lmes pays limitrophes pour s'approvisionner en produits vestimentaires et cosmétiques qu'elle plaçait aupres des clients qui payer au bout d'un mois. Les nombreuses dettes impayées l'ont obligé à arreter cette forme de commerce. Elle a alors implanté une petite boutique devant son domicile pour vendre des denrées alimentaires. Avec cette activités , elle fait difficilement face aux lourdees charges de nourriture, de santé et d'habillement de sa famille et d'elle meme. Ces difficultés l'a poussent à ouvrir un compte à l'IMCEC ou elle obtient deux prets de 300 000f et de 100 000f qu'elle rembourse entierment sans retards. Aujourd'hui, apres avoir constitue une épargne de 52 399, elle sollicite un autre pret de 200 000f pour renforcer son activité. Elle envisage avec ce pret d'acheter 10sacs d'oignopn, 10 sacs de choux, 05 sacs de piment, 03 cartons de tomate local, 2 sacs de savon et 2 sacs de sucre.Elle espere obtenir des benefices de ce stock qui l'aideront à améliorer l'alimentation de sa famille mais aussi à faire face aux dépenses de sante ét d'habillement. Son ambition est de construire une grande alimentation dans son domicile qui se trouve au bord de la route.
texts.en: The borrower is a 46-year old single woman. She lives with her mother, brother and sisters. She sells food products. In the past, she used to travel to the neighboring countries to stock up on clothing and cosmetics, which she sold on credit to clients who would pay her back within a month. Many unpaid debts have forced her to stop this business. She has opened a small shop in front of her home in order to sell foodstuffs. She has been struggling to provide for the hefty expenses of food, healthcare and clothing for herself and her family. These difficulties have led her to open an account with IMCEC, where she obtained two loans, in the amount of 300,000 francs and 100,000 francs, repaid fully without delays. Now, after having been able to put aside 52,399 francs, she is seeking another loan of 200,000 francs in order to bolster her business. She plans to buy 10 bags of onions, 10 bags of cabbage, five bags of peppers, three cartons of local tomatoes, two bags of soap and two bags of sugar. She hopes that expending her stock will increase her income, allowing her to improve the family’s nutrition, and also cover the expenses related to healthcare and clothing. Her goal is to build a big grocer store in her house, which is located on the side of a big road.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of onions, 10 bags of cabbage, five bags of peppers, three cartons of local tomatoes, two bags of soap and two bags of sugar

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: La señora Silvia  residente en el corregimiento de Campeche, en el departamento del Atlántico, se dedica desde muy joven a la preparación de exquisitas comidas y pasteles , oficio que aprendió con su madre quien se dedicaba a trabajar en oficios domésticos; cuando su madre fallece Silvia también comenzó en sus mismas tareas pues le gustaba mucho preparar comidas, por eso al conformar su hogar   se dedicó a trabajar en forma independiente haciendo almuerzos, pasteles y sancochos que hoy en día deleitan el paladar de sus vecinos y clientes esporádicos que visitan el corregimiento. Hace tres años incursionó en la venta de mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos y esta actividad  ha resultado muy buena, su margen de rentabilidad es alto y su clientela ha subido notablemente. Su esposo por una grave enfermedad dejó de trabajar como ebanista, hace 5 años y la responsabilidad de este hogar debió asumirla Silvia. Así es que ahora maneja dos negocios el de vender mercancías y el de preparación de comidas. Sus ventas tanto de comidas como de mercancías mediante   catálogo,  le permiten cubrir sus costos y asumir la totalidad de los gastos de su hogar. Tiene los equipos necesarios para el desarrollo de su negocio,  maneja  buen margen de rentabilidad y una buena liquidez. Su hermana le colabora en todas las actividades que realiza. Tiene capacidad de pago y se le nota el interés por sacar adelante sus negocios y con ello lograr que su familia avance.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Silvia   hace a la Fundación Mario  Santo Domingo, con él comprará insumos para preparar alimentos, mercancía variada como cosméticos producto de las ofertas que en su catálogos están bien buenas y esto hace más rentable su negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia lives in Corregimiento de Campeche in the Atlántico Department.  From a very young age she’s been preparing delicious meals and cakes, an occupation she learned from her mother who worked as a domestic employee.  When her mother died, Silvia started doing the same kind of work because she liked preparing meals very much.  When she formed her own home, she started working independently preparing lunches, cakes and stews which today delight the taste buds of neighbors and occasional customers that visit the corregimiento (a Colombian territorial division not quite large enough to be a town).

Three years ago she started selling merchandise via specialized product catalogues and this activity has turned out to be very good.  Her profit margin is high and her clientele has increased considerably.

Her husband had to stop working as a cabinet maker due to a serious illness so Silvia had to take over responsibility for the home five years ago.  She now runs both businesses, selling catalogue merchandise and preparing meals, which makes it possible for her to cover her costs and to cover her household’s expenses in their totality.

She has the necessary equipment to carry out her business.  She manages a good profit margin and good cash flow.  Her sister helps her with all the activities she carries out.  She has the ability to pay and one can see the interest she has in moving her businesses ahead so that her family can advance.

Her Kiva loan is the first loan she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She’ll use it to buy ingredients to prepare meals and assorted merchandise, like cosmetics that are on special sale in her catalogues, that are very good and make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare meals and assorted merchandise like cosmetics on sale.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.en: Luis Manuel is a 41-year old father of three children who has owned and operated a small convenience store for the last 12 years out of her home.  While business has been good, He would like to purchase a larger variety of products to be able to sell to her customers. He wants to soap, soups, detergent, soft drinks and candy. The increased income will help support her father who has recently became ill.  Her dream is to grow the business to help provide for his entire family.

loans.use: to buy soap, soups, detergent, soft drinks and candy for his store.

loans.name: Candida Norberta

texts.en:
Candida is a 70-year-old married mother of six children who has sold clothes door-to-door for the past 17 years. She makes frequent trips to Managua to re-stock her inventory and meet client demands.  

Candida is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety and higher quality shirts, pants, skirts, suits, towels, and linens. She would like to continue to work hard for the next several years to support her family as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, suits, towels, and linens

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Santa Mónica Group

texts.es:
Santa Mónica es un grupo de formado por 6 mujeres que se encuentra en su primer ciclo con Credituyo. Ellas escogieron ese nombre para el grupo porque así se llama la calle donde realizan sus reuniones semanales.  Las mujeres de este grupo practican diferentes actividades económicas como venta de zapatos, ropa y venta de tamales.

María de Jesús es una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 48 años, vive en unión libre, y solo tiene 1 hijo que ya está casado. El esposo de María es vigilante y recientemente se quedó sin trabajo, hecho que obligó a María de Jesús a vender tamales para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. A María le ha ido bastante bien con su negocio de ventas de tamales y con su crédito espera comprar un triciclo más para que su esposo le ayude a vender tamales en las colonias cerca de su casa. A largo plazo, María de Jesús espera poder hacer crecer su negocio lo suficiente para contratar algunos empleados y así poder retirarse.
texts.en:
Santa Mónica is a group formed by six women that’s in its first cycle with Credituyo.  They chose this name for the group because that’s the name of the street where they have their weekly meetings.  The women in this group carry out various economic activities like: shoe sales, clothing sales and tamales sales. 

María de Jesús, 48, is one of the group members.  She lives in a free union and has just one son who is already married.  María’s husband is a watchman and recently lost his job which forced María de Jesús to start selling tamales to help cover household expenses.  María has done quite well with her tamale sales business and expects to use the loan to buy another tricycle cart so that her husband can help her sell tamales in the neighborhoods near her house.  In the long run, María de Jesús hopes to make her business grow enough so that she can hire employees and retire.

loans.use: to buy a  tricycle cart.

loans.name: Placida Polonia

texts.en:
Placida is 48 years old and married with three grown children. She has been a seamsress for the past 30 years. 

Placida is requesting a loan to buy needles, fabric, scissors, thread, and other sewing equipment and materials. Her goal is to provide financial support to her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy needles, fabric, scissors, thread, and sewing equipment

loans.name: Avenida Lopez Avelar Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Avenida López A., se encuentra localizado en la comunidad D. Jantetelco, está conformado por las señoras Francisca, Angela y Eustolia van a comprar con su préstamo Perfumes y cosméticos por mayoreo, la señora Preciliana va a comprar hip o clorito para fabricar cloro, la señora Carmela va a comprar pulseras, collares, esclavas, la señora Tranquilina va a comprar zapatos por mayoreo, la señora María D. los Angeles va a comprar elotes para vender esquites y chileatole, las señoras Minerva y Alberta van a comprar ropa blusas, pantalones, camisas etc. por mayoreo. La señora Angela tiene 34 años D. edad, ella vive en unión libre con su esposo, ellos tienen 3 hijos Lizbeth Natali D. 12 años D. edad, Anete D. 10 años D. edad ellas están estudiando la primaria y Erick D. 5 años D. edad está en preescolar, ella venD. perfumes D. dama y C. D. la marca Fraiche por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar perfumes D. dama y C. y una parte para la alimentación D. sus hijos, ella inicio su negocio hace 2 años su tía la invito a vender y con el préstamo que recibió D. Kiva y fundación Realidad lo invirtió en perfumes, ella sale a vender sus productos en Jantetelco y Amayuca, su negocio es importante porque D. ahí tiene para lo que necesiten sus hijos en la escuela, ella se siente orgullosa D. su negocio  porque sale a vender sus perfumes en su tiempos libre y pueD. atender a sus hijos, las ganancias las utiliza para lo que haga falta para la comida D. sus hijos, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir porque lo va a ocupar para invertirlo en perfumes y tener varias fragancias para ofrecerles a sus clientes, sus sueños y esperanzas son ampliar su casa construir otros cuartos para que sus niños estén mas cómodos y que sus hijos salgan adelante en sus estudios. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por sus préstamos, ya que hay muchas personas necesitadas, y que nos sigan ayudando con sus préstamos”.  Jantetelco es un pueblo bonito D. clima cálido, se ven los cerros, la gente es amable, tranquila, hay campo siembran maíz, camote, cacahuate, sorgo.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called Avenida López A.. It is located in the community to Jantetelco. 

Señora Angela is 34 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage with her husband and they have three children. Lizbeth Natali is 12 years old and Anete is 10 years old. They are in primary school. Erick is 5 years old and is in preschool. She sells Fraiche brand women’s and men’s perfumes through a catalog.

She requested her loan to buy women’s and men’s perfumes and a part of it will also go to feeding her children. She began her business two years ago. Her aunt invited her to do sales and with a loan she received from Kiva and Fundación Realidad she invested in perfumes. She sells her products in Jantetelco and Amayuca. Her business is important because that is how she provides for her children’s school needs. She feels proud of her business because she goes out to sell perfume in her free time and she can care for her children.

She will use the profits to do whatever it takes to feed her children. She is happy with the loan she is going to receive because she will use it to invest in perfumes and will have various fragrances to offer to her customers. Her hopes and dreams are to add on to her house, building more rooms so that her children are more comfortable, and that her children get ahead in their studies.

The group’s members also incluD. Francisca, Angela and Eustolia who are going to buy wholesale perfumes and cosmetics. Señora Precilina is going to buy sodium hypochlorite to make bleach. Señora Carmela will buy bracelets, necklaces and ID bracelets. Señora Tranquilina is going to buy shoes wholesale. Señora María D. los Angeles will buy corn on the cob to sell esquites [corn and chili pepper based snack] and chileatole [savory corn beverage]. Señora Minerva and Señora Alberta will buy wholesale clothing such as blouses, pants, shirts, etc.

The members of the group want to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad that “we thank them for their loans as there are many needy people, and may they continue helping us with loans.” Jantetelco is a town that has a nice warm climate and a view of the mountains. The people are friendly and it is tranquil with fields of corn, sweet potato, peanuts and sorghum.

loans.use: to buy Fraiche brand women's and men's perfumes.

loans.name: Angel Francisco

texts.en: Angel is 52 years old and single. His children are adults.  For the last 34 years he has had a small clothing store where he sells a wide variety of pants, shirts, and various other clothing items.  Angel plans to use the loan proceeds to buy handbags, cosmetics, footwear, carvings, and clothing in general, higher quality products that his clients have a greater demand for.  His dream is to be able to maintain and continue to grow the business in order to better his life.

loans.use: buy handbags, cosmetics, footwear, carvings, and clothing in general.

loans.name: Esquipulas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama  Esquipulas , sus integrantes  decidieron ponerle  así por que  le tienen  mucha devoción al santito de Esquipulas el santito morenito . Este grupo esta ubicado  en la ciudad de pinotepa nacional Oaxaca .El grupo  esta conformado  por diez integrantes  que se  conocen  desde hace tres años , son vecinas y familiares.

El representante de este grupo se llama  Evodia tiene cuarenta años de edad  estudio  hasta  quinto  grado de primaria, tiene  cinco hijos  tres mujeres y dos varones. Ella se dedica  a la venta  de tamales y necesita  el préstamo para  comprar loa alimentos que necesita para la elaboración para los tamales.  Sus clientes  quieren un lugar mas grande para comer y se sientan mas a gusto con su familia por que el local donde vende sus tamales esta muy pequeño.
La señora Evodia  también quiere hacer mas grande su local para que tenga mas clientes y así ya no salga a vender por que descuida su local.
La señora Evodia  desea  este préstamo para hacer mas grande su local y obtener mas ganancias y empezar otro negocio le gustaría que fuera de ropa.

Gudelia  Agustina  es otra de las integrantes  del grupo Esquipulas. Tiene  sesenta y ocho años de edad  y  tiene  un  total de nueve hijos  cinco mujeres y cuatro varones  mayores de edad. Ella se dedica  ala venta de pescado  y necesita  el préstamo  para comprar  mas pescado  ya que  vende en el mercado y en su casa .
Sus clientes desean  que  aja  mas grande su negocio  y contrate  personal por su edad por que como ya esta grande se la hace tarde y es una persona que los despacha muy bien que hasta le regala un pescado.
La señora  Gudelia  desea  hacer una tienda de abarrotes.

Los otros  ocho integrantes se llaman :
Jorge- compra  y venta de pescado.
Adriana- compra de insumos para la venta  de comida.
Epifania-Artículos de belleza para trabajar.
María  Felipa- compra de insumos  para  la elaboración  de totopos  para la venta.
Aurora Luz- compra de material  para la elaboración  de manualidades  para la venta.
Eduviges-  venta de zapatos.
Adriana- venta y compra de refrescos , tienda de abarrotes.
Josefina- Compra y Venta de semillas secas.

Están muy agradecidas  con el préstamo que le a dado fundación realidad y por las cosas  que han logrado Cohn su negocio como son.: mas ganancias y mejor calidad de vida .
Gracias fundación realidad
texts.en:
This group is called “Esquipulas.”  The members decided on this name because they are very devoted to the Little Saint of Esquipulas, the brown skinned little saint.  The group is located in the city of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca.  It has ten members who have known each other for the last three years; they are neighbors and family members. 

The group representative is Evodia.  She’s 40 years old and went up to 5th grade.  She has five children: three girls and two boys.  She sells tamales and needs the loan to buy the food she needs to make tamales.
