Her customers would like a larger space to sit down to eat with their families because the place where she sells her tamales is very small.  Evodia also wants to enlarge her locale to have more customers so that she won’t have to go out to sell any longer and neglect her locale.  Evodia wants this loan to enlarge her locale and to earn more profits to start another business; she’d like it to be clothes sales.

Gudelia Agustina is another member of the Esquipulas group.  She is 68 years old and has nine children: five girls and four boys, all adults.  She sells fish and needs the loan to buy more fish because she sells both at home and at the market.  Her customers would like her to enlarge the business and hire personnel because of her age; since she’s already older it gets late for her and she’s a person who takes care of them very well, she even gives away a fish.  Gudelia would like to open a grocery store.

The other eight members are:

Jorge - to buy fish.

Adriana - to buy ingredients to make meals.

Epifania - to buy beauty supplies.

María Felipa - to buy ingredients to make fried tortilla chips to sell.

Aurora Luz - to buy materials to make crafts to sell.

Eduviges -  to sell shoes.

Adriana - to buy beverages, grocery store.

Josefina - to buy dry seeds to sell.


They are very grateful for the loan that Fundación Realidad has granted them and for the things they’ve accomplished with their businesses like: more profits and a better quality of life.  Thank you Fundación Realidad.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make and sell tamales.

loans.name: Chichicazapa Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Nuevo Paso Nazareno ó Chichicazapa la cual se caraccteriza por ser una comunidad indigina en la donde todos sus habitantes hablan el dialecto Mazateco, el esta localidad existe una UDE (grupo integrado por mas de 10 personas) la cual lleva el nombre de su comunidad "Chichicazapa" porque ellos asi se identifican mas, est grupo esta integrado por 10 personas.
Uno de los integrantes de este grupo es Amada ella tiene la edad de 20 años, se encuentra soltera y solo estudio hasta el segundo años de Telesecundaria, ella nos platica que actualmente vive con sus padres y dos de sus hermanos, y que desde que dejo de estudiar tuvo que iniciar a trabajar pero como su comunidad es pequeña no hay muchas fuentes de trabajo asi que decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, ella realiza sus ventas los dias miercoles pero un dia antes ofrece con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad sus carne y al otro despues de aliñar el cerdo, entrega los pedidos.
Ella nos platica que la venta de carne de cerdo es algo muy laborioso y trabajoso porque desde dias antes tiene que salir a otros pueblos a comprar el cerdo que va a aliñar y en alguas ocaciones le es muy dificil encontrar cerdo y tiene que ir mas lejos a Playa V. pero ella es una mujer muy luchona ya que tiene que salcar a adelante a su familia y a el mas pequeño de sus hermanos que esta enfermo de una pierna.
Amada necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos, alimento y bolsas platicas para poder realizar su venta.
Ella nos comenta que espera que con este credito su negocio prospere y que desea darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres y hermanos y tambien que sus hermanos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar una profesion para que en un futuro puedan tener una mejor vida.
Los demas intengrantes del grupo son:
Minerva- Venta de pollo
Juana- Venta de refrescos
Sara- Venta de ropa
Cecilia-Venta de refrescos
Margarita Venta de Antojitos Mexicanos
Marcelina-  Venta de Antojitos Mexicanos
Edith- Venta de refrescos
Juana- Venta de carne
Luisa- Venta de refrescos
texts.en:
In the state of Oaxaca there is a community called Nuevo Paso Nazareno, or Chichicazapa, which is an indigenous community where all of the inhabitants speak the Mazateco dialect.  Here there is a communal bank (made up of 10 people) that carries the "Chichicazapa," name of its community, because this is the name they identify with the most.  This group has 10 members.

One of the members of this group is Amada.  She is 20 years old, single, and completed only two years of secondary school.  She tells us that now she lives with her parents and two of her brothers.  Ever since she left school she started to work, but since her community is small there are not a lot of job opportunities so she decided to start her own business selling pork meat.  She makes her sales on Wednesdays, but the day before she offers her meat to her friends and neighbors in the community.  The next day, after seasoning the pork, she delivers her orders. 

She tells us that selling pork is a difficult and arduous business because days before she has to go out to the other towns to buy the pig that she will prepare, and at times it is very difficult to find a pig and she has to go very far from Playa V..  But she is a very tenacious woman, since she has to support her family and also her youngest brother, who has a hurt leg.

Amada needs this loan to invest in the purchase of pigs, feed and plastic bags to make her sales.  She tells us that she hopes that with this loan her business will prosper.  She wants to provide a better quality of life to her parents and brothers, and she also hopes that her brothers will have the opportunity to study a profession so that in the future they will have a better life.  

The other members of the group are:

Minerva- who sells chicken
Juana- who sells soft drinks
Sara- who sells clothing
Cecilia-who sells drinks
Margarita - who sells traditional Mexican snacks
Marcelina-  who sells traditional Mexican snacks
Edith- who sells drinks
Juana- who sells meat
Luisa- who sells drinks

loans.use: to sell meat, drinks, clothing and traditional Mexican snacks

location.town: Nuevo Paso Nasareno, San Miguel Soyaltepec, oaxaca

loans.name: Fany Margoth

texts.en:
Fany is 36 years old and lives in the city of Macachi in the central Ecuadorian Andes. She is married and lives with her family in their own house. She has a son who is nine years old and a daughter who is two years old. Fany is a hard-working and humble person who tries to give the best she can to her children. She is a farmer who grows onions. Her loan will be used to invest in improving her soil and harvesting more onions. 

Since she was a child, Fany enjoyed farming. Her mother provided her with the drive to continue with the family’s onion farming tradition. Fany says that she has to sacrifice a lot to do her work but, without it, she would not be able to continue forward. She hopes that she will harvest enough of her new onion crop to cover her repayments and pursue her dreams for her family. Fany wants her family to have their health and do well, to expand her onion harvest, and purchase more calves in the future.

loans.use: to invest in improving her soil and harvesting more onions

loans.name: Orlando Enrique

texts.es:
Orlando  es un hombre de 43 años  casado, que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 16 por los cuales él y su cónyuge no se cansan de trabajar para brindarles bienestar.   Orlando vive en pleno centro de Malambo, un municipio a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla,   receptor de muchas personas que vienen desde todos los rincones del país; en este municipio  abundan en sus barrios las actividades informales  y también se encuentra ubicado el parque Industrial de Malambo S.A. “Pimsa” donde ingresan Motonaves Marítimas procedentes de Estados Unidos, Centro y Sur América y el Caribe.
Orlando tiene el negocio de alquiler de lavadoras desde hace 11 años, su esposa también es una mujer trabajadora,  con habilidades culinarias que pone en marcha dedicándose al  negocio de preparar pasteles los fines de semana y vender refrescos. Estos dos negocios les ha  permitido obtener ingresos con los cuales han logrado el bienestar de su hogar; Gradualmente   se han expandido, consiguiendo hacer inversiones importantes para su crecimiento, como cuando compraron el enfriador y una vitrina calentadora, para dar una imagen de calidad a su microempresa. Así mismo han aprovechado su clientela para vender minutos a celulares, generando ingresos adicionales, así como también compraron    una moto taxi, vehículo muy usual en esta población, para transportarse. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que Orlando  hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará 4 lavadoras más, e insumos para la preparación de sus pasteles,  pues su cobertura en el servicio de lavadoras se ha ampliado y muchas veces pierde clientes porque no puede responder oportunamente a la gran demanda que se presenta. Con esta inversión espera mejorar la rentabilidad y fortalecer su trabajo y el de su esposa como independientes para que sus hijos se proyecten con mucho éxito.
texts.en:
Orlando is a 43 year-old, married man who has two children aged 10 and 16.  He and his wife do not tire in working to provide for their children's well-being.  Orlando lives in the very center of Malambo, a town which is located 15 minutes from the city of Barranquilla.  Malambo is a place where many people come to live from all corners of the country.  In the neighborhoods of this town, there are a lot of informal businesses.  One can also find the Malambo S.A. "Pimsa" industrial park where motorboats come from the US, Central and South America and the Caribbean.

Orlando has been in business renting out washing machines for 11 years.  His wife is also a hard-working woman who has culinary skills which she uses in her business making cakes and selling soft drinks on a weekend.  These two businesses have allowed the couple to make income for the well-being of their household.  They have gradually expanded their businesses and made important investments in order to help them grow such as, for example, when they bought a cooler and a heated display case, to provide their small businesses with a good image.  They have also made the most of their customer base in order to sell their customers cell phone minutes too.  This makes them additional income.  They also bought a motorcycle taxi which is a common type of vehicle in this area and is used to transport passengers.

This Kiva loan is Orlando's first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy four additional washing machines and supplies for making cakes.  His washing machine service has expanded and he often loses customers because he cannot respond in a timely fashion to the great demand that he has.  As a result of this investment, Orlando hopes to improve his profitability and strengthen both his own and his wife's business so that their children can be successful.

loans.use: to buy four additional washing machines and supplies for making cakes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell natural products and to pay off an industrial machine she's paying for.

loans.name: Yaciris Del Socorro

texts.es:
Yaciris de 24 años vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio,  barrio que combina espacios productivos formales e informales, zonas comerciales, edificios, conjuntos residenciales, viviendas, supermercados, y principalmente es un lugar conocido en toda Colombia, porque muy cerca se encuentra uno de los escenario más importante de la ciudad y de Colombia: “El estadio Metropolitano de Barranquilla” donde se juega el buen futbol profesional y es la sede  del Junior de Barranquilla,  equipo amado en la costa Norte de Colombia. 
Yaciris desde el año 2006 inició su negocio con un punto comercial ubicado en la parte externa de un centro comercial importante del sur de la ciudad, donde vende chancletas, calzado deportivo para damas caballeros e infantil  y próximamente estará ubicada en la nueva galería de la avenida principal.  Sus clientes son transeúntes a quienes les vende de contado aunque tiene clientes con los que ha realizado transacciones a crédito. El negocio lo atiende en compañía de su esposo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará en mayor volumen  y de contado, sandalias y calzado para damas pues se provisionará para dar respuesta a la gran demanda que se avecina a propósito del segundo semestre del año, época en la cual en la cual ocurre un importante incremento de sus ventas.  Su sueño más adelante es tener una casa propia para ofrecerle a su hijo de 7 meses, excelentes  condiciones habitacionales y de bienestar .
texts.en:
Yaciris, 24, lives in the "20 de Julio" neighborhood, which is an area that contains both formal and informal activities, commercial zones, buildings, residential complexes, houses, and supermarkets.  This is an area known throughout Colombia, because it is very close to one of the most important venues in the city and in Colombia, the Metropolitan Stadium of Barranquilla, where professional soccer is played.  This is the home of the "Junior de Barranquilla" team, which is much loved on the northern coast of Colombia.

Yaciris started her business in 2006 with a store located outside of an important mall in the southern part of the city.  Here she sells flip-flops and sneakers for men, women and children.  Soon she will have a location in the new galleria on the main avenue.  Her customers are passers-by to whom she sells on a cash basis, although she has some customers to whom she sells on credit.  She attends to this business along with her husband from 9am until 9pm.  This Kiva loan will be the second loan that she has received from the  Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and with it she will purchase sandals and shoes for women in large quantities on a cash basis.  This will allow her to stock up her business for the high demand that comes in the second half of the year, the season when she generally sees a big increase in her sales.  Her dream for the future is to have her own house, so that she can provide her son, who is 7 months old, with excellent living conditions and a good life.

loans.use: to buy sandals and women's shoes in large quantities on a cash basis

loans.name: Las Tres Estrellas Group

texts.es:
La señora Irene  es casada y vive en la localidad de la Ribera la granadilla, Municipio de Coapilla Estado de chipas México.

    Ella se dedica a la elaboración de panes, en donde lleva dos años y tres meses y comenta que el va bien ya que con ello está apoyando para tener ingresos en su hogar aunque no tiene una familia grande quiere lo mejor para ellos.

    Con esta actividad inicio por su propia creatividad y así apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y juntos comenzar a horrar para que cuando tengas sus hijos  no les haga falta lo mas impórtate y justo salgan adelante.

    Su más grande deseo es que con esta pequeña  actividad pueda seguir trabajando y darle lo mejor a su premier hijo que esta por nacer en unos meses.

      Las personas que integran el en grupo son: la señora Timonea en la compra y venta de pollos para venderlo aliñado, así también está la señora Trinidad en la compra  de palmas para elaborar petates.
texts.en:
Señora Irene is married and lives in the area of Ribera la Granadilla, in the Municipality of Coapilla in Chiapas State, Mexico.

She works baking bread, which she has been doing for two years and three months.  She says it's going well, as with this she is able to support her household by providing income.  While she does not have a large family, she wants the best for them.

She started in this activity with her own creativity and so supports her husband with household income.  Together they are saving for when they have children.  She doesn't want them to lack anything important, and just wants them to be able to get ahead in life.

Her greatest wish is that she can continue working with this small business and provide the best for her first child who is due in a few months.

The people who make up the rest of the group are: Señora Timonea who buys chickens to season and sell, and Señora Trinidad who buys palm fronds to make mats.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Natividad Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre Natividad, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así se llama la calle donde está situado el lugar de reuniones, de ahí, es por eso que escogieron este nombre, esta historia es acerca de la señora María Félix, ya que es la representante de este grupo, cuenta con 42 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos esteban, Ángel y cristal, de los cuales los tres estudian, el mayor está cursando el tercer año de prepa, uno más segundo año de secundaria y la más pequeña esta en sexto año de primaria, ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de antojitos mexicanos desde hace mas de 10 años.

Doña María Félix decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que tenia la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, para sacar a sus hijos adelante, ya que no tenia la solvencia económica suficiente para conseguir darles una mejor educación, y continuar invirtiendo en su negocio, el crédito que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de los insumos necesarios para continuar con la preparación de sus ricos platillos como son: jitomates, cebollas, papas, variedad de chiles, aguacates, pollo, maíz, tortillas, quesos y demás especias.

La señora María Félix desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, y así poder hacerlo crecer mucho mas, puesto que quiere construir un local para poner un restaurant de comida mexicana, también comprar sillas y mesas y así tener una mejor producción e incrementar y mejorar sus ventas e ingresos, puesto que así podrá seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que pueda seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

Dice que todos sus compañeros, son personas responsables y pagadoras puesto que todos se conocen de hace tiempo, ya que son de la misma comunidad, y también son muy amigos así que no tienen ningún problema entre ellos.

Ella esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios de kiva y con Fundación realidad, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, para así seguir apoyándose a sí mismo y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.

Otros de los compañeros de doña María Félix son: María Leonor, Reyna, María Isabel, Aurelia, Ana Lilia, María de Jesús, María de los Ángeles, Teófila y blanca Carol quienes realizan variadas actividades como son: venta de carne, frutas, comida, ropa, dulces, tamales, refrescos, calzado, algunos abarrotes y panadería.
texts.en:
This group is called Natividad.  The members decided to give the group this name because it is the name of the street where they have their meetings. This story is about María Félix who is the group's representative.  She is 42 years old, married, and has three children: Esteban, Ángel and Cristal, who are all in school.  Her eldest is in his third year of high school, the next child is in his second year of junior high school and the youngest is in her sixth year of elementary school.  María Félix has been preparing and selling Mexican snacks for ten years.

María Félix decided to start this business because she needed to improve her family's quality of life and get her children ahead in life as she didn't have enough financial solvency to provide them with a better education and continue investing in her business.  She invested the loan that she received in buying the supplies she needed to continue making her rich dishes such as tomatoes, onions, potatoes, a variety of chilis, avocados, chicken, corn, tortillas, cheese and spices.

María Félix would like to continue investing in her business so that she can grow it even more.  She would like to build premises, buy tables and chairs, and set up a restaurant selling Mexican food.  She would like to improve her production and increase and improve her sales and income so that she can continue supporting her children in their education and improving their quality of life.

María Félix says that all her fellow group members are responsible people and good payers.  They have all known each other for quite a long time as they are from the same community.  They are also good friends so there are no problems between them.

María Félix is very grateful to Kiva lenders and to Fundación Realidad since, thanks to them, she is getting ahead in life and has been able to own her own business.  This allows her to continue supporting herself and improving her family's quality of life.

The other members of María Félix's group are: María Leonor, Reyna, María Isabel, Aurelia, Ana Lilia, María de Jesús, María de los Ángeles, Teófila and Blanca Carol.  They carry out a variety of business activities such as selling meat, fruit, meals, clothes, sweet treats, tamales, footwear and groceries, and running a bakery.

loans.use: to invest in buying tomatoes, onions, potatoes, a variety of chilis, avocados, chicken, corn, tortillas and cheese

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly de 46 años vive en el municipio de Soledad  con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 21 y 25 años, con ellos tiene sus más grande  sueño  de verlos triunfantes. Nelly confecciona prendas de vestir y también tiene un almacén de ventas de artículos para modistería.  Su negocio funciona en un local ubicado en el centro de Soledad y cuenta con 4 máquinas de coser y 5 vitrinas para exhibir los productos. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe Nelly de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el comprará  materia prima e insumos y una máquina de coser industrial. Su margen de contribución es del 31% y maneja una utilidad neta que le permite cubrir su crédito. La mayor parte de sus gastos son operativos.  Sus compras la realiza de contado  y su rotación de inventarios en el negocio de la confección es de 32 días, mientras  a ella le pagan  los créditos que ofrece a los 15 días. El negocio presenta buena rentabilidad sobre las ventas representada en un porcentaje  no menor de un 16%. Su sueño es ampliar su confección y así mismo hacer adecuaciones al almacén donde comercializa los productos de modistería.
texts.en:
Nelly, 46, lives in the town of Soledad with her spouse and two children who are 21 and 25 years of age.  Her great dream about them is seeing them triumph.  Nelly is a dressmaker and also sells dressmaking supplies.  Her business operates in a locale in downtown Soledad and has four sewing machines and five display cases to exhibit the products.  Her Kiva loan is the first loan Nelly’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she’ll use it to buy raw materials, supplies and an industrial sewing machine. 

Her gross profit is 31% and her net profits are sufficient to repay the loan.  Most of her expenses are operational.  She pays cash for her purchases and inventory turns over in 32 days while she gets the credit she offers repaid in 15 days.  The business is showing profits over sales no less than 16%.  Her dream is to expand the dressmaking as well as to make adjustments to the store where she sells her items.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies and an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: El Arbolito Group

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe vive n la localidad de la ribera general Sandino, ella es casada con el señor  Valdemar y con quien procero tres hijos quienes son: José Eliazin de veintidos años de edad, verónica  del Carmen  y de veinte años y el más pequeño es Luis Alberto de diesis seis años de dada.

   Ella se dedica a la compra  y venta de de pollos de granja para luego venderlo aliñado en la misma localidad, en donde lleva  dos años y cinco meses y comenta que le va bien ya  que con ello está teniendo ingresos y está apoyando a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa.

   Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su familia para sacarlo delante de la mejor manera y por eso decidió dedicarse a esta actividad  que le está dando un buen resultado  y a mejorado sus ingresos.
Lo que más desea es que sus hijos salgan adelante y con el préstamo seguir trabajando para tener mejor ingresos.

   Las personas que integran en el grupo son las siguientes: María Aida  quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes y las señora verónica del Carmen invierte el préstamo en la compra de pollo por reja para luego venderlo aliñado.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives in La Ribera, General Sandino.  She’s married to Valdemar with whom she has three children:  José Eliazin, 22, Verónica del Carmen, 20, and the youngest, Luis Alberto, 16.

She buys ranch raised chickens for subsequent sale butchered in the same location.  She’s been in business two years and five months and she comments that she does well since she’s earning income and helping her husband with household income.

Wanting to better move her family ahead is what motivated her into this activity.  She decided to go into it and it’s producing good results and improving her income.

What she wants most is that her children get ahead and with the loan continue to work to obtain better income.

The members of the group are: María Aida who will use the loan to buy merchandise to stock her grocery store and Verónica del Carmen who will use the loan to buy crates of chickens to butcher and sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of chickens to later sell butchered.

loans.name: Maria Lucilvia

texts.es:
La señora María Lucilvia, es casada con el señor Bedamin y con quien procreo hijos quienes aun están a su responsabilidad y son: Guadalupe jasir de catorce años de edad, Bedamin de Jesús  de ocho años de edad.

      Ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos, pavos de rancho para luego venderlo y solcito  el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de alimento y maíz, a si tenga un desarrollo más  rápido y con ellos sus clientes les guste la cálida de pollos que vende.

      Ella por su propia creatividad disidió dedicarse a este tipo de negocio ya que es un actividad muy buen que deja ingresos  y la  ganancia que le queda vuelve e invertirlo en la compra de comida para sus pollos y de eso mismo depender con sus ingresos para su hogar.

      Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo ella pueda tener su propio dinero y de sí mismo con el construir una casita mejor para que sus hijos viva cómoda mentes, como también seguir apoyándolo en su sus estudios.
texts.en:
Señora María Lucilvia is married to Señor Bedamin with whom she has children for whom they are still responsible.  They are: Guadalupe Jasir, aged fourteen, and Bedamin de Jesús, aged eight.

She works raising chickens and farm turkeys, which she later sells.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of food and corn, so she can develop the business faster with her customers, who like the quality of the chicken she sells.

She decided to engage in this type of business out of her own creativity; it is a very good business that earns revenues and profits.  She returns whatever is left over and invests it in the purchase of food for her chickens, and by doing so she can dependably contribute to the household earnings.

What she wants most is that with this small business and the loan, she can earn her own money and with it build a better house for their children to live comfortably, as well as continue to support them in their studies.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of turkeys and chickens with chicks, and also to buy food to fatten them for later sale.

loans.name: Ludi Elem

texts.es:
La señora Ludí Elem es casada con el señor Fidel y con quien procreo do hijos que aun están a su responsabilidad y son: elisana meradi de cuatro años de edad y el más pequeño es Franklin Michel de un año de edad.

   Ella se dedica  a  compra y venta de ropas, para damas, caballero y niños, así también en la compra de zapatos, en donde lleva dos años y ocho meses  en lo que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello está teniendo  un buen resultado dentro de su hogar y familia.

   Lo que lo inspiro ha esta actividad fue su familia ya que también quiere apoya a su esposo con los ingresos  de la casa y darle lo mejor a su pequeña familia.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda tener mejor ingresos y con el préstamo apoyarse para que mejor sea su mercancía.
texts.en:
Ludí Elem is married to Fidel and they have two children who are still their responsibility.  They are: Elisana Meradi, 4, and Franklin Michel, 1.

She buys and sells clothes for women, men and children.  She also buys shoes.  She’s been in business two years and eight months and comments that she does well since she’s having good results with it within her family and home.

Her family inspired her to go into this activity because she wants to help her husband with income for the home and provide the best for her little family.

What she most wants to get from this small activity is improved income and to use the loan to help improve her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals and clothes to resell later.

loans.name: Blanca Irene

texts.es:
La señora  Blanca Irene vive n la localidad de llano grande ellas es casada y a su responsabilidad tiene a dos hijos y son: Crispín Alejandro de quince años de edad y abenair de nueve años de edad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de ingredientes para la elaboración de dulces  de leche, así como también pastillas de cuajo para la leche con que elabora los quesos, en esta actividad lleva diesi ocho años y nueve meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a tenido un buen ingreso de solvencia económica.

     Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su esposo quien es el que se encarga de ordeñar las vacas y juntar la leche para elaborar los quesos y ella decidió ayudarlo para que juntos se poyen en la actividad.

     Su más grande deseo es que con el préstamo y la quesería pueda salir adelante  y darles  estudio a sus hijos que están creciendo.
texts.en:
Blanca Irene lives in Llano Grande.  She’s married and has two children in her care.  They are: Crispín Alejandro, 15, and Abenair, 9.

She requested the loan to buy ingredients to make milk-based candy as well as rennet tablets for the milk she uses to make cheese.  She’s been in this line of work for 18 years and nine months and comments that she does well with it; she’s had good income and economic solvency.

Her husband motivated her to get into this activity since he milks the cows and gathers the milk to make cheese; she decided to help him so that they can help each other out in this activity.

Her greatest wish is that with the loan and cheese store to be able to get ahead and provide schooling for her young children who are growing up.

loans.use: to buy candy and cheese making ingredients.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Guadalupe, vive en la localidad de llano grande municipio de Coapilla Chiapas, ella  es casad con el señor Sergio, y ya no tiene ningún hijo a su responsabilidad.

    Ella invierte el préstamo en la compra  de mantas y pastillas para la elaboración de quesos en donde comenta que lleva  veinte años y nueve  meses, en lo que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha sacado adelantes a su familia.

  Lo que lo   motivo ha esta actividad fue su esposo quien trabajaba de ordeñar,  en una comunidad y fue como aprendió a elaborar los quesos  y  con el tiempo su esposo tuvo sus propias vacas y comenzaron ellos mismos a  practicarlo  y desde entonces los dos trabajan esta pequeña actividad.

   Lo que más desea es que con  la bendición de dios y el prestamos pues seguir trabajando para sostenerse en su gastos que se generan en su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Guadalupe lives in Llano Grande in the municipality of Coapilla in Chiapas.  She is married to Señor Sergio, and they have no children for whom they are responsible.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of blankets and pads for cheese making, which she says she has been doing for twenty years and nine months.  She says it's going well, as she has moved her family forward in their lives.

The reason she started her activity was because of her husband, who was working milking cows in a community; this was how he learned to make cheese.  Eventually her husband got his own cows and they started to practice cheese-making themselves.  Since then, the two of them work in this small business.

What she wants most is with the blessing of God and the loans, to be able to keep working to keep herself given their household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of blankets and pads for making cheeses.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys  tiene  veintiséis años de  edad ella es soltera  y vive en el barrio trinidad, de copaínala estado e Chiapas México. 

    Ella  trabaja con su hermano, es en una tienda de impresiones y ella solicito el  préstamo para invertirlo en la   compra de catálogos, de la marca, avión, jafra y Arabela, en donde lleva nueve meses y comenta que le va bien ya que con  ello ha tenido un buen  resultado.

   Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue por si misma ya que con ello desea tener sus propios  ingresos para  apoyarse con sus gastos que se generan en su vida diaria, aunque cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano lo demás lo dispone para apoyar a su mama.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña  actividad pueda tener sus propios ingresos para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys is twenty-six years old.  She is single and lives in the Trinidad neighborhood of Copaínala, in Chiapas State in Mexico.

She works with her ​​brother in a photocopying store, and she is applying for the loan to invest in purchases from beauty brand catalogs including Avon, Jafra and Arabela.   She has been doing this for nine months and says things are going well as she has had good results.

The reason she started this activity was for herself, as she wishes to have her own income to support her daily living expenses.  She counts on the support of her brother, on top of which she provides support for her mother.

What she wants most is to earn her own income from this small activity, so she can move forward in life with her family.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of cosmetics from Avon and Arabela brands.

loans.name: Aura Luz

texts.en: Aura Luz is a fifty-year-old mother of two children, ages 18 and 20.  For the last twenty-five years, Aura Luz has sold pork from pigs that she buys from breeders. She learned this business from her mother who originally started the business.  With the loan proceeds, Aura Luz can buy a greater quantity of pigs.  Her dream is to improve her living conditions and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of pigs.

loans.name: Las Flores De Tlacoachistlahuaca Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las flores de tlacoachistlahuaca, los integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre puesto que así se llama su comunidad donde viven y porque en la casa de señora donde se reúnen tiene un jardín donde hay variedad de flores, es por eso que decidieron nombrar de esta manera a su grupo, esta historia es acerca de la señora Antonia, ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella cuenta con 36 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, Cesar, Marcela y Juan, de los cuales los tres estudian, el mayor está cursando el tercer año de secundaria, otro más en sexto año de primaria y el menor en segundo año de preescolar, ella tiene una tienda de ropa y bisutería, con la cual lleva más de 7 años.

Doña Antonia se decidió por este negocio, ya que dice quería buscar la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para darles una muy buena educación a sus hijos, ya que no contaba con el respaldo económico de algún familiar, ella invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas mercancía como son: vestidos, pantalones, faldas, shorts, blusas, playeras, camisas, ropa interior y mas bisutería como: aretes, pulseras, anillos, collares, para así continuar con las ventas de sus artículos. 

El sueño que tiene doña Antonia es el de ampliar un poco mas su local ahí mismo en su casa para continuar con sus ventas y así tenerla mucho mas surtida, y obtener más y mejores ingresos y con eso poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios, para que tengan una muy buena carrera profesional.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron ya que gracias a esto su negocio empezara a mejorar mucho y su vida y la de su familia también cambiaran.

Las integrantes del grupo las flores de tlacoachistlahuaca y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Ángela-venta de perfumes, Rosa Iris-venta de ropa, Viridiana-venta de cosméticos, Ismaela-venta de tamales, Flora Alexis-venta de ropa, María-mercería, Froylan- estética, Divina-frutería.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Flores de Tlacoachistlahuaca.”  The members decided on this name because that’s the name of the community they live in and because the woman’s house they meet in has a garden with a variety of flowers and that’s why they decided to name their group like this.

This story is about Antonia since she’s one of the group members.  She’s 36 years old and the single mother of three children: Cesar, Marcela and Juan.  All three are in school.  The oldest is in third year of high school, another is in sixth year of primary school and the youngest is in second year of preschool.  She has had a clothing and costume jewelry store for over seven years.

Antonia decided on this business because she says she wanted to find a way to improve her and her family’s quality of life and also to provide her children with a good education and she could not count on support from any family member.  She used her loan to buy more merchandise like: dresses, pants, skirts, shorts, t-shirts, shirts, underwear and more costume jewelry like earrings, bracelets, rings and necklaces to continue selling her articles.

Antonia’s dream is to expand her home based store a bit more to continue with sales and to have it much better stocked to earn better income and be able to continue supporting her children’s schooling so that they will have very good professional careers.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva for the support from the loan she was granted because, thanks to this, her business will begin to improve a lot and her live and her family’s life will also change.

The members of the “Las Flores de Tlacoachistlahuaca” group and the activities they carry out are:

Ángela - perfume sales,

Rosa Iris - clothing sales, 

Viridiana - cosmetics sales, 

Ismaela - tamales sales, 

Flora Alexis - clothing sales, 

María – notions, 

Froilán - beauty salon and fruit sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora María de los Ángeles, vive en la localidad  de San Miguel, ella es casada con el señor Ramiro y con quien procreo dos hijos, Demisio Ramiro de nueve años  y  Liliana  de cuatro años.

    Ella solicito el préstamo  para invertirlo en la compra  de platicos de la marca tupperware como son: cubetas, tupper, vasos, como también  colchas,  entre otros y con esta actividad  lleva un año y cuatro meses y esta contenta porque le está dando un buen resultado.

   Lo que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue su familia  para apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa y  así juntos trabajar para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su  pequeña familia.

    Lo que más desea es que con el tiempo ella pueda tener su propia distribuidora de productos de esta marca para apoyar a otras personas que como ella tienen una pequeña actividad.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles lives in the San Miguel community. She is married to Ramiro with whom she has two children, Demisio Ramiro who is nine years old and Liliana who is four. 

She requested the loan to invest in the purchase of Tupperware brand plastics such as buckets, tupperware, and cups, as well as bedspreads among other items. She has been doing this for a year and four months and is happy because it is yielding good profits. 

Her motivation for starting this activity was her family so that she could support her husband with income for the household, and thus work together to give a better quality of life to their small family. 

What she wishes for most is that, with time, she would have her own business by which she might have the means to continue working in the future, and be a distributor so she can support other people with this activity.

loans.use: to purchase plastic dishware.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina, es casada con el señor  Omar y con quien procreo dos hijos  quienes a un están a su responsabilidad  y son: Omar Antonio  de trece años de edad y Samuel de tan solo un año y un mes de edad.

    Ella es ama  de casa y solicito e préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pollos para venderlo  destazo  en la misma localidad así  también  la compra de carne de res para venderlo en  tasajo, en esta actividad lleva  un año y cuatro meses y comenta que le va muy bien ya que con ello ha tenido un buen resultado.

    Su motivo ha esta actividad fue por si sola así tendrá su propio dinero y apoyara a su esposo con los ingresos de  la casa y así juntos trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
 
    Lo que más desea con su actividad es mejorar su mercancía para que sus clientes le mas y así  mejor sea su ganancias y pueda seguir trabajando el préstamo.
texts.en:
Marina is married to Omar with whom she has two children still under their care, who are Omar Antonio, 13 years old, and Samuel, who is only one year and one month of age. 

She is a housewife and requested the loan to invest in purchasing chickens for cutting up and selling in the same area, as well as buying beef to sell as beef jerky. She has had this business a year and four months and comments that it is going very well since she has made good profits. 

Her motivation for this business was herself, so she would have her own money, and she will support husband with income for the household, and thus work together to get their children ahead. 

What she most wishes for in her business is to improve her merchandise so that her clients [buy] more from her, so her profits will be better and she may continue working the loan.

loans.use: to purchase chicken by the rack to sell it cut up.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La señora maricela  vive es de un lugar conocido como san miguel, de copaínala estado de Chiapas México. Ella es cada  con el señor Alfonso  y con quien procreo una hija de nombre Sandi anay de cuatro años de edad.

   Ella se dedica  a la compra de  y venta de trastes como son: ollas, platos, bajillas, vasos, entre otros, en esta actividad aun esta iniciando  y lleva cuatro meses ya que la actividad anterior no le dio un buen resultado por la competencia que hay.

  Lo que lo  motivo ha esta  nueva actividad fue su vecina quien es la que se encarga de comprar la mercancía y también se las da a ella para  que la apoye a venderlo  y las ganancias que baya obteniendo lo sirva ella para tener sus  propios ingresos.

     Lo que más desea es que con el préstamo que a solicitado pueda mejorar su compra de mercancía para que con ello mejor sea sus ganancias que baya obteniendo y así sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maricela is from an area known as San Miguel, in Copaínala in the state of Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Alfonso with whom she has a daughter by the name of Sandi Anay who is four years old.   

She devotes herself to buying and selling dishware such as pots, plates,and bowls, dinner sets, cups and other items. She is just starting up this business and has been doing it for four months, since her previous business did not yield good profits on account of the competition. 

She was motivated to start this business because of her neighbor who is responsible for purchasing the merchandise, and who also gives them to her so she may help her sell it and have her own income from the profits she is making. 

What she most wishes for is that with the loan she has requested, she would improve her buying of merchandise in order to improve her earnings and thus get her children ahead.

loans.use: to purchase plastic dishware.

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es: Miryam vive en el municipio de Soledad con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 11 a 21 años, allí se dedica a la producción y ventas de picadas, negocio creado por la necesidad de generar ingresos, e iniciado como una venta de fritos , en el momento que su esposo se encontraba desempleado. Cuando el negocio empezó a tomar forma, fue agregándole otros productos derivados de la harina de trigo,  aunque contaba con muy poco capital de trabajo  para cubrir sus primeras demandas, pero aun así hizo muchos esfuerzos para lograrlo;  su esposo siempre la ha acompañado,  pues cuando Miryam se enfermó él  asumió toda la operación de este y aun continua apoyándola.  Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el  comprará materias primas e insumos como maíz, azúcar yuca, harina de trigo y leche. Su sueño es lograr posicionarlo y está empezando a hacerlo. Con el apoyo de la Fundación ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo, diversificar su oferta, y concentrarse en nuevos mercados, como en las casas de eventos sociales y fiestas familiares que son sus más apreciados clientes. En la actualidad tiene la expectativa de recibir el subsidio de vivienda en el megaproyecto Villas de San Pablo, donde la Fundación desarrolla su enfoque misional en la fundamentado en la construcción de comunidades sostenibles
texts.en:
Miryam lives in the town of Soledad with her husband and four children whose ages range from 11 to 21.  She makes and sells “picadas” (combination plates containing various fried meats, sausages, offal, manioc and potatoes), a business that arose from the need to generate income and that started as a sale of fried fast food when her husband became unemployed.  As the business started to take shape she started adding other items derived from wheat flour.  Although she had very little working capital to cover her initial demand, she still stove to accomplish it.  Her husband has always been by her side and when Miryam became ill he took over the entire operation and still continues to help her out.

Her Kiva loan is the first financing she’s gotten from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy raw materials and ingredients like corn, sugar, manioc, wheat flour and milk.  Her dream is to position it and she’s starting to do so.  With help from the Fundación she’s managed to increase her working capital, diversify her offer and concentrate on new markets like sites that are used for special events and family parties which are her most valued customers.  

She is currently hoping to get a housing subsidy for Villas de San Pedro where the Fundación is developing its mission statement‘s focus on building sustainable communities.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies like corn, sugar, manioc, wheat flour and milk.

loans.name: El Pinito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre el pinito, las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre, porque en el lugar donde se reúnen hay un pequeño pino, esta historia es acerca de la señora Irma, ya que es la representante de este grupo, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada, tiene cuatro  hijos, esteban, Mariela, mariano y Abigail, de los cuales solo dos estudian, uno está cursando el primer año de la carrera de derecho y la menor esta en segundo año de prepa, ya que los dos mayores ya están casados, ella tiene una dulcería, desde hace 11 años.

Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que quería buscar la forma de apoyar a sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida, aparte de que esta actividad le permite estar al pendiente de ellos y no descuidarlos, también para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de más dulces, refrescos, aguas y jugos, para esta temporada de calor que es insoportable.


La meta que se ha puesto doña Irma es darles una excelente calidad de vida, a sus hijos ya que también, quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, tanto que está pensando en construir local para poner una tienda de abarrotes y así tener mucho mas surtido y mas variedad de productos, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.

Ella dice que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones y les gusta mucho trabajar, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad.

Doña Irma le da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su familia a Fundación realidad y kiva  por que gracias a ellos podrá mejorar su vida y la de su familia, puesto que ahora tendrán una excelente calidad de vida y solvencia económica.

Las integrantes del grupo el pinito y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Áraceli-venta de pollos, juljencia-venta de ropa, clementina-venta de cosméticos, aristea-venta de tamales, jeronima-venta de ropa, maria-mercería, adilene-venta de camotes, priciliana-venta de camote, irma-dulceria, juana-venta de pan, rogaciana-venta de pan, felicitas-venta de tamales.
texts.en:
This group is called 'El Pinito' (The Little Pine Tree).  The members gave the group this name because there is a small pine tree in the place where they meet.  This story is about Irma who is the group's representative.  She is 40 years old, married, and has four children: Esteban, Mariela, Mariano and Abigail.  Only two of her children are studying.  One is in his first year of a law degree and her youngest is in her second year of high school.  The two eldest children are already married.  Irma has owned a grocery store for 11 years.

Irma tells us that she decided to start out in this business because she wanted a way to support her children and provide them with a better quality of life.  In addition, this business allows her to attend to her children and not neglect them.  She is also able to support her husband with their household expenses.  Irma used the loan that she requested to invest in buying more sweet treats, soft drinks, water and juice for this hot season which is unbearable.

Irma's goal is to provide her children with an excellent quality of life.  She would also like to grow her business a lot more.  She is thinking of building premises in order to set up a grocery store so that she can offer her customers a wider range of products in order to improve and increase her profits.

Irma says that all her fellow group members are responsible people who meet their obligations and really enjoy working in order to improve themselves and get ahead even when faced with difficulties.

Irma gives thanks to Fundación Realidad and Kiva on behalf of herself and her family.  Thanks to them, she will be able to improve her own life and that of her family.  They will now have an excellent quality of life and financial solvency.

The members of the "El Pinito" group and the businesses that they are engaged in are as follows:
Áraceli - chicken sales
Juljencia - clothes sales
Clementina - cosmetics sales
Aristea - selling tamales
Jeronima - clothes sales
María - selling sewing supplies
Adilene - selling sweet potatoes
Priciliana - selling sweet potatoes
Irma - selling sweet treats
Juana - selling bread
Rogaciana - selling bread
Felicitas - selling tamales

loans.use: to invest in buying more sweet treats, soft drinks, water and juice

loans.name: Gladys Marlene

texts.en: Gladys Marlene is a 53-year-old single mother of one adult child.  Gladys has owned a small convenience store for the last four years.  She would like to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase a greater variety of products like cleaning supplies, soap, candy, soda, bread and basic grains for her business.  Gladys’ main is to continue to grow her business and she is very appreciative of the opportunity to become a borrower.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies, soap, candy, sodas, bread and basic grains for her business.

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
Este  grupo se llama el manantial , sus integrantes  decidieron  ponerle ese nombre por que su barrio se llama "El Manantial", estado de Oaxaca  esta conformado por diez integrantes  que se conocen desde aproximadamente 30 años son vecinas y familiares.

La señora Zita  es integrante  del grupo "El Manantial", ella tiene treinta y cinco años de edad, siempre ha vivido en ésta comunidad, es por ello que desde muy pequeña conoce a los demás integrantes del grupo. 
Ella estudio hasta secundo grado de la secundaria  tiene un total de cuatro hijos  dos  mujeres y dos varones , se dedica  a la venta  de calzado  y necesita el préstamo para comprar .
Necesita el préstamo para comprar mas calzado y así exhibirlos en le pequeño local que acaba de construir su esposo para  que cuando no tenga tiempo de salir vende desde su local.
Sus clientes le recomienda que venda todo tipo de calzado lo que son tenis y zapatos escolares  para que  ya no vayan  a otro lugar a comprar.
Uno de sus sueños de la señora  Zita es poner una zapatería para que así tenga algo que dejarles  a  sus hijos.

Los otros  ocho integrantes se llaman :
Isabel-representante del grupo vende frutas y verduras
Antonia- venta de antojitos mexicanos .
Juana- venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Catalina-para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan.
Gloria- para  la compra de  insumos para la elaboración de pan.
Cecilia-venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Luciana-para la elaboración de tamales.
Clara- venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Cecilia-para la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Están muy contentas por el apoyo que les a dado fundación realidad para hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
This group is called “El Manantial” (The Spring). Its members decided to call it this because their neighborhood is called “El Manantial,” state of Oaxaca.  It has ten members who have known each other for approximately 30 years; they are neighbors and family members.

Zita is a member of the “El Manantial” group and is 35 years old.  She has lived in this community her whole life and for that reason has known the other members of the group for a long time. She studied up to 8th grade.  She has a total of four children, two girls and two boys.  She sells footwear and needs the loan to buy more footwear to display in the small locale that her husband has just finished building so that when she does not have time to go out to sell she can do it from her locale.  Her customers are recommending that she sell all types of footwear, like tennis shoes and shoes for school, so that they won’t go elsewhere to buy.   One of Zita’s dreams is to set up a shoe store to have something to leave to her children.

The other group members are:

Isabel - sells fruits and vegetables.
Antonia - sale of traditional Mexican snacks.
Juana - sale of traditional Mexican snacks.
Catalina - to buy ingredients to make bread.
Gloria - to buy ingredients to make bread.
Cecilia - sale of traditional Mexican snacks.
Luciana - to make tamales.
Clara - sale of traditional Mexican snacks.
Cecilia- sale of traditional Mexican snacks.

They are very happy with the support that Fundación Realidad has given them to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy and sell shoes.

loans.name: Yeral

texts.en:
Yeral was born to be a businessman. “It’s in my blood,” he says. Growing up in Chimbote, Peru, his interest in business was piqued early by watching his parents. His father worked at a local restaurant while his mother sold vegetables and fruits. Oftentimes, he would join his mother on these pursuits and learned the tricks of the trade from her.

His parents’ tremendous influence stayed with him as he moved from Peru to San Francisco in 2004. While working a series of miscellaneous jobs, Yeral’s desire to open up his own business grew. However, as a recent immigrant, he didn’t know how to get things started.

In 2010, his drive to become an entrepreneur propelled him to get into business the way he knew best:  Yeral began serving delicious Peruvian treats at food festivals.  In order to secure a spot at a Peruvian Food Festival, he needed a loan to pay the initial fee but when he turned to a major bank, he was refused credit because he did not have tax returns, a business license or a business bank account. 

Without a set destination, he marched through San Francisco’s Mission district, adamant that somewhere in the sea of pay-day loans and pawn shops, he would find a financial institution that would help him.  At last, he stumbled upon Opportunity Fund, where the staff recognized his potential and his passion.  Yeral got the cash he needed to capitalize his business, as well as a foothold into the mainstream American financial system.

At last year’s Peruvian Food Festival, Yeral sold over 400 plates of food and gained recognition for his talent making tasty Peruvian treats.  He wants to return again this year, and this time he expects to sell closer to 800 plates of food, doubling his business over last year. Yeral needs a second loan for $4,000 in order to buy more inventory and secure his spot at this year’s Peruvian Food Festival, which will be held in July.  

Currently, Yeral devotes 50% of his time to expanding his business and he spends the other 50% working at a bar. He aims to expand his business so that one day he can devote 100% of his energy to serving delicious Peruvian treats.

loans.use: to buy more inventory and secure his spot at this year’s Peruvian Food Festival.

loans.name: Katherin Noemi

texts.en:
Katherin is 19 years old and lives near the city of Latacunga in central Ecuador. She is single and lives with her parents. Katherin is responsible and persevering. 

Her loan will be used to buy animals, particularly pigs, for her farm. She began her pig-raising business by raising piglets. She works alongside her parents and reports that her business is going well and that she wants to buy more pigs to increase her herd. 

Katherin received her first loan from FODEMI in the past year. She feels that it permitted her to grow economically and helped her pay the household expenses. She hopes to “have a profession and always be moving forward” with her life. In the future, she’d like expand her business and open a store.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Brigida Del Carmen

texts.en:
Brigida is a 39-year-old married mother of three children, ages 15, 12 and 7.  For nearly three years, she has had a store in the market where she sells general merchandise, such as clothes and cosmetics.  

Brigida plans to use the loan proceeds to buy a wider variety of high quality goods.  Her goal is to continue to grow her business to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 38 años, casada con Julián de 40 años con quien tiene 4 hijos quienes viven en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Edith recuerda que se inició en las labores agrícolas, aún desde muy niña estando en la chacra de sus  padres, comenzó la  mayor parte de su tiempo sembrando y cosechando los productos como cacao y café, es donde ella vio una oportunidad de que el producto de cacao tenía una  gran demanda, es por ello que empezó a realizar sus propias plantaciones luego a independizarse de sus padres, no sin antes les agradece eternamente por las lecciones de aprendizaje que la inculcaron. En el presente produce en grandes volúmenes, por ende le otorga buena rentabilidad, para ello trata de cuidar su fuente principal ante cualquier plaga que se le aparezca, y normalmente recibe la ayuda  de su pareja, pero en temporadas de cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones para que le puedan facilitar la extracción de su producto de manera eficiente y eficaz. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y de esta manera podrá garantizarse para poder realizar prestamos venideros. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles ella invertirá en la poda de su cacao. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, ella se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y de esta manera podrá garantizarse para poder realizar prestamos venideros. Ella esta feliz por el mejor desempeño en su banco comunal ya que todos son solidarios. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles ella invertirá en la poda de sus plantas de cacao.
texts.en:
Edith is 38 years old and married to 40 year-old Julián.  The couple have four children and live in Puerto Mayo community, in Pichari district.  Edith remembers that she started out farming when she was still a girl, on her parents' farm.  She spent most of her time sowing and harvesting products such as cacao and coffee.  Edith saw an opportunity.  She saw that cacao was in great demand and so started setting out her own plantations.  She then started farming independently from her parents after having thanked them profusely for the training that they had given her.

Edith currently produces cacao in large volumes which provides her with a good profitability.  For this reason, she tries to protect her main source of income from any pests that appear and she normally receives help from her partner.  However, during harvest season, she needs help from laborers who make it easier for her to pick her produce efficiently and effectively. 

This is Edith's second loan from MFP.  She pledges to be punctual in making her loan repayments so that she can ensure she is able to take out further loans in the future.  She will invest her 1,000 Peruvian soles in having her cacao plants pruned.  Edith is happy to be a member of her community bank because all the members are very supportive of each other.

loans.use: to hire laborers to prune and weed her cacao plants

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha de 37 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Es viuda y tiene dos hijos que estudian en universidad. Se dedica a la venta de frutas.

Escogió esa actividad porque quedo viuda y con su hijas que tenia que sacar adelante, por eso decidió vender frutas. Labora sola de 7H00 am a 7h00 pm. Con el apoyo del préstamo desea para las matriculas y utilice de sus hijos y a al vez comprar frutas para el negocio. Lo que mas anhela es tener un local donde pueda comercializar sus productos.
texts.en:
Martha, 37, lives in Primavera de Duran (urban outskirts that were originally irregular with several hills, streams and lagoons that are still present as evidence of deteriorating ecology).  She’s a widow with two children who are at university.  She is a fruit vendor. She chose this activity because she was left a widow with two daughters to support; she decided to sell fruit.  She works alone from 7am until 7pm.

With help from the loan she wants to pay tuition and buy school supplies for her children and at the same time buy fruit for the business.  What she most wishes for is to have a locale that she can sell her products in.

loans.use: to pay school tuition and to buy fruit.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 28 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (fue nombrado así debido a la especie de árboles Guazuma ulmifolia. El Guasmo es un barrio popular, de clase humilde, que anteriormente era una hacienda) de Guayaquil. Es un hombre trabajador que busca salir adelante en los gastos del hogar.. Es casado y su esposa trabaja vendiendo comesticos por catálogos y tienen un hijo de año y medio. Tiene un taller de bicicleta

Hace un tiempo atrás el era ayudante de un taller y un día decidió ponerse su negocio propio. Labora de 8h00 am a 13H00 pm en su taller. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar materiales para su taller como llantas, tubos, timones y varios cosas. En un futuro su quiere comprar una maquina que le hace falta en su taller y a la vez desea ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julio is 28 and he lives in an urban area of el Guasmo (so named because of a type of tree-Guazuma ulmifolia).  El Guasmo is a poor neighborhood with humble residents (in the past it was a plantation) of Guayaquil.  He is a hard-working man who is looking to get ahead with household expenses.  He is married and his wife also works selling cosmetics through catalogs. They have a year and a half year old son. 

 Julio has a bicycle repair shop. In the past he was an assistant in a shop and one day he decided to set up his own business.  He works from 8 am to 1:30 pm in his shop.  He will use the loan to buy supplies for his shop such as tires, tubes, steering wheels and some other items.  In the future he want to buy a machine that he needs in his shop and also to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for his shop such as tires, tubes and steering wheels

loans.name: Monica Del Rocio

texts.es:
Monica de 38 años,  vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. Es separada y tienen tres hijos de 2, 8 y 7 años que estudian en escuela fiscales. Se dedica a la venta de ropas y varias productos.

Empezó hace un tiempo atrás a raíz de su separación inicio con la ventas de ropa y varios productos y amplio su negocio. Labora sola de 8H00 am a 17h00 pm. Con el apoyo de préstamo desea incrementar su capital comprando mas mercadería de ropa . En un futuro quiere abrir un local para promocionar mas sus productos y todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Monica, 38, lives in an urban zone in Las Orquídeas (so called because at the beginning there were many orchids there) in Guayaquil.  She is separated and has three children who are 2, 8 and 7 years of age and who go to public school.  She sells clothes and assorted products.

She started some time ago due to her separation.  She started with sales of clothes and various products and expanded the business.  She works alone from 8am until 5pm.  With help from the loan she wants to increase her capital buying more clothes.  In the future she’d like to open a locale to better promote her wares and all her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Monte Verde Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Monte Verde y se ubica en la ribera Benito Juárez.

     La señora a quien se le tomo la entrevista se llama Victoria ella es casada con el  señor Santos , y con quien a su responsabilidad tiene  a tres hijos  y son: Reynol de veinte años, de edad, Irving de quince años de edad y el más pequeño es Bladímir  de trece años de edad.

      Ella  se dedica a esta a actividad de abarrotes, y solicito el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercancía como son: azúcar, frijol, aceite, jabón, entre otros, para que los clientes encuentren  lo que buscan  y l tiene ubicado en la casa de su  hija.


     Su inspiración por esta actividad fue  por su familia para tener un mejor ingreso  y a si tener un mejor control de solvencia económica y apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando a un así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en  el campo.

      Lo que más desea con s actividad y el préstamo es que pueda seguir trabajando para tener sus propios a horro para  que con el tiempo pueda tener su  propia actividad en su hogar.

     Las personas que integran el grupo son: la señora María celinda, quien invierte el préstamo en la compra de mercancía para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la siguiente  señora es  Guadalupe  quien invertirá el préstamo en la compra de hilos, agujas, telas para la elaboración de ropa, y por último la señora flor de luz quien también lo invierte en la compra de ropas  para luego salir a venderlo en la mismas localidad.
texts.en:
The group is called Monte Verde (Green Mountain) and is located in Ribera Benito Juárez.  The woman who was interviewed is Victoria.  She’s married to Santos and they have three children still in their care.  They are: Reynol, 20, Irving, 15, and the youngest, Bladímir, 13.

She is a grocer and asked for the loan to invest in merchandise like: sugar, beans, oil and soap, among others, so that the customers will find what they are looking for.  The store is located in her daughter’s house.

Her inspiration for this activity was to have better family income, to have better control over her financial solvency and to support her children who are studying.  She relies on help from her husband, who works in the fields, as well.

What she most wants with this activity and with the loan is to be able to continue working to be able to have her own savings and in time manage to have a home-based business of her own.

The people who make up the group are:

María Celinda, who will use the loan to buy stock items for her grocery store,

Guadalupe, who will use the loan to buy thread, needles and fabric to make clothes, and lastly,

Flor de Luz, who will buy clothes to resell in the same community.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Melba Mercedes

texts.en: Melba Mercedes is a married mother of two children, ages 11 and 20. For the last 16 years, she has run a small eatery.  The loan proceeds will help her continue to operate her business, more specifically, will help her purchase basic grains she uses in food preparation.  Melba Mercedes would like to grow her business and increase the income to be able to support her family better.

loans.use: purchase basic grains she uses in food preparation

loans.name: Aura Maria

texts.es: Aura comprará con su nuevo credikiva comprará  materias primas en mayor volumen para responder a unos contratos de ropa infantil que ganó y le ayudarán mucho mas en sus ingresos . Con su credito anterior compró materiales elaboró productos decorativos y aumentó ligeramente sus utilidades. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores:   " Muchisimas gracias por todo lo que estan haciendo por los miscroempresarios es una excelente ayuda" Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Aura ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/219623
texts.en: Aura will purchase, with her new Kiva loan, basic materials in large volume so she may fulfill some orders she received for children's clothing, which will help her much more with her earnings. With her previous loan she purchased materials, made decorative products, and slightly increased her profits. She sends the following message to her financers: "Thanks so very much for everything you are doing for the micro-business owners, it is excellent help." If you would like to know Aura's story, go to the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/219623

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies in large volume.

loans.name: La Santa Cruz Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama santa C., porque así se llama la colonia donde viven y pues todos son originarios de la misma, esta historia es acerca de la señora margarita, puesto que es la representante de esta UDE, ella tiene 34 años de edad está casada con el señor Mario, con el cual tiene 5 hijos Ángel, Israel, alondra, marcela, Martin y estefani, de los cuales solo 3 estudian, el mayor está cursando el segundo año de secundaria y los otros dos quinto y sexto de primaria, ya que los otros dos aun son muy pequeños  de 2 y 10 meses de edad, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva 6 años.

Doña margarita eligió esta actividad, puesto que es lo que mejor se vende en su comunidad, también porque dice que es una muy buena fuente de ingresos, que le ayuda para continuar apoyando la economía de su familia, el préstamo que recibió lo invirtió en la compra de mas mercancía como son: refrescos, arroz, frijol, azúcar, sal, galletas, aceite, leche, jabón, clarasol, detergente y papel higiénico

La meta que dice tener doña mago, (como mejor la conocen en su comunidad) para su negocio, es la de continuar invirtiéndole mucho mas, ya que lo quiere hacerlo crecer, puesto que está pensando en ampliar su local, para tenerlo muy bien surtido y así mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias, para poder continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudio, para que puedan tener una muy buena carrera profesional.

Nos comenta que en su grupo se trabaja muy bien, puesto que todos los integrantes se conocen perfectamente y son personas muy responsables con sus pagos y sobre todo bien trabajadores.

Las personas que conforman el grupo son las siguientes: obdulia, Nicolasa, María de Jesús, margarita, saida, Tania, Sonia, María Félix, Elizabeth y Lorenza, quienes se dedican a diferentes actividades como: abarrotes, venta de pescados, carne, refrescos, colchas, elaboración de tamales, frutería, venta de cosméticos, antojitos, etc.
texts.en:
This group is called “Santa C.” (Holy Cross) because that’s the name of the neighborhood where they live and because they all come from there.  This story is about Margarita because she’s the representative of this communal bank.  She is 34 years old and married to Mario.  They have five children: Ángel, Israel, Alondra, Marcela, Martin and Estefani.  Only three of them are studying.  The oldest is in 8th grade and the next two are in 5th and 6th grades.  The last two are still too little; they are 2 years and 10 months old respectively.  She has had a grocery store for six years.

Margarita chose this activity because it’s what sells best in her community and also because she says it’s a very good source of income that helps her continue to support her family’s economy.  The loan she got she used to buy more merchandise like: soft-drinks, rice, beans, sugar, salt, cookies, oil, milk, soap, Clarasol (bleach), detergent and toilet paper.

The goal that Doña Mago (as she’s better known in her community) has for her business is to continue investing much more in it because she wants to make it grow because she’s planning to enlarge it to have it very well stocked to increase and improve her profits to continue to support her children with their schooling so that they will be able to have very good professional careers.

She comments that one works very well in her group because all the members know each other perfectly well and they are people who are responsible with their payments and, above all, very good hard workers.

The other group members are: Obdulia, Nicolasa, María de Jesús, Margarita, Saida, Tania, Sonia, María Félix, Elizabeth y Lorenza who carry out a variety of activities like fish sales, grocery sales, meat sales, snack sales, bedspread sales, tamale making, fruit sales, cosmetics sales, fast food sales, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La señora Georgia, vive en la localidad de San Juan, cerca de coapilla, ella es madre soltera con una hija  de nombre Rosalba Esther  de ocho años de edad.

    Se dedica a su negocio de abarrotes desde hace seis años y cuatro meses, y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía y  así tener surtida su tienda, ya que es con esto  que está teniendo  ingresos para sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.

   Se inspiro a esta actividad para tener sus propios ingresos   y así de esta manera tener sus propios ingresos, paraqué con ello tenga de donde darle lo mejor a su hija ya que su esposo el abandono cuando la bebe estaba muy chico y ella decidió tener un trabajo en donde pueda apoyarse con lo gastos.

    Lo que desea es que con esta actividad pueda salir adelante y con la bendición de dios con el tiempo agrandar su negocio para apoyar a su hija a que  tenga una profesión.
texts.en:
Señora Georgina lives in San Juan, near Coapilla.  She is a single mother with a daughter named Rosalba Esther, who is eight years old.

She has been working in her grocery business for six years and four months, and is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of goods to keep her store well stocked, as it is through this that she earns income so her young daughter can move forward in life.

She was inspired to do this activity so as to have her own income, and in this way she earns her own income.  With this she can provide the best for her daughter.  Her husband left her when the baby was very young and she decided to take on work which could help her with expenses.

What she wants is for this business to progress, and that with the blessing of God she can in time enlarge her business to support her daughter, so she can get a profession.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of goods to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita, es de un lugar  llamado san Juan  de coapilla  Chiapas México, vive en unión libre con el señor  Aricel  y con quien procreo un hijo de nombre Fabián de tan solo cinco años de edad.

   Ella se dedica  a su hogar, como también a la compra y veta de frutas y verduras, para salir a venderlo en su hogar, en esta actividad lleva  dos años y dos meses en lo que comenta que le bar bien ya que con ello esta a aumentando su solvencia económica. 

    En esta actividad se inspiro para apoyar a su poso a  aportar dinero y así juntos sacar adelantes a su único hijo  y quiere darlo lo mejor para que su crecimiento valla mejorando día a día.

      Lo único que desea es que con sus ahorros que baya obteniendo, logre incrementar mas su negocio y con el tiempo construir un local para que pueda seguir vendiendo.
texts.en:
Margarita is from a place called San Juan, in Copainalá, Chiapas, Mexico.  She lives with her common-law husband Aricel with whom she has a son, Fabián, who is only five years old.

Margarita looks after her home and also buys and sells fruit and vegetables.  She sells her produce from her home.  She has been in this business for two years and two months.  She says that her business is doing well since it is helping her to increase her financial solvency.

Margarita started out in this business in order to support her husband by contributing money to their household.  Together the couple manage to get their son ahead in life.  They want to provide him with the very best so that he can grow every day.

The only thing that Margarita wishes for is that she can increase her business through the savings that she has made and that, over time, she is able to build premises so that she can continue making her sales.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Hercilia

texts.es:
Doña Hercilia, vive en una localidad que se llama San Juan  estado de Chiapas. Ella es madre soltera con un  hijo de once años de nombre Orlando Havel en quinto de primaria.

    Ella es ama de casa y se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y legumbres, en donde lleva  tres años y cinco meses, lo que nos platica que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un mejor ingreso en su hogar y solicito el préstamo para comprar más mercancía.
L
    o que lo motivo ha esta actividad fue ella misma  ya que es   una mujer sola que solo depende de ella y para mejorar su ingresos económico decidió poner este  tipo de actividad que si le está dando un buen resultado.

    Lo que más desea es  que con el tiempo ella pueda tener su actividad más  grande  y asi seguir trabajando con el crédito.
texts.en:
Doña Hercilia lives in an area known as San Juan in the state of Chiapas. She is a single mother with an eleven-year-old son named Orlando Havel in the fifth grade. 

She is head of her household and devotes her time buying and selling fruits and vegetables, which she has been doing for three years and five months. She tells us that it is going very well since she has had greater earnings for her household. She requested the loan in order to purchase more merchandise.
