What motivated her to start this business was herself, since she is alone and depends only upon herself. In order to improve her financial earnings she decided to go into this line of business which is in fact producing good profits. 

What she wishes for most is that with time she would have a larger business and thus go on working with the loans.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La señora Fidelina,  es  casada  con el señor Celerino  y vive en la localidad de llano grande municipio de coapilla Chiapas

   Ella se dedica a la panadería en donde lleva dos años y  comenta que le va bien ya que con ello  ha estado teniendo un buen resultado y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de ingredientes como son: azúcar, huevo, harina, aceite, entre otros, para que con ellos se apoye y elabore su actividad más tiempos.

    Ella se inspiro en esta actividad  porque desde muy joven ella apoyaba a sub mama con la venta y a elaborarlo y cuando se caso lo práctico unos  años pero cuando nacieron sus primero hijos  dejo de practicarlo y hace dos s  años comenzó de nuevo.

     Lo que mas desea en esta actividad es que con la bendición de dios y el préstamo pueda salir adelante  y trabajar hasta que las sigan apoyando con el crédito.
texts.en:
Fidelina is married to Celerino and lives in the town Llano Grande in the municipality of Coapilla, in Chiapas. 

She devotes herself to a bakery she has had for two years, and comments that it is going well since she has been making good profits. She requested the loan in order to invest in the purchase of ingredients such as sugar, eggs, flour, oil, among other items, so she may be supported and carry out her business activities longer. 

She was inspired to start this business because from a very early age she helped her mom with selling and making it. When she got married she did it for several years, but when her first child was born she stopped, and two years ago she began again. 

What she wishes for most in this business is that with God's blessing and the loan she may get ahead and work so they may continue supporting them with the loans.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for making breads and pastries.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot tiene 34 años, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos por quienes trabaja arduamente. Juntos viven en su propia casa ubicada en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Margot viene laborando en este negocio aún desde muy joven, siempre trataba de ayudar a sus padres en poner las semillas y cultivarlas, desde entonces decidió tener su propio negocio el cual implicaba tener su propio terreno de cultivo, propiedad que sus padres le cedieron para que lo trabajase. Es así que cultiva cacao y Noni, ya que  para Margot, son productos que tienen mucha demanda a nivel nacional e internacional, es por ello que se levanta desde muy temprano para trabajar en su parcela y darle el cuidado respectivo. Por lo general siempre cuenta con el apoyo de sus peones cuando es temporada de cosecha, siendo éstos vendidos en los centros de acopio y en el mercado de su comunidad por el cual su margen de rentabilidad esta en alza. En el futuro aspira tener su tienda de abarrotes, con la necesidad de poder diversificar su cartera de clientes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera tener el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que pueda continuar con su trabajo. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá en contratar peones para que lo ayuden a limpiar su parcela.
texts.en: Margot is 34 years old and a single mother. She has 3 children, for whom she works very hard. They live together in their own house, located in the community of Puerto Mayo, in the district of Pichari. Margot has worked in this business since she was very young, always trying to help her parents planting seeds and cultivating the crops. Because of this, she decided to have her own business, which meant having her own fields to farm. Her parents gave her some property so she could farm it. She now cultivates cacao and Noni, since for Margot, these are products which are in great demand on both the national and international levels. For this reason, she gets up very early to work on her parcel of land and give the crops the necessary care. In general, she always has support from farm workers when it is harvest season. She sells her harvest at the wholesale buying centers and at the market in her community, and her profit margin is rising. In the future, she hopes to have her own grocery store, so that she can diversify her customer base. This is her first loan with MFP, and she hopes to have the support of every one of you so that she can continue with her work. With the 1,000 Peruvian new soles she is requesting, she will invest in contracting farm workers to help her clean up her parcel of land.

loans.use: to hire farm workers.

loans.name: Maria Belgica

texts.es:
La señora Bélgica, es casada con el señor Dionisio,   con quien procreo cuatro hijos de los cuales dos ya están casados y dos están  a su responsabilidad  y son: Pilar de doce  años  y la más chica es Ana Cristel de siete años.

    Ella solicito la presta para invertirlo en la compra de útiles escolares para surtir su pequeña papelería en donde lleva dos años y cuatro meses, en lo  que nos cometa que le va bien ya que con ellos está logrando tener un mejor ingreso

    Lo que lo inspiro fue su familia ya que también quiere aportar con los  ingresos de la casa y así juntos con su esposo mejorar su calidad de vida y darle lo  mejor a sus hijos que aun están con ella.

     Lo que más desea es que su papelería crezca día con di apara  así seguir apoyando a sus hijos a que sigan estudiando y terminen una carrera.
texts.en:
Bélgica is married to Dionisio.  The couple have four children, two of whom are already married and two of whom are in their care: 12 year-old Pilar and their youngest, 7 year-old Ana Cristel.

Bélgica requested a loan to invest in buying school supplies to stock her small stationery store that she has run for two years and four months.  She tells us that her business is doing very well as she is making good income.

What inspired Bélgica was her family as she wants to contribute towards her household income and, together with her husband, improve their quality of life and provide the best for their children who still live with them.

What Bélgica most desires is for her stationery store to continue to grow so that she can continue supporting her children who are in school and ensure that they continue studying and finish a degree course.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as pencils, composition books, notebooks, colored pencils, etc.

loans.name: Eliani

texts.es:
La señora eleani  vive en  la localidad de llano grande de coapilla, ella es casa con el señor Ezequiel  y con quien procreo un hijo que apenas tiene cuatro meses de edad y se llama Ezequiel.
 
     Ella es amad de casa y en vertiera el préstamo en la compra de llantas, mantenimiento para la camioneta de transporte, así como también el pago en la hacienda, en esta actividad lleva  dos  años y seis meses él en lo que cometa que le va bien ya que con ello está logrando tener un mejor ingreso.

     Quien lo motivo a esta actividad fue su  esposo  para que juntos puedan tener sus propio dinero y para ello decidieron dedicarse a este pequeña  actividad que le está dando un buen resultado para mejorar su calidad de vida.

      Su más grande dese es que con esta actividad pueda tener  sus propios a ahorros para que con ello, logre sacar adelante a su familia  y con el préstamo seguirse apoyando para tener en una condición buena a su camioneta.
texts.en:
Señora Eliani lives in the village of Llano Grande in the Coapilla municipality. She is married to Señor Ezequiel with whom she has had one child who is just four months old. His name is Ezequiel.

She is a housewife and will invest the loan in the purchase of tires and maintenance for a transport pick-up truck. She will also be able to pay the taxes. She has been involved in this activity for two and a half years. She says that it is going well and she is able to make a better income as a result.

Her husband motivated her to start this activity so that they can have their own money together. As a result they decided to start this small business, which is producing good results and improving their quality of life. 

Her biggest dream is that with this activity she will be able to have her own savings so that she can help her family get ahead. This loan helps to keep the pick-up in good condition.

loans.use: to pay for the purchase of tires, maintenance and paying the taxes on her transport pick-up truck.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 25 años de edad. Actualmente,  Yolanda  vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con su única hija. Yolanda tiene un pequeño cafetín en el colegio San Fernando de la ciudad del Cusco. Desde el mes de marzo que se encarga del cafetín y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

Yolanda en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo tortas, gelatinas y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Yolanda was born in Quillabamba, Cusco (Perú).  She is 25 and lives in Cusco with her only daughter. Yolanda runs a small cafe in the San Fernando School, in Cusco. She has been in charge of the business since March and has been pleased to see the results of her hard work.  Yolanda seeks this loan to stock the cafe with food items such as cakes, gelatin and other snacks.  Known to be hardworking, she was invited by other members of the communal lender “Mosoc Killa” to participate as a borrower of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy food items such as cakes, gelatin and other snacks

loans.name: Ronald Amaury

texts.es: Ronald  de 32 años es un hombre que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 3 a 10 años. Él es el propietario del negocio “Decoraciones Ronald”. Desde la edad de 15 años aprendió con su padre el arte de acabado en yeso y marmolería en los interiores y exteriores de las construcciones. Cuando creció se especializó en el Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje “  SENA “ organismo apoyado por el Estado Nacional donde perfeccionó su arte y posteriormente se independizó para  ofrecer sus servicios con el apoyo de un ayudante.  Ronald realiza los contratos con personas naturales o empresas a todo costo, esta es la razón de su requerimiento en credikiva, pues necesita comprar materiales para lograr acabados en viviendas donde lo han contratado y debe poner todo el dinero para sus materiales. Su sueño  es establecerse en un local y ofrecer los servicios y productos en yeso que también elabora como cenefas y adornos, en un punto comercial, con el fin de aumentar su reconocimiento y con ello sus ingresos. Este es su primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea una vez más con su inversión,  tener un capital de trabajo disponible para responder a los contratos a todo costo.
texts.en:
Ronald is a 32-year-old man who lives in the city of Cartagena. He has three children aged 3 to 10 years old. He is the owner of a business called “Decoraciones Ronald” [Decorations by Ronald]. At the age of 15 he began learning the art of plaster and marble finishings for the interior and exterior of buildings from his father.  

As he grew older he specialized in the National Apprentice Service “SENA”, an institution supported by the state. There he perfected his art. Later he started working independently, offering his services with the help of an assistant. 

Ronald carries out his contracts, all costs included, with both individuals and companies. That is why he needs a kiva loan to buy the materials to complete the finishings in homes where he has been contracted as he must put up the money for the materials. 

His dream is to establish a storefront, where he can offer his services and plaster products, which he also elaborates with friezes and decorations, in a commercial location. This will serve to increase his recognition and with it, his income. This is his first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Again, he plans to use this investment to have working capital available to be able to respond to contracts, all costs included.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making friezes.

loans.name: El Porvenir Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el porvenir, decidieron ponerle este nombre porque así es como se llama la comunidad donde viven, y todos son originarios de la misma, esta historia es acerca de la señora C. esbeidy, ya que es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella tiene 30 años de edad, está casada con el señor esteban, tienen 2 hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia, está cursando el segundo año de primaria, ya que el menor apenas tiene 2 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de tarjetas y recargas para celulares, desde hacen  3 años.

Dice que eligió esta actividad ya que tenía que buscar la forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, fue por eso que decidió empezar con este pequeño negocio aparte de que dice le deja muy buenas ganancias, el préstamo que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mas tarjetas y en recargas.

La señora C. nos comenta que su propósito es el de seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para hacerlo crecer mucho mas, ya que quiere poner una tienda de celulares, para mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos y con ello poder solventar los gastos de la educación de sus hijos, ya que quiere que sigan estudiando para que tenga una carrera muy buena profesional.

Ella conoce muy bien a sus compañeras y nos comenta que son personas responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y superarse.

Da las gracias a los prestatarios de kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, puesto que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener un mejor futuro.

Las integrantes del grupo el porvenir y las actividades que realizan son las siguientes:
irma-fruteria, julia-venta de chilate, Viridiana-venta de calzado, Balbina-venta de quesos, eudoxia-tienda de abarrotes, Ángela-venta de ropa, Leticia-venta de perfumes, Ernestina-venta de pescados, Genoveva- venta de ropa, Zenaida-tienda de abarrotes, Érick-venta de rótulos, Brenda-venta de perfumes,  petra-venta de antojitos, María de Lourdes-antojitos, C. esbeidy- recargas para celular, María Edith-carnicería y adulfa- venta de antojitos.
texts.en:
This group, named "El Porvenir," decided on this name because this is also the name of the community where they live and where all of them are from.  This description will focus on C. Esbeidy, since she is one of the members of this group.  She is 30 years old and is married to Esteban.  They have 2 children; one of them is in school in the second grade and the younger one is barely 2 years old.  C. has had a business selling cellular telephone cards and recharge minutes for 3 years.

She says that she chose this activity because she had to look for a way to provide for her children and help her husband with the household expenses.  For this reason she decided to start with this small business, which she says gives her good earnings.  She will use the loan she received to buy more telephone cards and recharge minutes.

C. tells us that her goal is to continue to invest in her business to make it grow a lot more, since she wants to have a cellular phone store so that she can have more income.  This way she can cover the educational expenses of her children, since she wants them to continue to study so that they can have a good professional career.  

She knows her fellow group members well, and tells us that they are responsible people who are hardworking and reliable and who have a strong desire to get ahead and succeed.

She thanks the Kiva lenders for their trust and for giving her this opportunity, but most of all for believing in her.  Thanks to this support she can invest in her business and in this way have a better future.

The members of the group "El Porvenir" and their respective businesses are the following:

Irma-fruit sales
Julia-chilate (a riced-based drink) sales
Viridiana-shoe sales
Balbina-cheese sales
Eudoxia-grocery store
Ángela-clothing sales 
Leticia- perfume sales
Ernestina-fish sales
Genoveva- clothing sales
Zenaida-grocery store
 Érick-sign sales
Brenda- perfume sales
Petra-snack sales
María de Lourdes -snack sales
C. Esbeidy- cellular phone recharges
María Edith-meat store
 Adulfa- snack sales

loans.use: to purchase more cellular phone cards and recharge minutes

loans.name: Las Perlitas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama las perlitas, las integrantes del grupo decidieron ponerle este nombre ya que en el grupo la mayoría son mujeres y es así como se consideran unas hermosas perlas, la historia es acerca de la señora Lina, ya que es la representante del grupo, ella cuenta con 43 años de edad, está casada con el señor Amadeo con quien tiene 4 hijos, Edmundo, analia, Ariel y pablo, de los cuales solo 3 estudian, la mayor está cursando el primer año de secundaria, y dos más están es quinto y sexto año de primaria, ya que el mayor está casado, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace mas de 7 años.

Doña Lina se decidió por ese negocio, ya que dice que tiene mucha demanda, y le genera muy buenas ganancias, además de que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante, para darles una muy buena calidad de vida, invirtió su crédito en la compra de mas ropa como son: blusas, playeras, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, shorts, camisas y ropa interior, para así tener un mejor surtido.

El sueño que tiene doña Lina y espera algún día poder cumplirlo es el de ampliar  un poco mas su local y para así tenerlo muy bien surtido, ya que es su anhelo mas grande, también para poder mejorar e incrementar sus ingresos y así continuar apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y asegurar su futuro.

Nos dice que los integrantes de su grupo, son personas muy responsables, trabajadoras y puntuales, ya que tienen tiempo de conocerse y se llevan muy bien, puesto que viven en la misma comunidad.

Ella esta muy agradecida con fundación realidad y kiva por el apoyo del préstamo que le otorgaron, ya que gracias a esto su negocio esta mejorando mucho.

Otros de los compañeros de doña Lina son: Elizabeth, francisca, minerva, Edmundo, Sandra, idalia, Emiliana, norma y arlette, quienes realizan variadas actividades como: venta de frutas, madera, pollos, comida, ropa, dulces, zapatos, tamales y algunos abarrotes.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Perlitas (The Little Pearls).  The members of the group decided on this name as the majority of the group are women and they consider themselves to be beautiful pearls.

This story is about Señora Lina, as she is the representative of the group.  She is 43 years old, and is married to Señor Amadeo with whom she has 4 children; Edmundo, Analia, Ariel and Pablo.  Only 3 of them are at school as her oldest child is married.  Her eldest daughter is in her first year at secondary school, and two others are in the fifth and sixth years of primary school.  Lina works selling clothes, which she has been doing for over 7 years.

Doña Lina decided on this business as she says there is much demand and it generates very good earnings for her.  In addition, she wanted to find a way to advance her children in order to give them a good quality of life.  She will invest her loan in buying more clothes such as blouses, T-shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, shorts, shirts and underwear, so she can offer a better assortment.

Doña Lina's dream, that she hopes someday to be able to accomplish, is to expand her place a little more and have it very well stocked; this is her greatest desire.  She also dreams of being able to improve and increase her earnings, and so continue to support her children with their studies and secure their future.

She tells us that the members of her group are very responsible, hardworking and punctual; they have taken the time to get to know each other, and they get along very well as they all live in the same community.

She is very grateful to Fundación Realidad and to Kiva for the support of the loan that has been granted to her, and thanks to this loan her business is greatly improving.

The other colleagues of Doña Lina are: Elizabeth, Francisca, Minerva, Edmundo, Sandra, Idalia, Emiliana, Norma and Arlette, who engage in various activities such as selling fruit, wood, chickens, food, clothing, candy, shoes, tamales and some groceries.

loans.use: to buy more clothes such as blouses, T-shirts, dresses, pants, skirts, shorts, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.es:
Wilda nació en la ciudad de Acomayo del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 32 años de edad. Actualmente,  Wilda vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Wilda tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. En esta oportunidad Wilda requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Wilda was born in the city of Acomayo, in the department of Cusco (Peru). She is 32 years old. Currently, Wilda lives in the city of Cusco together with her two children. Wilda has a small grocery store in her home. At this time, Wilda needs a loan to buy merchandise, such as rice, sugar, noodles and other basic necessities. 

The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person, and thanks to these qualities, her fellow members invited her to join the “Mosoc Killa” communal bank of the Arariwa Association.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.en:
Gloria, a 49-year-old married mother of a 9-year-old child, has run a small eatery out of her home for the past 30 years.  She would like the additional capital to make improvements to the eating area and to buy basic grains, soft drinks, paper plates, bags, vegetables and meat for the business.  

Gloria’s desire is to continue providing support for her family and that her daughter grows up with greater opportunities.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, paper plates, bags, vegetables and meat  for the business

loans.name: Rommel

texts.es: Rommel de 32 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 8 años; allí se dedica a la elaboración de avisos y materiales publicitarios, negocio que inició cuando se graduó en la escuela de diseñador gráfico, su experiencia práctica la construyó cuando trabajó en una agencia publicitaria como creativo y finalmente cuando decidió darle curso a su espíritu emprendedor, se independizó y emprendió su aventura de negocio. Al principio, hizo toda una labor publicitaria para dar a conocer sus servicios, y también  lo hizo realizando trabajos publicitarios a microempresas vecinas, donde se dio a conocer en el mercado. Hoy sus clientes, amigos, vecinos lo refieren y sus compradores han  ido creciendo paulatinamente, por la gran satisfacción que genera en ellos la calidad de su trabajo.   Su credikiva es el  primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará un computador debido a que tiene uno solo y con esta deficiencia pierde muchos clientes. Su sueño más adelante es tener su propia agencia de publicidad y en el futuro generar fuentes de empleo.
texts.en: Rommel is 32 years old and lives in the city of Cartagena with his wife and two children, ages 3 and 8. He makes a living making advertisements and promotional materials, a business he started when he graduate from graphic-design school. He gained experience when he worked in the creative department for an advertising agency and finally decided to rein in his entrepreneurial spirit and go out on his own and start his own business. At first, he did all the labor to familiarize himself with his services, and he also started doing publicity for his neighboring small businesses, which helped him learn his market. Today, his clients, friends and neighbors all recommend him and his buyers have been growing steadily thanks to the great satisfaction found in the quality of his work. This loan with Kiva is Rommel's first with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and he plans to purchase a computer because he only has one and that deficiency makes him lose many customers. His dream for the future is to have his own advertising agency and generate sources of employment.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es: Marisa tiene 28 años, convive con Enrique de 30 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de puerto mayo del distrito de Pichari. Desde hace 7 años Marisa trabaja en la actividad agrícola, específicamente en el cultivo de  cacao. Si bien al comienzo ella solo contaba con una pequeña chacra, decidió ampliar su terreno, para así producir en grandes volúmenes. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero a la vez tiene a su cargo peones que le pueden facilitar en el cultivo de su producto. Usualmente ella los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas o en los Centros de Acopio de su comunidad. En el futuro piensa expandirse adquiriendo nuevos terrenos para cultivar nuevos productos que tengan mayor demanda. Este  es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para concretar con sus planes. Además es una mujer de buenos principios y la que más aporta en su banco comunal. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá para contratar peones y le den un buen mantenimiento de su parcela.
texts.en: Marisa is 28 years old and is married to Enrique, 30, with whom she has three children. They all live in their own home in the community of Puerto Mayo, district of Pichari, Peru. For the past seven years Marisa has worked in agriculture, specifically in cultivating cocoa. While at first she only had a small plot of land, she decided to expand so she could produce at a higher volume. At times her children help her, but she also hires workers to help her cultivate the product. Usually she sells the cocoa to wholesale merchants or at her local community center. In the future she plans to expand by buying new lands and cultivating new products that are in higher demand. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she is hoping for the support of every one of you to help solidify her plans. She is a woman of strong principles and is a big supporter of her community bank. With the 1,000 soles she is requesting, she plans to hire workers to help maintain her plot of land.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Las Margaritas 2 Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre las margaritas 2, las integrantes decidieron ponerle este nombre, por que como son puras mujeres y pues se identifican con esa flor, esta historia es acerca D. la señora Magali, ya que forma parte D. este grupo, cuenta con 23 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 1 hijo, Eduardo D. 8 años D. edad quien cursa el tercer año D. primaria, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pizzas desD. hace 4 años.

Doña Magali decidió iniciar con este negocio por que tenía la necesidad D. hacerlo, pues no contaba con la solvencia económica suficiente, para la educación D. su hijo y para darle una mejor calidad D. vida, ella decidió invertir el crédito en la compra D. más insumos para la elaboración D. sus pizzas como son: jitomates, puré D. tomate, harina, jamón, carne, queso, piña, salchichas y chiles.

Ella desea seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para poder poner una pizzería, ya que así tendrá una mejor producción y variedad D. su producto, para mejorar e incrementar sus ventas y ganancias, para seguir apoyando a su pequeño hijo con sus estudios y en un futuro puedan terminar una muy buena carrera profesional.

Platica que todos sus compañeros, son personas responsables y pagadoras puesto que todas se conocen y no tienen ningún problema entre ellos.

Dice que esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios D. kiva y con FRAC, ya que gracias a ellos esta saliendo adelante y ha podido tener su propio negocio, asi poder apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.

Las personas que integran el grupo D. las margaritas 2 y las distintas actividades que realizan son las siguientes: Magali-venta D. pizzas, abelina-venta D. frijoles, Isabel-venta D. perfumes, floricel-venta D. zapatos, Bertha-venta D. dulces, eulalia-taqueria, Herminia-frutería, lazara-venta D. pescados, divina-venta D. ropa- Paula-antojitos, ponciana-fruteria y Paula-molino D. nixtamal.
texts.en: This group is called Las Margaritas 2 (The Daisies 2). The members decided upon this name because they are pure women who can identify with the flower. This description is about Magali, who is part of this group. She is 23 years old, married and has a son, 8-year-old Eduardo, who is in his third year of school. Magali has maD. a living making and selling pizzas for the past four years. She decided to start this business out of necessity because she didn't have sufficient income for her son's education and to give him a better quality of life. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase more ingredients to make her pizzas, such as tomatoes, tomato sauce, flour, ham, meat, cheese, pineapple, sausages and peppers. She wants to continue investing in her business so she can set up a pizzeria, since then she will increase her production and selection and improve and increase her sales and profits. In this way she can keep supporting her son's education and in the future he can end up with a very good career. She chats with all her fellow group memeber, who are responsible women who all know each other and don't have any problems with one another. Magali says she is very grateful to Kiva and FRAC, since thanks to them she is continuing ahead and has been able to start her own business and support her son. The women who make up the Las Margaritas 2 group and their activities are as follows: Magali - selling pizzas; Abelina - selling beans; Isabel - selling perfumes; Floricel - selling shoes; Bertha - selling candy; Eulali - running a taqueria; Herminia - running a fruit stand; Lazara - selling fish; Divina - selling clothing; Paula - selling snacks; Ponciana - running a fruit stand; and Paula - running a corn mill.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as tomatoes, tomato sauce, flour, ham, meat, cheese, pineapple, sausages and peppers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a large volume of merchandise with special discounts.

loans.name: Paula Telvia

texts.es: Paula Telvia is 63 years and has 3 grown children.  For the last eight years, she has worked as a seamstress from her home producing shirts, skirts, pants, and linens. Paula Telvia intends to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase materials to create more productst scissors, threads, fabrics,  that she can sell.  She is very appreciative of the loans she has received, as it has helped her better her standard of living.
texts.en: Paula Telvia is 63 years and has 3 grown children.  For the last eight years, she has worked as a seamstress from her home producing shirts, skirts, pants, and linens. Paula Telvia intends to use the proceeds of the loan to purchase materials to create more productst scissors, threads, fabrics,  that she can sell.  She is very appreciative of the loans she has received, as it has helped her better her standard of living.

loans.use: scissors, threads, fabrics

loans.name: Cruz Del Socorro

texts.en:
Cruz Del Socorro is a 56-year-old single mother of three adult children.  For the last 23 years, she has sold different milk products, such as cheese and cream, as well as other food items. The loan proceeds will be used to buy more milk, as well as pigs.  

Cruz del Socorro’s goal is to improve her living standards, including some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy milk for making products, such as cheese and cream

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 39 años de edad, convive con Celia de 40 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Puerto Mayo del distrito de Pichari. Desde hace varios años atrás, Oscar  esta dedicado al negocio de venta de abarrotes en general,  fue simplemente por que en su barrio no existía un negocio de este rubro. Desde entonces le ha resultado rentable con respecto a otros años. Generalmente la hora que más clientela tiene es partir de las 6 a 8 de la mañana; es ahí que sus hijos la apoyan en el negocio. Normalmente los productos que vende son de primera necesidad, es por ello que se siente contento y satisfecho con la actividad que realiza. En un futuro el piensa incrementar más productos para implementar su tienda. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo tanto espera la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con su trabajo. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Oscar is 39 years old. He lives with Celia, who is 40. From this relationship, they have 4 children. Together they live in their own home located in the community of Puerto Mayo of the district of Pichari. For several years, Oscar has sold general groceries. He started this simply because in his neighborhood a business like this didn't exist. It has been profitable since then. Generally,he has the most customers between 6 and 8 in the morning. At that time, his children help him in the business. Normally, the products he sells are basic necessity products. He is content and satisfied with the activity he does. In the future, he plans on having more products to sell in his store. This is his first loan with  MFP and he hopes to have all of your cooperation to continue working. With the 1.000 nuevos soles he is asking for, he will buy more products to supply his store.

loans.use: to buy more products to supply his store.

loans.name: Generalas Group

texts.es:
Las ‘Generalas’ es un grupo formado por 7 personas que se encuentran en su primer ciclo de crédito al norte de la ciudad de Escobedo en Nuevo León. Sus integrantes escogieron ese nombre porque admiran al famoso general mexicano ‘Pancho Villa’, quien formó parte importante del éxito de la Revolución Mexicana.

Blanca Leticia es una de las integrantes del grupo, está por cumplir los 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 10 años y otro de 6 años.  Blanca se dedica a la venta de comidas en una cooperativa en una escuela primaria donde ofrece a los alumnos y maestros varios tipos de comida como tacos de diferentes guisos, hamburguesas y algunas botanas. Con su crédito, Blanca planea comprar suministros para ofrecer más variedad de comidas como algunos tipos de tamales, gorditas y quesadillas. Una de las metas de Blanca es lograr que su negocio crezca para que pueda expandirse a más escuelas de su ciudad y así ayudar a alimentar a una mayor cantidad de niños y maestros.
texts.en:
'Generalas’ is a group with seven members who are in their first loan cycle.  They live in the north of the city of Escobedo, in Nuevo León.  The members chose this name because they admire the famous Mexican general 'Pancho Villa' who played an important role in the success of the Mexican Revolution.  

Blanca Leticia is one of the group's members.  She is about to turn 31, is married, and has two children aged 10 and 6.  Blanca's business is selling food in an elementary school.  She sells the students and teachers different types of food such as tacos, burgers and some snacks.  Blanca plans to use her loan to buy supplies so that she can offer a wider range of food including some types of tamales, 'gorditas' (a type of stuffed corn cake) and quesadillas.  One of Blanca's goals is to grow her business so that she can expand to cover more schools in her city and thereby help feed a larger number of children and teachers.

loans.use: to buy supplies so that she can sell a wider range of food

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 35 años de edad. Actualmente, Yanet vive en la ciudad de Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Yanet se dedica a la venta de comida desde las 7 de la manaña hasta las 2 de la tarde todos los días. Ya es un año y medio se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, leche y otras cosas. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Yanet was born in the city of Quillabamba, in Cusco department (Peru).  She is 35 years old and currently lives in the city of Cusco together with her two children.  Yanet sells food from 7.00am to 2.00pm, every day.  She has been in this business for one and a half years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.  On this occasion, Yanet needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, noodles, milk, etc.

Yanet is a responsible and hard-working person and, owing to these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's "Mosoc Killa" community bank.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria  de 53 Años es una mujer que vive en San Jacinto, población del municipio de Bolívar, caracterizada por las artesanías que fabrican sus mujeres especialmente los tejidos verticales con los que elaboran sus hamacas y mochilas. Maria tiene 5  hijos en las edades de 11 a 36 años, los tres últimos estudian y los dos mayores son trabajadores independientes. Ella es la propietaria de  una tienda donde vende víveres y  maneja un capital de trabajo muy pequeño para surtirla. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva,  que es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual surtirá su negocio, comprando víveres en mayor volumen y con la posibilidad de obtener descuentos que agregarán mayor ingreso a su negocio.  
 Maria Inició este negocio  para genera recursos en beneficio de su hogar y desde hace tres años ha sido apoyada por la Fundación, cuando ingresó mediante la metodología de grupos solidarios. Maria se ha dedicado a varios negocios  y se adapta a los requerimientos de la clientela, alguna vez también se dedicó  a la venta de carnes y de allí le quedó el congelador con el que ahora cuenta. Su meta es lograr un nuevo posicionamiento porque lo había perdido, y con sus financiamientos lo está recuperando, Su sueño más adelante es ampliar su negocio, para tener la oportunidad de apoyar a sus hijos en la educación superior. Mientras le aporta su trabajo al logro de sus metas, Maria continua esforzándose por aumentar la rentabilidad sobre las ventas,  que se encuentra en un porcentaje no menor del 11%
texts.en:
Maria is a 53 year-old woman who lives in San Jacinto, a town in Bolívar municipality which is noted for the handicrafts that the local women make, especially the vertical looms with which they make their hammocks and backpacks.

Maria has five children aged between 11 and 36.  Her three youngest are in school and her two eldest work independently.  Maria is the owner of a store where she sells food products.  She has a very small working capital with which to stock the store.  This is why she is taking out a Kiva loan, which is her second loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to stock her business, buying food products in larger volumes, with the possibility of obtaining discounts which will add to her business profits.

Maria started out in this business to make money for her household and she has been supported by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for three years.  She joined through the community bank system.  Maria has worked in several businesses and she adapts to her customers needs.  She also used to sell meat which is where she got the freezer that she now has. 

Maria's goal is to achieve a new position [in the market] since she had lost it but, through her loans, she is getting it back again.  Her dream for the future is to expand her business so that she has the opportunity to support her children with their higher education.  While she works to achieve her goals, Maria continues working hard to increase her sales profitability which is at no less than 11%.

loans.use: to stock her business, buying food products in larger volumes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sodas, crackers, grains, canned soups, and detergents for her store.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 30 años, reside en la comunidad nativa de Shankivironi (selva central peruana). Ahí conformó su familia junto a Natalia, su esposa desde hace 9 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Cintia y Angie a los cuidan en su casa propia. El trabajo de este joven padre de familia se centra en “la agricultura”. Su principal actividad económica. La siembra de café en sus 3 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, es lo que más le gusta; ya que tiene 10 años de experiencia en el cuidado y cultivo de los mismos. Además de ver como en estos meses el costo por kilo del grano de café subió considerablemente. Este año venderá su producción a la cooperativa “Café Montaña” y “Bioazul”, donde espera obtener una buena ganancia. Pero consiente que la cosecha se realiza una vez al año, trabaja a la vez en trasporte público, con un motocarro que alquila, cubriendo las rutas de Pichanaki a Puerto Sotani. Le va muy bien en su trabajo, por ello desea en este año comprar uno propio, que le sirva también para trasladar su cosecha de los terrenos de cultivo hacia la ciudad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para el desarrollo de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juan, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado, en completar el dinero adquirido para la compra de un vehículo llamado “torito” (especie de movilidad para el trasporte público).
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old and lives in the indigenous community of Shankivironi (in the central Peruvian rainforest).  There he started his family together with Natalia, his wife of 9 years.  The couple have two children: Cintia and Angie, who they care for in their own home.  This young father's work is 'farming'.  It is his main business activity.  Growing coffee on his 3 hectares of farmland is what he most enjoys doing because he has 10 years experience in caring for and growing this crop.  He has also seen how, over the last few months, the price per kilo for coffee beans has risen considerably.  This year he will sell his produce to the “Café Montaña” and “Bio Azul” cooperative where he hopes to obtain good profits.  However, as he is aware that his coffee harvest only happens once a year, he also works providing a public transport service with a vehicle that he rents.  He covers routes from Pichanaki to Puerto Sotani.  His work is going very well but this year he would like to buy a vehicle of his own which he can also use when transporting his harvest from his farmland to the city. 

Juan belongs to the "Los Clavelitos de Shakivironi" community bank and this is his third loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your cooperation in helping him reach his goals.  For his part, he pledges once more to make his loan repayments on time as he has done with his previous loans.  Juan enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.

Juan, with your support, will invest the money he has requested by adding it to a sum of money he already has in order to buy a vehicle called a 'torito' (a type of motorcycle taxi which is used for public transportation).

loans.use: to buy a vehicle

loans.name: Yelybeth

texts.es:
Yelybeth nació en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 25 años de edad. Actualmente, Yelybeth  vive en la ciudad donde nació y está soltera. Yelybeth es barman y trabaja en alternando en discotecas y Karaokes de la ciudad del Cusco.  Yelybeth es sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. En esta oportunidad Yelybeth requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de belleza como perfumes y otros. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoc Killa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Yelybeth was born in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department (Peru).  She is 25 years old, single, and currently lives in the city in which she was born.  Yelybeth is a bartender and works in both discos and karaoke bars in the city of Cusco.  In her free time, she sells cosmetics.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy more beauty products such as perfume, etc.

Yelybeth is a responsible and hard-working person and, owing to these personal qualities, her friends invited her to join Asociación Arariwa's "Mosoc Killa" community bank.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products such as perfume, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy milk, cheese and cream

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es: Apolinario de 39 años, reside en la comunidad nativa de Shankivironi (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Estela, su esposa desde hace 19 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia. Como padre responsable trabaja constantemente para brindarle a su familia comida, educación y vestimenta. Desde hace 12 años viene sembrando en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, naranja, achiote, maíz y plátano. Los que más le gustan de su trabajo es limpiar y cultivar sus sembríos. Más le molesta el intenso calor de la zona cuando está trabajando en el campo; “me canso mucho”, afirma. Además de sentirse satisfecho de recibir el pago de sus productos por parte de los acopiadores de la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde comercializa en cada cosecha. Paralelo a ese trabajo, Apolinario, en sus tiempos libres se dedica al trasporte público con un torito o ballata (especie de trasporte público), cubriendo las rutas de Puerto sotaní a  la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde gana un dinero extra. Ahora espera ahorrar mayor cantidad de dinero para poder mejorar la tienda de comestibles de su esposa, donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para conseguir sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Apolinario, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono para esparcirlos en sus cultivos. Asimismo en el pago a los peones para que le ayuden en la cosecha de café.
texts.en:
Apolinario is 39 years old and lives in the indigenous community of Shankivironi (in the central Peruvian rainforest).  There he started a family together with Estela, his wife of 19 years.  The couple have four children but only live with three of them.  They live in their own home.  As a responsible father, Apolinario works constantly to provide his family with food, clothes and an education.

For 12 years, Apolinario has been growing oranges, annatto, corn and bananas on his two hectares of farmland.  What he most enjoys about his work is weeding and growing his crops.  What bothers him the most is the intense heat in the area when he is out working in the fields.  "I get very tired", he says.  However, he feels very happy to receive payment for his produce from the middlemen in the town of Pichanaki where he sells his crops after each harvest. In parallel with this work, in his free time Apolinario also provides a public transport service with a 'torito' or 'ballata' (a motorcycle taxi - a mode of public transport).  He covers routes between Puerto Sotaní and the town of Pichanaki.  This earns him some extra money.  He hopes to save up a larger sum of money so that he can improve his wife's grocery store where she sells basic household products.

Apolinario is a member of the "Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi" community bank and this is his third loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your support in helping him achieve his goals.  For his part, he pledges once again to make his repayments on time as he has done with his previous loans.  He enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Apolinario will invest the money he has requested in buying several sacks of manure to spread over his crops.  He will also pay farm workers to help him with his coffee harvest.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and hire farm workers

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 51 años, reside en la comunidad nativa de Shankivironi (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Jovita, su esposa desde hace 15 años. Ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos en su casa propia. El trabajo de este sacrificado hombre se centra en la “agricultura”, su principal sustento económico. Hace 15 años se dedica a la siembra de cítricos en toda su variedad, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y trabajo. Lo que más le gusta de su labor diaria, es poder dedicar la mayor parte de su tiempo en cuidar y producir sus propios sembríos. Ya que según cuenta en sus tiempos libres, trabaja como peón cosechando café en diferentes terrenos agrícolas obteniendo una ganancias extra. Más lucha día a día contra su principal inconveniente que es la falta de capital de trabajo, pues tiene 5 hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas de los cuales solo produce una hectárea, pero con el apoyo de su hijo, a quien le compró una motocarro para realizar trasporte público en la zona. Espera lograr sus objetivos trazados y así comenzar a sembrar café, para diversificar su producción. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para seguir logrando sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Jorge de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varias plantitas de café para comenzar con su próxima siembra dentro de estos días.
texts.en:
Jorge is 51 years old and lives in the indigenous community of Shankivironi (in the central Peruvian rainforest).  There he started a family together with Jovita, his wife of 15 years.  The couple have eight children but only live with five of them.  They live in their own home.

This selfless man's work is 'farming'.  It is his main source of financial support.  He has been growing different varieties of citrus fruits for 15 years.  He looks after his fruit with a lot of care and hard work.  What he most enjoys about his daily work is being able to spend most of his time caring for and growing his own fruit.  He tells us that in his spare time he works as a laborer, harvesting coffee on other people's land, which makes him extra money.  He fights hard every day against his main problem which is a lack of working capital.  He owns five hectares of farmland but only produces crops on one hectare.  However, he has the support of his son for whom he bought a car so that he could provide a public transport service in their area.

Jorge hopes to achieve the goals that he has mapped out and start growing coffee, in order to diversify his production.  He is a member of the "Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi" community bank and this is his fourth loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your support so that he can continue achieving his goals.  For his part, he pledges once again to make his repayments on time as he has done with his previous loans.  He enjoys being a member of his community bank because all the members are responsible people who are very supportive of each other.  With your support, Jorge will invest the money he has requested in buying some coffee seedlings in order to start his sowing which he will do very shortly.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants

loans.name: Chuchi

texts.en:
Chuchi is 45 years old and married with four children. Chuchi works very hard to provide for them.

Chuchi runs a sari-sari variety store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Chuchi has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as rice, feeds and other groceries. 

In the future, Chuchi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Juanita works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a sari-sari store. Juanita is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her furniture-making business.

Juanita has been supporting her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her furniture making

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Flora works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Flora is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas for her food vending business.

Flora has been supporting her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for her food vending

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene  52 años, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos. Juntos viven en su propia casa ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de Llochegua. Agustina, se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora, recuerda que en su juventud sufrió mucho debido a la perdida del cultivo de cacao, siendo su única fuente principal de ingresos, y por ende se endeudaron. Hoy Agustina manifiesta que ha trabajado mucho para salir adelante. Es así que el negocio que posee es un bar, en donde le ha generado buenas ganancias económicas y ya lleva casi 7 años trabajando de manera constante. Su estrategia de permanecer en un negocio tan competitivo es que siempre las bebidas que ella vende están al alcance del público en general, además de mantener siempre surtido con diversos productos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con los 2.000 nuevos soles lo invertirá para comprar muebles y acondicionar su local de ventas.
texts.en:
Agustina is 52 years old.  She is a single mother and has four children.  They live together in their own home which is located in the village of Canayre, in Llochegua district.  Agustina is noted as being a hard-working woman.  She recalls that in her youth she suffered a lot through the loss of her cacao crop as this was her main source of income.  As a result, she got into debt.  Today Agustina tells us that she has worked hard to get ahead in life.  Her business is a bar and it has made her good money.  She has been working in this business constantly for seven years.  Her strategy for remaining in such a competitive business is to ensure that the drinks she sells are always affordable to the general public.  She also always keeps her business stocked with a range of products.

This is Agustina's second loan from MFP and she pledges to make her loan repayments on time.  She will invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles in buying furniture and fitting out her premises.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her sales premises

loans.name: G.s. Estrella Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria de los Ángeles es casada y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como chofer en los buses que viajan a Managua. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de manera ambulante, tiene 15 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que en principio dio inicio por su mama, la cual se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de lápiz labial, sombras, brillos, cremas y tratamientos trabaja principalmente por encargos y actualmente posee bastantes encargos. 
El señor Marvin se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, este negocio lo tiene localizado en el mercado aunque en su casa maneja un inventario que proviene de unas cosechas que compra y luego las saca al mercado después de haberlas tenido en su casa. El negocio dio inicio en principio con la experiencia brindada por su mama quien tenía más de 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad. El solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una pequeña cosecha de aguacates. Su sueño es instalar un nuevo negocio en su casa para que su esposa también le ayude y no tenga que trabajar en otro lado.
texts.en:
Maria de los Ángeles is married and has a four year-old son.  Her husband works as a driver on the buses that travel to Managua.  Her business is selling cosmetics as an itinerant vendor.  She has been in this business for 15 years.  She started out through her mom who sells fruit and vegetables.  She is requesting this loan to invest in buying lipsticks, eye shadows, lip gloss, creams and treatments.  She mainly works to order and currently has a number of orders.

Marvin sells fruit and vegetables.  His business is located in the market although he keeps stock in his home which comes from harvests that he buys.  He then takes them to the market to sell.  He started his business with experience provided by his mom who had been working in this business for more than 25 years.  Marvin is requesting a loan to invest in buying a small harvest of avocados.  His dream is to set up a new business in his home so that his wife can also help him and not have to work elsewhere.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, eye shadows, lip gloss, creams and treatments

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra works hard to support her family. Isidra is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Isidra requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Isidra has been in this business for two years.

Isidra would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Baatarjav

texts.en:
Baatarjav lives with his wife and son in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. His son, age 23, is a driver who manages his own taxi service business. His son earns 100,000 MNT in a month. 

Baatarjav runs a shoe making business with the help of his wife. They make variety of Mongolian traditional shoes for all ages. With 21 years in operation they have been able to stabilize their business and built a strong customer base. 

They used to live in someone else's backyard. However with their earnings, they managed to buy a plot of land where they are planning to build a house in the future. Also they have managed to buy a car for their family use. 

Their business revenue is vital source of income for their family. He is a hardworking man who is planning to have a workshop in the future. 

He says, "Our car was burnt recently. So we needed to buy a new car. Moreover my wife has been ill for several months and we spent lots of money for her treatment. So I need a loan to increase my working capital now." He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a charcoal business in the Philippines.

Laureta requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Laureta has been buying and selling charcoal for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from selling fruit.

Laureta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosanna, 42, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, a welder, and mother of six children, four of whom are already working while the other two are still studying. By the grace of God, Rosanna has managed to support her children’s educational needs. As of the present time she is working hard to be able to maintain her finances for her other two children’s education.

Rosanna operates a small propeller factory. Her husband works as the welder in their factory, while she handles the finances. They offer the propellers to suppliers who sell them to ship or motor boat owners or manufacturers. They earn a profit for every item they sell. Her regular customers are individual, local stores and retailers.  She earns a minimum of Php 1500 in sales every day.

 To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy materials and additional equipment, and for maintenance of their existing machines. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosanna dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for materials and additional equipment for her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling used clothes.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her sari-sari (variety) store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés tiene 52 años, esta casado con felicitas de 46 años, fruto de esta relación tienen dos hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Andrés se caracteriza por ser un hombre agricultor y muy cumplido al momento de comprometerse con los clientes, ganándose la confianza de ellos. Es así que siempre cuida de las plantaciones de cacao, ya que ha visto que el negocio de este fruto es muy rentable. Sin embargo hace años incursionó en la venta de productos de primera necesidad, por lo que eso significaba un mayor ingreso económico para su familia. Al principio eran pocas sus ventas, pero con el año supo posesionarse muy bien en el mercado de su localidad, y esto es gracias al precio justo y el buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el que Andrés se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Andrés  esta contento  por formar parte de su banco comunal. Con los 3.000 nuevos soles desea comprar más mercadería para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Andres is 52 years old and he is married to Felicitas, who is 46 years old. Their two children are the fruit of their relationship. They live together in a house located in the community of Canayre of the district of Llochegua. Andres is a known agriculturist and he is very committed to the agreements he has with his clients, thereby earning their trust. He is always in charge of his cocoa plantation, especially because he has seen that the product is very profitable. A few years ago he started out selling essential products and it yielded a better income for his family. At the start his sales were low but throughout the years he has known to set himself up very well in his community market by offering fair prices and through good customer service. This is the second loan he has with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and Andres is committed to be on time with his loan payments. Andres is happy to be part of his communal bank. With the 3000 nuevos soles he wants to purchase merchandise to supply his store.

loans.use: to purchase products to supply his store.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell.

Cecelia has been in this business for five years. Cecelia earns more income from fish vending.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari (variety) store.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Baljinyam

texts.en: Baljinyam is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a "ger", a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province of Mongolia. His older son is an elementary school pupil while the younger one is in kindergarten. He manages a food cafe and pool game with the help of his wife in his town. He started his business in 2009. He is also planning to operate a taxi service at night. He is a diligent man who is planning to expand his business. He is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase a car in order to start his taxi service business.

loans.use: To purchase a car to use as a taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more blouses, pants, and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Replita

texts.en: Replita, a 53-year-old married mother of one,  works very hard to provide for her family as the operator of a sari-sari store selling a variety of items such as egg, noodles, spices, etc. in the Philippines. In business five years, she is now requesting a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as shampoo, sardines, cooking oil, etc.  Replita would like to save enough money to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 32 años, casado con Noemí de 25 años, fruto de esta relación tienen 2 hijos siendo la mayor Emily de 7 años y Ander de 5 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Daniel es un joven con mucha visión de por medio, además le gusta explorar cosas nuevas. Recuerda que su primer trabajo y del que hasta hoy tiene vigente es su establecimiento de bebidas alcohólicas. Con el tiempo logró posicionarse en su localidad y ser el más concurrido. Daniel dice que para tener un negocio exitoso la clave esta en saber tratar al cliente dar lo que ellos buscan, por otro lado cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa y eso le facilita más las cosas al momento de atender a los clientes. Este es su primer crédito  con MFP, por el que se compromete hacer puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Daniel es la persona que más aportes da en su banco comunal. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles desea comprar más bebidas alcohólicas y gasificadas.
texts.en: Daniel is 32 years old and he is married with Noemi, 25 years old. Their two children is the fruit of their relationship. Emily is 7 years old and Ander is 5 years old. They live in their own home located in the community of Canayre in the district of Llochegua. Daniel is a young man with a vision and he also enjoys exploring new things. He remembers his first job that led to the business he has today, a liquor store. With time he was able to establish himself in his neighborhood, the best traveled community. Daniel says that the key to having a successful business is known how to serve the client and to provide them with what they seek. He also enjoys help from his wife and it helps to have everything ready when attending the clients. This is his first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) but he is committed to making his loan payments. Daniel is a member that contributes the most in his communal bank. With the 1000 nuevos soles he will purchase more alcoholic and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase alcoholic and soft drinks.

loans.name: Katia Melissa

texts.es: La señora Katia tiene 21 años de edad es madre soltera, tiene un niña de 1 año de edad, katia de dedica a vender ropa para niños y adultos, en un mercado de ciudad, eligió este tipo de trabajo por que le pareció muy rentable viene realizando esta labor hace mas de 2 años, el dinero que esta solicitando es para comprar mas mercadería como chompas pantalones polares busos entre otros, katia como toda joven tiene muchos sueños uno de ellos es ser una comerciante mayorista y mas adelante ser diseñadora de ropa, katia esta muy agradecida con la confianza que se esta brindando.
texts.en: Katia is 21 years old and she is a single mother. She has a 1-year old daughter. Katia sells kids' and adults' clothing in a market in the city. She decided on this type of work because she thought it was very profitable. She has been in business for more than 2 years. The funds that she requests will be used to purchase more merchandise, such as jackets, pants, sweaters, shirts and others. Katia, like any other young woman, has many dreams and one of her dreams is to be a wholesaler and later on to be a clothing designer. Katia is very thankful for the trust that is imparted upon her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing merchandise such as pants, jackets, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en:
Rocela works hard to support her family. Rocela is married. She has a meat-vending business in the Philippines.

Rocela requested a 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a cow and pigs for her business.

Rocela has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Rocela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a cow and pigs for her business.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ronelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines and also earns additional income buying and selling dried fish and farming rice. Ronelyn is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell in her business.

Ronelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve is 43 years old and married with four children.

Salve works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a 29,500-Philippine-peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Salve has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her rice retailing business for 10 years, and she also earns income from a sari-sari store and from farming rice.

Salve aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been farming rice for three years, and she also earns additional income buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Berdhan

texts.en: Berdhan is 52 years old and lives with his wife and five children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His older son is a construction worker, while his wife manages a mobile food-selling business in her town. He conducts a vegetable planting and trading business. He started his business in 2008. He used to have land where he planted vegetables for daily consumption. However, the land wasn't fruitful enough. So he sold the land and began planting his vegetables at a rented plantation. He is a polite man who attributes his business success to his good managerial skill. He is requesting a 1,500,000-Mongolian-togrog (MNT) loan to purchase land where he can plant his vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase land

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge de 50 años de edad, casado con María de 50 años con quien tiene una hija de 22 años y es estudiante. Ellos viven en su casa propia en el centro poblado de Canayre del distrito de LLochegua. Jorge  emprendió en un nuevo negocio, que es la venta de ropa para  todas la edades según a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Nunca imagino que le resultaría rentable, por lo que aún continúa ofreciendo su mercadería de puerta en puerta. También. Asimismo comentan que él y su esposa poseen Bar, permitiéndole ofrecer otros ingresos para su familia. Para ella es muy importante los dos negocios que posee, pero considera que la venta de ropa le genera más rentabilidad por ello se abastecerá de más ropa. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Jorge es un hombre que impone el orden en su banco comunal. Con los 1.000 nuevos soles, comprará más prendas para implementar su tienda.
texts.en: Jorge is 50 years old and he is married with Maria, 50 years old, with whom he has a 22-year old daughter, a student. They live in a house of their own in the community of Canayre in the district of Llochegua. Jorge took up a new business, being the sale of clothing for all ages and suiting the tastes and preferences of his clients. He never imagined that it would be profitable but he still continues to offer his merchandise from door to door. Also they mention that they have a bar to earn an extra income for the family. The two businesses that they have are very important to him but he feels that the clothing sales business generates more income, and for this reason he will supply himself with more clothing. Jorge is a man who brings order to his communal bank. With the 1000 neuvos soles he will purchase more articles of clothing to supply his business.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Bohchuluun

texts.en: Bohchuluun is 51 years old and lives with his wife and four children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His oldest son is a student, and the younger three attend secondary school. He manages a meat-trading business in his town with the help of his wife. He started his business in 1990 and gained much experience. In addition, he works as a guard at a public organization in order to supplement his earnings. He is a responsible businessman. He is requesting a 1,500,000-Mongolian-togrog (MNT) loan to purchase meat for his business.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Dolgor

texts.en:
Dolgor is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in a house in Hovd province of Mongolia. Her older daughter is a student while her husband works as a construction worker at a private company. 

Dolgor manages a fruit trading business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2000 and is planning to continue it in the future. With her business earnings, she has been able to buy land where she is planning to build a house, in the future. She is a polite woman who attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase fruits for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits.
